We had reservations but arrived early and had time to order a drink at the bar. Two Moscow Mules and complimentary house made potato chips to snack on while we waited to be seated. A few sips later our table was ready. 

Once at our table, our server explained the menu and gave a bit more information to my date since it was his first time there. We both decided on the Lawry's cut and we shared the sides. Creamed corn, asparagus, mashed potatoes with gravy and creamed spinach, also each meal comes with yorkshire pudding. 

To start, they bring you the famous spinning bowl salad (appropriately named). I absolutely adore this salad and I'm not particularly a salad kinda gal. Then we ordered another round of drinks while we waited for our food. Shortly after the carver comes by with his glorious cart full of prime rib and all the fixings. You'll be asked how you prefer your prime rib. I always go with medium. My date ordered his medium well. He's not a fan of pink. Even when we went to Gordam Ramsey he ordered medium-well, he'll never learn lol.

Now back to the prime rib. Every bite is absolutely delicious. Juicy and tender, so flavorful. It literally melts in your mouth. I like to sprinkle a bit of the lawrys seasoning and just a touch of horse radish for a kick. Mmmm, perfection. After our meal was done they brought a surprise for the birthday boy. Chocolate cake with a single candle to make a wish. The look on his face was priceless. 

The overall dining experience is as good as it gets. From the bartender to our hostess and not to mention our server. She was very attentive and made sure we were on schedule for the show we had tickets for right after. Can't wait to visit again. Until then I'll be dreaming of prime rib & yorkshire pudding. 

Misc tips: Always make reservations and if you're up for the challenge, you can find all their recipes on their website. I've tried it, they really taste like the real deal. ; )

I do not usually give bad reviews, but after2 disappointing experiences as a long term regular I must express. My great disappointment.

First the prime rib was mediocre.  It was tough and poor in flavor.
The portion was virtually half of what it used to be.

The service usually excellent was poor bordering on rude.

My dinner was served with a side of spinach not the corn I ordered.
When I informed the waiter he ignored me.

One of the ladies requested extra hot fudge with her Sunday and was told no..  the description in the menu described the sunday as topped with toasted almonds It was served with peanuts.

An expensive special birthday dinner was a total bust

ONE OF MY FAVORITE SPOTS APPEARS TO HAVE BECOME A TOURIST TRAP LIVING OFF ITS PAST GLORY.

Solid 5 star experience every time we go. We go about every other month. We are part of their VIP plan. It is a wonderful program that I absolutely recommend. It was $25 at the time we signed up and they send you a $25 certificate to come back. You get points for the money you spend and get gift certificates when you spend a certain amount. They also send you gifts for your birthday and anniversary.

The experience from the time we walk in is top notch. The hostesses are great, they remember us even if it has been three months since we've been there.

We always have a pre-dinner cocktail or two at the bar with Bruce. He is a great bar tender, very friendly, and very easy on the eyes ladies...(and gentlemen)! Their chips are yummy.

Dinner - we always request the same server (Jesus). They always try their best to seat us with him, we love catching up with him. If we can't sit in his section we still have a great experience. Prime Rib, Yorkshire pudding, the spinning salad, mashed potatoes...YUM. Everything is included with your Prime Rib and there is no need to get additional sides or appetizers. That said, we've had all the sides and a few of the appetizers and they are all great. We always finish with the glorious Sticky Toffee Pudding. I drool just thinking about it. It was better before the new chef took over a year or so ago but it is still super yummy. They used to serve it with Praline ice cream and a heavy whipping cream whipped cream almost buttercream like. Now it's just vanilla ice cream and a lite whipped cream.

It's always fun going when the carolers are there. It gives you the Christmas holiday warm and fuzzies. 

I recommend going in small groups 2-4, 6 tops. Now they do a great job with groups. In my opinion it's just a better experience in smaller groups. They cut your prime rib and the table so it's nice when you can all eat at the same time.

PRIME RIB HEAVEN.

We made same day reservations for a late evening dinner for the occasion of my hubbys bday. The hostesses were very sweet especially this elderly lady who adored my daughter. She was soooo cute I wish I caught her name to thank her for being so sweet.

Our server named Ellen was soooooo wonderful!!!! I loveeeed her. She was the nicest server ever. 

Our food was absolutely fantastic!!! We both ordered prime rib with mashed potatoes. And our baby girl had mac & cheese with a side of spinach and fruit. 

We got a small chocolate cake for my hubbys bday and the kids meal came with vanilla ice cream. We didn't get a chance to finish dessert because we were so full but both were delicious!!

I had such a wonderful time here. Being from the Bay Area and used to The House of Prime Rib, this place was just as amazing. I love the atmosphere and all of the people working were fantastic! 

THANK YOU ELLEN FOR BEING SUCH AN ANGEL!

This is a classic indulgent dinner. Lawry's only serves a handful of items and most of them are traditional. They seldom offer any "fusion" dishes and I find that refreshing. 

The main attraction is of course the prime rib and they do a an exceptionally good job with it.   We prefer the English Cut because the slices of prime rib are nice and thin. Their salad and sides are also very good. And, their Yorkshire pudding is good, bready compliment that is good for soaking up the gravy and au jus.

 As a side note, the art deco style of the Las Vegas location is fun if not a bit quirky. I prefer the Beverly Hills location with what I like to call the pilgrim decor. There is something very old school about that I just love.

We made it a point to come here for dinner when we were on our Vegas trip because we had seen this place on travel channel :} It is a fancy fine dining place but we did see several touristy people in regular shorts & t-shirt. But I would recommend dressing nice! We had a reservation for 8:00 but got there early, around 7:20. The waiting area is nicely furnished with several comfortable couches & chairs so the wait was fine. We were seated promptly at 8 on the dot. The guy who seated us was great, very friendly and asked us where we were from, etc. Also, it's cool how they pull out the table to seat you :P 

Our waitress was fantastic, super enthusiastic, friendly, and nice :) the sourdough bread & butter they give you is yummy & fresh, generous portion too. Food did not take long at all to come even though it was packed! The bf & I got prime rib of course! It comes with their signature spinning bowl salad, which was really cool. They mix it right at your table in a big bowl. The salad was fresh and crisp, and the croutons and dressing were yummy! Also a very generous portion. I definitely couldn't finish it all.

The prime rib also comes with mashed potatoes w/ gravy and yorkshire pudding. Both delicious!! I had the English Cut prime rib which is 3 thin slices (6.5 oz for $39). The bf had the beef bowl cut (biggest cut - 22 oz for $58). We also had sides of creamed spinach & corn ($6 ea) and caramelized onions ($2 - realllyyy good!), and the bf also had a lobster tail (I think it was $12) - he said this was the best lobster he has ever had. It's awesome how they carve the prime rib right in front of your table. Even the carver guy was super nice. This dinner was for our anniversary so everyone made it a point to tell us happy anniversary, which I thought was really nice :)

The prime rib was good, but not the best I've had. I got mine medium well, but it was still on the tough side. Because of the price, I had expected it to be melt-in-your-mouth-good prime rib -- My favorite prime rib everrr was from Cattle Company Steakhouse on Oahu. So sorry Lawry's, but the prime rib I got didn't beat theirs! :P That's why I took off one star. 

Overall I think you are definitely paying for the dining experience here. The service is outstanding and this was definitely THE BEST restaurant experience I have EVER had, hands down. It is pricey but you will not leave disappointed because they take care of you so well here. We even got a complimentary dessert for our anniversary! It was awesome :) Even though it is expensive, I would definitely come back here just for the experience.

If you love prime rib this is the place to be.  Top notch service, elegant setting and the food (which mostly consist of prime rib) is sooo good!  They wheel a silver cart up to your table and you choice your done-ness, cut and sides, fyi the cream spinach is out of this world good.  If I could have brought some home to Hawaii I would have it's that good.
Lawry's still the best prime rib restaurant of any.  Have decided only to eat Prime Rib at Lawry's.  consistently delicious and great service.  When in Vegas a must go to place.
Lawry's restaurant brand make probably the best prime rib that I have experience.  Quality meat and service along with the price tag.

Not a huge prime rib fan but boy do I LOVE Lawrys! The service was amazing, the food was spectacular, best prime rib I have ever eaten. Even the bread they give you is great dipped in the prime rib sauce! Definitely worth it!
Highway robbery on gift cards, Don't ever but them or give them, the expire.  Just tried to use $100 gift card on $700 meal, gif6 cards expired!  Never going back!!!

Lawry's was pretty good...our server was very engaged and the food was good. We had to ask about the history of the server uniforms, cause they were a little odd, but we did get a great history lesson. 

I ordered the California cut prime rib dinner and it was just enough for me. It came with mashed potatoes, Yorkshire pudding, and creamed spinach.  The salad served at the beginning of the meal could have been seasoned a little better, considering this is Lawry's, but overal good food, good service, good night!

Nice Place, Staff are nice but the cuts of meat that we had were not great at all. The cook must have had a bad nite cause our and even the couple next to us said that we would not be back again and we live here in Vegas. Well on to the next steak house.

I usually  don't write reviews but I was very disappointed at the food that I had to share with my fellow yelpers. I got the prime rib and mash potatoes. There wasn't nothing special at all. The price was too expensive and Truthfully I didn't even want to finish my meal. My fiancé got the lobster tail and the filet, and that was the most dry filet we ever had. Was surely not worth $70 for that plate. The ambiance was not worth the price either. The waitresses were dressed in old school outdated weirdo outfits  and you could just tell they didn't want to wait there.    We were offered a free desert but it was called lemon butt cake, (what an awful name) . The best part of the experience was taking the leftovers we had and giving it to a homeless man, seeing his smile was priceless, so I guess the $178 dollars I spent for my girl and i was worth it.

This was one of the nicest meals I've had the prime rib is great they carve it in front of you (kinda cool) you also get the famous spinning bowl salad also cool to watch,everything was great and the food was superb they do have a dress code so no shorts or shirts. The bartender was extremely knowledgable on the local beers which is a plus!
Extremely rude, couldn't keep a reservation on time and when requesting an update it was like I was an inconvenience. Won't come back
I remember how wonderful the food, service, ambience was in Beverly Hills, Ca. I'll have to try Lawry's here in Las Vegas. I hope it's just as great.

First time ever at Lawry's in Vegas. Small place, more intimate. Same concept, food still delicious, great service. I had a great time. If you havent been to Lawry's Vegas, its worth checking it out. Imagine walking from your Hotel on the strip to Lawry's? Too bad its far away from the strip.

This is my first time to Lawry's in Vegas and for lunch. My previous experience was in Beverly Hills for dinner. Both times, I've had a great experience. I highly recommend coming here! 

The decor here is nice and elegant. Great service. Made a reservation for lunch, came in, and was quickly seated. 

Our party of 3 ordered the Lawry's cut prime rib with mashed potatoes, Yorkshire pudding and creamed corn, 1 lunch special of BBQ beef sandwich with spinning bowl salad, and 1 prime rib sandwich. 

Instead of a meat cart brought to your table during dinner time, you take your order up to the carver's station. The carver for our prime rib is such a nice guy. He was efficient with the knives and also super friendly. 

Our lunch was amazing. The prime rib is tender and flavorful. Mashed potatoes and creamed corn is as good as I remembered. The BBQ beef sandwich is really tasty. It is nice and tender, has just the right amount of bbq sauce and wasn't salty at all. This is the first time I've tried their sandwiches. They are really good. 

Service is good, our server is very friendly but seemed a bit overwhelmed and busy.

Would I come here again? Heck yeah!

Went here on Saturday night, 9:00pm, 11/16/13.  As I was in-town on business, I was alone.  There was plenty of parking for my double-cab, 8' bed, full sized truck.  Walked right in and had a table in 3 minutes.  Ambience is slightly upscale.  The men were dressed like you'd expect in the main dining room of a cruise ship.  The waitresses looked matronly, primarily because of their matronly uniform.  I guess the costume is some sort of a maid's uniform, which included a white cap.  I did not laugh to myself because they, and the rest of the establishment was indeed fairly classy.  No teenagers worked here. 

 I had a salad, med-rare prime rib, creamed corn, spinach, and  Yorkshire pudding.  Yorkshire pudding is a special bread that you dip your remaining au-juice and other juices off your plate with.  The salad came with a house dressing that seemed to be a mixture of catalina/tomato and french.   The dressing was light and not very thick at all.  The waiter did NOT ask me what kind of dressing I want, so that might be all there was.  but it was sooooo good!  The dinner also  came with sourdough bread and butter.  Don't let the name "creamed corn" turn you off.  It's not the stuff you pour out of a can at home.  It really is very good.  Although the prim rib itself is very, very good, it really is no better than places such as The Outback and Texas Roadhouse.  So go for the ambience, or spinach, creamed corn.  If not, go somewhere cheaper.   

Because of the ambience, creamed corn and spinach, I will be back!  (For sure.)

I go to Lawry's very often and it's one of my favorite places for either prime rib or a great ribeye steak! The spinning bowl salads are outstanding!! You cannot go wrong here when it comes to prime rib or ribeyes. They have great shrimp cocktails, especially with a martini and prime rib olives. The staff is always friendly and accommodating!

My first experience at a prime rib house, and it was amazing! We hopped into a cab from the strip and popped in for lunch with no reservations. Nearly the first ones there, we were seated immediately. The service is impeccable and not at all pretentious. 

The Old Fashioned was so delicious and made with love that I decided to partake in two.

I enjoyed a well-done luncheon cut, while my husband indulged with lobster and a much larger cut of prime rib. He claimed it was the best lobster he's ever had. We could cut both of our entrees with a butter knife- it was so tender and delicious.

There is something quite special about the croutons in the spinning salad- they don't get soggy! 

Overall, the quality and service are just incredible. We're already making plans to return.

It was all so filling, that we decided against dessert. On our way out, the hostess asked if she could call a return taxi for us, but we elected to walk and burn it off. It really is just a quick walk from the strip.

What a special night for us. We went here to celebrate  a special occasion.  The food and atmosphere is amazing.  We were seated at a cute domed booth.  The cranberry-orange mojito was a nice holiday drink.  The waiter was knowledgeable, attentive, and helpful.  The spinning salad was cute, they spin the salad in a bowl over ice as they pour the dressing.  The prime rib is brought to you table side in these huge silver meat cooker/warmers.  You pick your cut and rareness from this cooker.  It came with Yorkshire pudding, and vegetable. The month of December they have carolers that roam the restaurant, and will come table side also to sing you a Christmas carol.  They say proper dress code is required, but looks like they forgo this to some extent. It is a bit pricey but glad we had this experience.

Great service, very classy.  Prime rib was perfect, tender and tasty but what took my husband and I over the edge and into absolute taste ecstasy was their key lime pie!!  Couldn't keep a smile off my face while savoring every bite!!

Spinning Salad: This was surprisingly good. I'm just glad they didn't put any cheese on it! Very fresh-tasting. The spinning thing was gimmicky though.

Jim Brady Prime Rib cut: a good portion if you're hungry. I got medium rare. It was juicy and flavorful. Not a lot of blood.

Creamed Corn: I ate this cause it was highly recommended. Although I got a stomach ache (dairy, not quality), I don't regret it!!

Old Fashioned: This was not made well. It tasted way too sweet and the proportions were way off!

Service: Nothing stellar but we had a group of 20 so this is understandable.

Overall, I see why this place is popular. Does the price justify their food? Sort of....but everything tastes good.

Tip: I heard the rib eye tastes excellent for those who are not too fond with prime rib!

Great service throughout the entire meal. Love the sourdough and the salad. The prime rib was the best i have had so far.
Pricey, but definitely worth it.

Okay, so I came here for with my buddy during a night in Vegas and although the steak and service was awesome, it didn't have the two guys hanging out type of atmosphere. The place was very exquisite and felt very posh, but at the same time seemed more of a "date" or anniversary or even a milestone birthday sort of a vibe. Not a place for two guys to just chow down on some fresh beef, killing a few pitchers of beer and laughing it up. 

We had reservations so we waited less than 5 minutes while they made sure our table was properly ready. The dining room is a very tall one story high volume (at least 25' high) area with crown molding and soft lighting everywhere. When they sat us in our high backed curved booth, they literally pulled the table out so we could be seated and then pushed the table back in. Once they knew we were going to have prime rib and steak (as if we came here for a salad), they brought out this huge rolling cart that was domed. Under the dome was a mountain of actual various choices of meat that we could get. My prime rib looked succulent and ready to jump in my belly; my bros steak had just the right amount of marbling for that juicy taste. They tagged the pieces we selected and rolled the cart away towards the kitchen. When the steaks came out, the tender meat seemed to jump onto my fork and just melt in my mouth. I've been to other steak houses and this was one of the best pieces of meat I've had (outside of Texas). The sides were awesome as well; the potatoes, the mac n cheese, the creamed spinach, the bread ... all great. And the drinks were great too; we had a few beers as well as a couple glasses of scotch and finished off with a simple rum and coke. 

Overall, the food and service were outstanding but it was the more formal atmosphere that kept the dining experience from falling off the charts.

Can prime rib get any better?  Only at Lawry's...  4 Stars for prime rib.

On our last trip to Las Vegas the wife and I decided to try a real prime rib restaurant since I'm a big fan of steaks and prime rib.  From reading previous reviews I had high expectations for the service and quality of the prime rib.  I was NOT disappointed!

The ambiance of the restaurant is spot on and the service was excellent.  When they seat you they pull the table out so you don't have to squeeze and slide into your booth.  Now that's service...

We ordered the famous spinning salad which was prepared table side.  Now the star attraction...  The shiny chrome prime rib cart came around and as the gentlemen opened the cover to reveal prime rib paradise.  I couldn't resist, I wanted to order the biggest thickest cut they had.  Reality and wife kicked in and I settled for a 16oz cut, mash potatoes and sauteed mushrooms.  The taste and quality of the meat was excellent.

Before we left I had to take a picture of my prime rib cart pushing hero.  He was nice and even did the hands on the hip pose with the cart cover open.  That was worth the extra 1 star!

I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Las Vegas!

I love love love this place!! Definitely not somewhere your going to go all the time.. but what a treat. I love the spinning salad and I love how the prime rib comes in a cart to your table. I love coming here during the holidays to listen to the Carolers. So fun! You need to be a little dressed up for this place, but it's all worth it! One of my favorite restaurants.. My grandma and I would come here.. so very special.

This place serves the best Prime Rib I have had anywhere bar none.
Located a bit off the strip this place gets overlooked but boy its worth a 10-15 min walk I took to come here. 
I didn't have any reservations and had to wait in the bar area for a bit nevertheless I enjoyed one of the better martinis in the city. The main dinning area is old school with service to match (it reminded me of the bygone era of fine dinning shown in Mad Men). Though its Las Vegas and I saw people in casual clothes I would recommend dressing up when coming here. 
Service was immaculate from start to finish. I ordered a shrimp cocktail for starters  which was served nicely chilled. The cocktail sauce was OK and the shrimp were large but run of the mill stuff. 
For the main I went with the Lawry's cut of Prime Rib and ordered it rare.
Salad was done table side an ode to old school fine dining. I am not much of a salad eater but this one was good and consisted of Crisp romaine and iceberg lettuce, baby spinach, shredded beets, chopped eggs and croutons, tossed with their Vintage Dressing.
Next came the main event a nice rolling trolley  with huge chunks of Prime Rib was brought table side and the meat was carved to my liking by an expert chef.  The main's come with an unlimited supply of Yorkshire pudding (very good) Mashed potatoes (OK) jus sauce (memorable) and Whipped cream horseradish but beef is the star attraction here. It is amazing how good the prime rib is and it is cooked to perfection. My cut was perfectly pink all around with a good meat to fat ratio. The crust was seasoned well and gave a nice contrast. I ordered some cream corn and mushrooms which were good as well but I don't think were needed as the main serving was generous. 
I wanted to try some desserts but I was full.
I must mention again how good the service was, my needs were anticipated and the servers would disappear after picking up stuff and refilling wine and water and not even once I had to look for them. 
Wine selection is extensive though I didn't explore it much and stuck to a Cabernet.
There you have it folks Las Vegas the way it was envisioned initially!
4.5 Stars!

Lawry's is hands down the best place to go for prime rib!  The atmosphere is awesome.  The service, just as good.  They say, "you get what you pay for" and this is no exception.  The best prime rib comes with a prime price tag.  However, in this case, I would be more than willing to splurge.  It is that good.  They have different cuts of meat which just means they have differnent sizes.  I got the Lawry's cut which is a step below the Jim Brady cut.  The Jim Brady cut is the biggest and it's huge.  I don't know how one person could eat that by him/herself.  The meal comes with Salad (which is freshly spun at your table), Yorkshire pudding, mashed potatoes, and some awesome whipped horseradish.  They have other sides too, but I don't know where you're going to fit it.  For dessert, I had a nap.

Not for everyone, probably more so for the less picky crowd. The service was excellent, and the prices are a little less than other places like it. The spun salad had egg, and the dressing was similar to in n out spread to me. I didn't really enjoy it to be honest. Next, I'm not sure if I just don't like prime rib as much as other cuts, but this just wasn't as tasty as other steakhouses for me :( the mashed potatoes were pretty good, and the creme brûlée was excellent. It was torched to a perfect crisp. Not sure if I would return, I think I'm more of a filet mignon girl.
Always a treat.  A classy place with excellent food.  I was not a prime rib person until going to Lowry's.  Their lobster tails are to die for.   A must try.

Lawry's is a super awesome prime rib mecca in Las Vegas, and after living here over 10 years, I was finally able to see what all the fuss is about last Friday. It is about a LOT!

We took advantage of their April email deal ... Dinner for two for $99, which includes their usual spinning salad, prime rib (only 8 oz.) with all the usual sides, a bottle of their house wine, and even little chocolate sundae's and coffee at the end.

Things that blew me away that usually don't:

1. Sourdough bread to start. Sure, its just sourdough bread, but at Lawry's they serve it warm, fresh and with ramekins of fresh buttah. Oh yeah.
2. Yorkshire pudding.  Cooked perfectly, fun to eat, and the perfect leftover gravy/au jus vehicle. Dayaaaam!
3. Creamed corn.  Most steakhouses serve adequate creamed corn, but Lawry's creamed corn was spot on, yellow nibblets of utter deliciousity. So fresh tasting and each kernal popped in my mouth just right. Wow. Good stuff you guys.
4. Coffee.  Don't you love it when they serve you coffee in those mini silver coffee pots? I DO!  And the coffee I ordered to go with my dessert was super fresh tasting, smooth, and truly satisfying.

One other detail that impressed me, was the fact that they have a sign in the reception area politely asking men to remove their hats while in the dining room.  I loved that.   Since I am enjoying the 2nd half of my 1st century here on earth (i.e., I am OLD), I remember when it was considered bad manners for men to wear hats indoors. These days in Vegas, you see that etiquette rule disregarded right and left and it kind of makes me cringe.  So it was really nice to find a restaurant that values old-fashioned GOOD MANNERS such as this one.

Thank you, Lawry's for making an awesome first impression on this meat-lovin' momma!

One of my all time Favorites! I've been here quite a number of times including the one in Beverly Hills. 

The 'Spinning Bowl Salad' is one of the best salads I've ever had, their house dressing is exceptional. 

I always order the 'Lawry Cut' cooked medium-medium well and ask for bone-in (it just seems to have a bit more flavor, not that it needs anymore). The prime is fork tender, juicy and just right. 

For the sides, I love the creamed corn (melts in your mouth) and  the mashed potatoes (so creamy good). The Yorkshire pudding just soaks up some of the savory au jus sitting on the bottom of the plate and occsionally taking pieces off in between bites of the prime just compliments it greatly. I also want to mention that adding a bit of their mild horseradish condiment with the prime brings a another layer of creamy flavor that I must say is beyond delicious!

In regards to the ambiance, the place resembles an extra large dining area of a mansion with servers dressed in maid outfits standing by at your service.

Prime rib sandwiches at its best!! And Monday's they offer a $10 special on an amazing Prime Rib sandwich meal. This comes with all you can eat homemade chips that are probably some of the best chips I've ever had. You get to choose the kind of bread you like. ( I always get it with an onion roll) It also includes a salad bar that has fruits, pasta salad, potato salad, and other side salads. There you can also find all the fixings to build your sandwich. I don't know about dinner  but lunch is awesome! I work right next door so you might catch me there on my lunch hour!

I've been here at least half-a-dozen times. Each time, I have ordered the 12 oz. prime rib which is more than adequate considering all of the scrumptious side dishes that you will order. I've never figured out the purpose of the Yorkshire Pudding but I guess that may be a European-thing. Anyway, the service is always above-par. The price tag is high so beware.

Another traditional meal on our trips to vegas.  We ate here after ziplining on fremont st.

Went with the California cut as portions can become overwhelming.  Service was amazing as usual with drinks being refilled without needing to ask.

Creamed corn was amazing.  Still not a huge fan of their bread pudding, but it was better this time around.  Prime rib cooked to perfection and 2 horseradish sauces to enhance the flavor.

There is never enough room for dessert unless u have a tapeworm working OT.

I really enjoy Lawry's. Even though I live within 10 miles of one, I generally go to the one in Las Vegas when I'm there. The food is always consistently great and the staff is always friendly. 

I'd like to say I get the Beef-Bowl Cut, but I'll be honest, the California Cut with Sides is enough to satisfy me and leave a little room for dessert.
Terrible assistant manager, failed to bring included item with meals and he was rude beyond belief!

I'm not generally a meat eater but eat meat from time to time. First,the salad. I read so much about the salad. I was really looking forward to it. My salad did not seem as fresh as it should have been. I can't be certain but it looked like older lettuce. Now the meat. Very impressed that they cut the meat right in front of you. You tell them what cut and how you like it cooked very nice. The prime rib was excellent. Service was very good. Frequent refills on water - I never had an empty glass where I had to find someone to fill. Also the booth was very nice. It was semi circular comfortable booth with lots of space for four. The hostess pulled the table out to make getting in easier. Overall a very nice place. But I think this was a little pricey.

I usually eat here at least once a month, it is so good, the ambiance and cleanliness, friendly people. I have enjoyed, Prime Rib, um-mm the best, Salmon Steak, vegetable plate. All three course meals the deserts are also very good. You cannot go wrong. It is a great place to hold a business meeting as well.

Our first time at Lawry's The Prime Rib.

If you've never been here's a secret: Get off the strip and go for lunch! You'll get an abridged version of the dinner experience for a fraction of the price.

Three of us decided that this would be better than a lunch buffet and we were looking forward to trying here after we'd been to Gallagher's for dinner on Sunday night.

First: The dress code does not apply during the lunch service but it is "upscale" so at least aim to wear a clean t-shirt. I wore a tank top and really felt severely underdressed for the lunch service. My Bad.

Second: Skip a salad and go for an appetizer. We ordered the fresh heirloom tomato and Mozzarella. It came drizzled with olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette. The Mozzarella was fresh and salty contrasting greatly with the sweet of the tomato and the balsamic. It was perfect to split between the three of us.

Third: Instead of the cart coming to you, you go to the cart! You approach the carver and inform him of what you would like.

We all ordered the luncheon cut (for smaller appetites). The creamed spinach was great and so was the creamed the corn-- It was all perfect. A few lumps in my mashed potatoes but I like mine lumpy so no complaints here. The gravy was smooth and tasted great. The aus jus was served directly over the prime rib, no cups or saucers here. Plus you get a nice, light and crispy Yorkshire pudding as well instead of a dense yeasty roll.

The prime rib itself was ordered medium-rare and everyone got a piece that was perfect. They give you butter knives because the prime rib is not tough and does truly almost cut like butter. You don't really need anything else to go with it. Just the juice and aus jus. I used only a small helping of the horseradish just for taste. They bring two kinds of horseradish. Spicy and Whipped. I wasn't a fan of the whipped as it wasn't spicy enough for me but the spicy was as perfect as it gets.

Additionally we were celebrating an anniversary and a birthday and were surprised with a small bundt spice cake with apple marmalade, creme fraiche, and raspberry drizzle with a candle. Somehow the three of us plowed through these two delicious desserts. I absolutely thought the apple marmalade was to die for and along with the spice cake, this was a fine dessert.

Definitely DO take the time to go off strip and go here!

Take the Deuce or SDX and get off at the Caesars/Flamingo/Harrahs. Walk down to Flamingo street and head Eastbound. There will be a bus stop on the south side of the street, east of the pedestrian bridge. Hop on the 202 and then Get off at Flamingo & Koval or Flamingo & Tuscany and it's a short walk to Lawry's The Prime Rib.

The most noticeable feature of this restaurant is the service. It is impeccable.  Not too sure about the pilgrim outfits that they make their waitresses wear but I can look past that. The food is good but fair warning, it is extremely rich, buttery and decadent. I suppose it's not every day that you dine at a place like this so my arteries will forgive me this once for my meal. It's fine dining so the pace is leisurely but the timing of the dishes arriving didn't leave me starving. Had a lovely meal but it definitely impacts the wallet.

I came here on a Friday night, not a lot of people.
Restaurant is very roomy, good for large parties 
Their food is very delicious, prime rib is very juicy and tasty, portion is also very large, I cannot finish my food
The only con is their location
They are now located at the strip, you will have to drive to their place, but they did have a very big private parking lot

SO I went off season ie cold out and this is just like the old school version in Chicago. I like the old school waitress who has worked there like 30 years and knows her stuff. prime rib is expenive-ish but big and sides are big and good. these folks know how to do a prime rib and at temp you order it. enjoyable whiel not super trendy nor super trendy prices eh. all things considered. id hit this gain. hell yah.

Everytime we come to Las Vegas we always go to Lawrys for dinner. The Lawrys experience is decadent and exceptional. The most delicious prime rib I have ever had and the creamed spinach, spinning salad, and mashed potatoes are divine! The service is excellent. They make sure you are extremely comfortable and your every need is met. The ambiance, food, drinks, and service are absolutely exceptional and pure excellence. If I could give 6 stars I would. Lawrys is an absolute must if you want  5 star prime rib in Vegas. I also think it is better than the Beverly Hills location. Love Lawrys!!!!!!

It is, after all, Lawry's! I try to go to the original in LA at least once every two months, with a close friend of mine. It's a guy thing. I also go to the Tam-O- Shanter right in front of my apartment on Los Feliz. For any meat eater, it's a must! I have reservations for Sunday in Las Vegas with my brother, YAY!

This is a must stop every time we go to Vegas for our boy's weekend out getaways for golf, gambling, and glutony.

Lawry's Vegas easily has the best prime rib I've ever had (and trust me, I've had lots).  I've also found that the Vegas Lawry's is much better and more consistent compared to the LA one (the original Lawry's).

Great service from the moment you pull up and hand you keys to the valet.  They always treat us like royalty even though many times we're stanky from a couple rounds of golf or are hauling around a drunk bachelor dressed as Elvis (complete with painted on sideburns).

We do however have some rules of etiquette when we go to Lawry's.  

1. EVERYONE must get the Bowl cut (all 32 boneless ounces of it)
2. NO ONE is allowed to order it cooked more than Med-Rare
3. ANYONE that doesn't finish it pays for everyone else's meal

This review is for the A Christmas Carol Dinner show that Lawry's is sponsoring during the holidays.  Our family attended this event on Dec 17th and we were all extremely disappointed.  The service was terrible, the production was mediocre at best and it was not worth the price that we were charged. I would not recommend this dinner show at all.  It would be more enjoyable to just pay for a nice dinner in the main dining room.

This is prime rib done at its best! Your dining experience begins with the prompt valet service at the front of the restaurant. The host at the front desk seemed to be helping a new employee get comfortable and acquainted with all the tricks of the trade. A hostess led us to our table and pulled the table out so we could get into the booth comfortably. It's the little things. Our waiter introduced himself and brought us our drinks.  The dinner started with their popular spinning salad bowl. He recommended the house seasoned pepper on our table, which we loved. Then the prime rib cart rolled up to our table.  After serving all of us, depending on our requested cuts, they brought out two kinds of horseradish and Yorkshire pudding. The pudding is an egg bread primarily good for soaking up the au jus on the plate. Delicious! Finally dessert and coffee to round out a perfect meal in an ambience of friendly refinement. 
Special thank you to Mr.Ball, our waiter, who kept the drinks constantly filled and was the picture of professionalism and deft. Looking forward to visiting again soon!

Went here for the first time last night... The best calamari , prime rib California cut, mash potatoes, the best salad ever!!!! Nice and clean place to eat... Employees are all so professional... I love that there is a dress code here... Gentlemen must remove hats... Ill definitely be back & will definitely recommend this place to family & friends!!!

This is sentimentally my favorite restaurant ever as I grew up going to the flagship in Beverly Hills. Not much has changed after going to the Vegas location. That's a good thing.

The ambiance is Old Hollywood. I got a cherry mash Old Fashioned in the cocktail room, and it was fantastic. The soda water is an unusual ingredient but adds more depth to the flavor profile. Overall, the drink is worth it's price.

For dinner, I would never consider anything but the prime rib. I got the Diamond Jim Brady with mashed potatoes, creamed corn and Yorkshire pudding with a salad serving as the starter.

Salad: Light and satisfying, helped by the beets and croutons.
Prime rib: Incredible. Delectable. Cooked to perfection (I had the cut medium rare).
Mashed potatoes: Perfectly creamy. I wish the gravy served with it was lighter, more like an au jus.
Creamed corn: Wonderfully sweet. The corn tasted like it could've been cooked longer.
Yorkshire pudding. Always great and best when dipped in the natural juices of the prime rib.

I love the experience here and am always grateful when I can attend.

Miss O'Brian is the best. She served us with grace, good humor, and helpful advice. I had the petite filet, but the others in my party enjoyed the prime rib. Mashed with horseradish was genius. Thanks, again, Miss O'Brian!

Meat lovers rejoice. This was the best prime rib I've ever had and the dining experience was incredible. The bread they started off with was perfect and we got creamed corn and asparagus as appetizers. The creamed corn was very good and very rich. The appetizers were amazingly fresh and buttery. For an entree I got the  the "Beef Bowl Cut" of prime rib which is their largest cut. If they would have had a larger size I would have gotten that. The beef is cut right in front of you and the meat is so juicy and succulent it's making me hungry thinking about it. The beef is perfectly seasoned and melts in your mouth. You almost don't have to chew it. I loved this place.

So there was a group of 8 of us ready to eat the heart attack on a plate that is prime rib, mash potatoes w/ gravy, creamed spinach and Yorkshire pudding made w/ pan drippings. YUMMY! We all brought a few bottles of special wine ($15 corking fee per bottle). Not to say their wine list is off but it's not the best in my opinion. 

Our waitress was funny, attentive and a very good sport considering we were throwing down some serious wine. We all had the prime rib, of course. WHO in their right mind would get anything else? The spinning salad served prior to dinner is made table side and it never disappoints. I HATE BEETS but why do I love them in this salad? I will have to explore that at a later time. 

Anyway, as expected, food was fab, service even better and they sang me a little song for my birthday and brought me a nice piece of cake. 

I am a big fan of this place and I even steal the recipes from their website to make my own creamed spinach, creamed horseradish and prime rib. Mine MIGHT be better! Bobby Flay Throwdown?!? Perhaps! Lawry's...ring me up and let's do this!
Great food, had an amazing meal here! As good as it gets ! Try the Fiat martini... Best drink I've had in a long time!!!!

Must taste this food!!! The best prime rib in town!  When you order just order the California cut and don't order an appetizer because you will be super full!   For drinks if you are sick order the hot wisely tea with honey(server will know).  At least try the sautéed mushrooms!
Prime rib was great... I had the rib eye seasoned to perfection. I couldn't get enough of the cream corn..  Lobster tail was cooked to perfection.. Not too rubbery..

The food of course was sensational, as always, but when I went here a couple weeks ago it was the service that really caught my attention.  We had show tickets and since they sat us late we were really concerned about missing the show.  But they sped up what is normally more of a "dining experience" into a pre-show meal, boxed up our leftovers, and we somehow made it on time to the show.  What more can I say?

You are better off at Lawry's in another location.  Service from some staff seem very nonchalant.  Just whole atmosphere seems very off compared to other locations.  Some races more welcomed than others.  It was a rare experience l don't want to repeat.

Came here for take-out. You might be asking..Lawry's does takeout?? YES. I've been to the Beverly Hills location many times, so I was excited to try the Vegas one but didn't want to dress up. We ordered over the phone in advance, and they cut the meat when we got there so it'd stay juicy. This location only has potato chips and does not have meatballs in the waiting area FYI, so I took a star off.  The prime rib was delicious as usual and we got creamed corn & spinach which were good too. They packaged it very nicely and we were able to enjoy it in the comfort of our own home.

DH and I went for dinner last night to celebrate our anniversary.  It's not the most romantic of places, I know, but we didn't want to spend the $150 per person (or more) that all the well-rated fancy restaurants on the Strip seem determined to charge.  We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.

Lawry's is an old-fashioned sort of place.  It's not gourmet, but honest-to-goodness good food.  The service was gracious, although slow.  Seating was very comfortable.  Food was great, but we think House of Prime Rib in San Francisco still reigns supreme for this sort of dining.  
The only disappointing dish of the evening was dessert (Coconut Banana Cream Pie--skip it).  The price was right; we walked out for about $150 total.  This is one of the few meals we've had in Las Vegas where we actually felt like we got our money's worth!
had a great birthday dinner for my husband who loves prime rib ....he was very happy:)
One of my favorite in Vegas. Best Prime Rib anywhere!! Ask to be seated at Miss Pleasants table! Frank at the Bar will keep you watered until ur seated!! An unforgettable experience!!

If you love prime rib and old fashioned service, this is the place to go. We were with "meat & potatoes only" family members and so we brought them here because the menu is strong and simple; pretty much just meat & potatoes. They loved it. 

This is a great place to bring clients, or take a group of people who want a really fun & unique prime rib experience. The prime rib was melt-in-your-mouth perfection, served tableside from huge gleaming metal carts, cut and carved to order (doneness, size, etc) by servers in chefs hats, coats, and ... get this... white gloves. 

You're also personally attended by a waitress in a very unique costume; and boy does the waitstaff know their stuff. You'll not get bad service here, EVER. All orders will be perfect, all drinks will be refilled before they can even get to half empty, all your dining needs will be met with grace and style. It's awesome to watch this staff in action.

The prime rib dinner includes potatoes and their famous "spinning bowl salad." It's made tableside, too, and again, with a skill that's fun to watch. You can also choose from a few sides (baked potato, asparagus, creamed spinach, peas or corn, THAT'S IT) but be advised, those do cost $6 to $8 extra per portion (they're served from the cart, too). But since your prime rib will cost you from $35 to $55 (depending on cut), that $6 suddenly doesn't look too expensive ;) 

My uncle got the Rib Eye steak ($42 for 10oz boneless, $50 for 16 oz plus bone) it was perfectly cooked and delicious, but my feeling is $50 is a lot for a steak, even if it is a really good one. However, my uncle thought every bite was worth every penny. 

What I really appreciated was they have a few fish and vegetarian choices here, too. Three, to be exact. You can have the Fish of the Day, Lobster, or the Eggplant Lasagna. True, that's not many choices, but it might be enough to keep everyone in your group happy. 

There are two appetizers available: a jumbo shrimp cocktail ($14) and a sizzling skillet of butter & garlic mushrooms ($8) We had them both since our group was large and there was plenty to share all around. The flavors were strong, simple and good. I really, really recommend the mushrooms; the sauce is lovely for dipping bread. 

If I have a tiny complaint it's that all the food was really pushing the edge of saltiness and greasiness, but I am fully well aware that's the joy of this style of old-school cooking - there's a lot of butter and salt in everything but the water, and that's just how it is. It's something a health conscious person can overlook for one meal, but one might not want to eat here too often, simply to avoid an unexpected heart attack if nothing else. This is definitely a "special occasion place" both for the wallet and the health.

So if you find yourself in Las Vegas and you want to go have a really nice, non-casino piece of prime rib, Lawry's is your joint. Oh, and there will be a lot of Lawry's seasoning salt on the table, too. Not that you'll need it.
The best prime rib and creamed spinach I've ever had.

Attended a lunch last week and even wrote in on the Facebook Page (Lawrys) about the disappointment during lunch steak cooked improperly.  Poor Customer Service from Restaurant and Server. No response still a week later from the restaurant.  Terrible.

Have been here easily 10 times for various personal and business dinners and most recently last week for a birthday. Service and food quality has been impeccable each and every time. And I've been to probably 75% of the high end steakhouses in Vegas. It's prime rib so may not be for everyone but if that's your thing you really can't go wrong.

Had Thanksgiving dinner there with nine friends.  Have to say,  we were very disappointed.   Half the table had traditional turkey dinner,  the other half had the prime rib.   The portions were very small.  We ordered family style spinach and corn for the table,   They brought us two of each.   There was enough for one spoonful for each person.   They charged us for 4 family servings, which makes me think they might have intended to bring 4...but never did.  There was not enough bread for the entire table and the Yorkshire puddingwas cut clumsily to serve 9 very small pieces.   No au juice was offered or served.  One of my guests asked for medium rare and was served medium well. This has been a family favorite for special occasions in the past,  but will be eliminated for future holiday get togethers.  Sorry Lawyrys,  this visit was a prime disappointment. 
William Ladner

From the reviews, this restaurant should have an outstanding service. But sadly, that's not what I feel today. My customers ordered a medium rare prime rib, it came very rare.

We waited for the food for quite a long time. When we need our waitress, we could not find her. They just took away the dishes, not evening ask if we are done with the food.

Food is ok, but I don't think I will spend that much for the prime rib with the poor service again.

I ate here for the first time last weekend. 5 stars baby! Why?

- Yummy yummy salad with beets. I love beets. If I just ate the salad, I'd be happy, but this is not why I came here.

- Strong Dirty Dirty Martini. I could only take two sips. I didn't finish it, but it was one of the best martinis everRRR.

- nice high ceilings so there was good ventilation and it wasn't some dark gloomy stuffy steakhouse where you couldn't breathe. i could also see my date clearly without having a candle burning in between us. been there done that. it's creepy, not romantic.

- Waitress was the sweetest and the nicest. I liked it when her eyes bugged out when I ordered the Jim Brady cut. She asked me if I was sure. I said well I like the bone, give me the bone. She said if I wanted a lawry cut with the bone and I said fine, just as long as I get the bone, my favorite part.

- the carver gave us HUGE pieces both with bones. my date didn't even ask for the bone. i ate more than he did. yummy spicy horseradish and creamy horseradish. we were both charged the regular lawry cut price.

- spinach that tasted like bacon. woah!

conclusion: i'm a bay area native and hands down this place was BY FAR way better than house of prime rib. boo-ya!

Fan-frickin-tastic.  This is NOT a cheap place to eat.  You do have to get dressed up to get inside.  Expect to dress up like you're going to church pretty much to eat here.  The service was great.  The server explained every detail to our dining experience and how the food would be presented.  They have a full menu of wines, beers, and drinks.  As for the main entree you can order prime rib served in various ways or steak.  Salad came out first, as well as appetizers (fancy chips).  Various side orders came in such as a mushroom dish cooked sizzling, and a side of asparagus.  I got the famous Lawry's prime cut prime rib dinner.  Medium well with a side of mashed potaotes.  The prime rib was succulent and juicy and literally melted like butter upon tasting it.  That was a great tasting meal!  Worth every penny I spent here.  Expect to spend at least $50 or more here for a meal.  A true Vegas dining experience.

Best Place to eat Prime Rib hands down! The Prime Rib is so tender and flavorful. The sides are fantastic as well. Best creamed spinach ever. The yorkshire pudding  and spinning salad just put the whole dinner over the top delicious. Service has always been excellent. If your a prime rib conissour you will not be disappointed!
Just found out that Mon-Fri they serve lunch in a more casual atmosphere for half the price as dinner. SCORE!!!
However, dinner is the way to go for the special occasions. 
LOVE this place!

We would definitely go back and give it another try.  
Spinning bowl salad is Amazing! Wine selection & prices were good. 

The prime rib cart is a very unique & inviting, but the service was way, way off. 

The waiter forgot the Whipped horseradish sauce, Bernaise sauce, green peppercorn sauce & Yorkshire pudding... These items did not arrive at our table & we had to track the waiter down & request what we had ordered. 
Meat was a little over-cooked & there was no offer of bottled water. 
In spite of all that the place is lovely, the food is tasty & the waiter was pleasant. If there had been any level of service, it would be a 5 star.  The banana, coconut cream pie was very good.

Absolutely loved it. 
It was delicious and very good portions, service was excellent and staff very friendly I will definitely be back. 
Our total was $175 that included 2 entrees with a $3 sauce , 2 sides, and 3 cocktails 
We celebrated a birthday and tried the blackberry bunt cake, really good too.
The only place to go for Prime Rib. My favorite is the Diamond Jim Brady cut served RARE.

Listen, if you're looking for a nice meal at a classy place that won't break the bank, this is a solid choice for you.  Went with the wife and was very satisfied.   We both got the lawry cut and were stuffed by the end of it.  I think it was about $47 (expensive but at least it's very quality food) and it came with a salad, which I was super into.  I didn't even know I liked beets before I had them in my salad and now we are like BFF.   Actually, meat will always be my food BBF, but beets and I are cool now.   

The meal also came with mashed potatoes, which you usually have to order separately when you go to a steakhouse.   Definitely a bonus that it was included.  I asked if they had some sort of magic wand to turn my mashed potatoes into garlic mashed potatoes.  Needless to say they did, and I feel like it was a mega upgrade.  

Also shared a creamed corn with the wife.  Who knew corn could be so satisfying.  They took good care of us and we felt very welcomed and cared for.   Lawrys is gonna be a my go to for a fancy meal that I won't have to take out a second mortgage to go to.   You know how steakhouses be sometimes.

This is a lunch review. 

The Skinny: went in for lunch and it was totally good eats... Their pastrami sandwich is totally delish! (4) service: slightly disorganized in the beginning,  it got better by the end (3) value: come in for lunch... You won't regret it (4).

I have been craving a nice piece of medium rare prime rib for weeks. After incessant nagging, I finally convinced the hubs to take me to Lawry's for lunch. 

I chose lunch because the prices seemed more reasonable and they had more variety of proteins to choose from (turkey/pastrami/Roast beef). Plus when you get the prime rib plate during lunch,  you get to try the creamed spinach and corn. 

So we were seated promptly despite a large event occurring in the dining room. We showed our hostess our Lawry's VIP card. She told us to make our server knew about it so earned our points towards rewards dollars. (This was a triple point week... Score!) 

We perused our menus and were waiting for a server. We waited. And waited. All the while,  other tables were going to the prime rib bar and getting food. I finally flagged down a waiter to ask him what the deal was and to put in a drink order. 

He was surprised we didn't have a server yet but he explained that he would take our drink orders. He then told us during lunch, you line up at the prime rib bar and the carver will prepare sandwiches and prime rib plates.  If you want any other side items,  the server will take your orders. Your server will check in on you to see what you ordered from the bar and will start a check for you. 

So we immediately head to the prime rib bar with the line of people putting in their orders. 

The carver was quite efficient and we didn't wait long. 

I got the luncheon prime rib plate which comes with mashed potatoes, creamed spinach/corn (or a bit of both) and Yorkshire pudding for $24. The hubs got a pastrami sandwich for $14 which comes with choice of bread (he got rye), chips, and condiment bar. 

The hubs really loved his hand carved and trimmed pastrami sandwich. The pastrami was melt in your mouth good and the rye bread had a really perfect density to it. He thinks it may be the best pastrami he's had since Katz's deli in NYC which is saying a lot. He helped himself to the unlimited condiment bar where they had coleslaw(okay),  potato salad (okay), macaroni salad (okay),  marinated mushrooms (good), and marinated cucumber/tomatoes (good). They also had condiments as well such as slices of tomato, pickles, mustard,  etc. 

My prime rib was pretty freaking delicious. Medium rare, I wolfed down the tender meaty goodness. I opted for half creamed corn and spinach. The creamed corn was unbelievably sweet with a nice bite to eat kernel. Creamed spinach was also very tasty. In comparison the mashed potatoes were rather lackluster (texture was too homogeneous and didn't have enough butter/milk to make it luxurious). Texturally , the Yorkshire pudding was also disappointing -  tough/dense and not crispy enough. 

After we got back, our server came by and refilled our glasses of water promptly and kept them filled throughout our stay. 

Polishing off our meals,  the hubs said "I can't believe we missed out on so much for so long." Why indeed, why indeed (4 starred review)
Once you dine at Lawry's, there is no other option for prime rib. You will be spoiled and the competitors will pale in comparison.

Don't even question...go now. Food is amazing, service is impeccable, free valet this place is really top notch. Prime rib is carved table side and it's delicious. The spinning salad is so good. I cannot stress enough how wonderful this place is. They will make you feel like a VIP.

I went to Lawrys Las Vegas yesterday with my family and I've got to say, the ambience is better than Lawrys Beverly. We were greeted by great staff and our server Vanessa was an absolute delight! She checked on us regularly and recommended great entrees and dessert! She's very positive and serves customers well.  Go for their toffee dessert! It's to die for.

The ambiance of this place is great. The food was amazing. The prime rib really melts in your mouth. My favorite part from my experience at Lawry's besides eating the meat from heaven itself, was when the chef sliced the prime rib right at our table. 

Also, our server, Freddy, was super friendly and amazing. If you see this Freddy, you were awesome man.

Absolutely love love love this place! Had a lovely dinner the other night. Very friendly service. Prime Rib is AMAZING as well as the mashed potatoes, Yorkshire pudding, and other sides (my favorite is creamed corn)! Perfect for birthdays, anniversaries, and other special events!
Perfect as always. We never go to Vegas and never not stop by for dinner. You must try the creamed corn.

I have eaten at Lawrys several times and every time has been amazing! I want to point out my experience last night because it was the BEST time I've had there. Our waitress Mrs. Taylor made our experience unforgettable!! She is by far not only the best waitress I've had at Lawrys (which all have been great) but the best waitress I have ever had!!! She went above and beyond to make our experience great and because of that I had the very best piece of primerib I've had!! She knew what I wanted and made it happen!! Thank you Mrs. Taylor!!! : )

We went to Lawry's for our mini reunion.  We were seated right away and our server Mike K was awesome!  We had all different cuts of prime rib and everyone enjoyed their selection.  I thought it was a really good deal for the price.

I hadn't been to Lawry's since my las pt visit to the Beverly Hills location 15 years ago. Although I really enjoyed my visit that time, I never really think about this place when I think special occasion, since prime rib is so easy to make at home. However, this past Xmas, my wife convinced me that the little one would probably do better here than at te steakhouse I had reserved for us...so of course we ate here!

Well, she was right. The Xmas decor was quite festive, and with the unprecedented cold spell in Vegas, it really felt like Xmas. We were lucky enough to come by on a night that they had carolers! This really added to the ambience, as they were quite good and very accommodating with our requests (I seriously did not expect them to be able to sing Riu Riu Chiu!)

The food was just as good as I remembered it...the prime rib juicy and wonderfully tender. It tasted all the better because I saved twelve dollars and did not get suckered into ordering the Diamond Jim Brady cut! I remembered my buyer's remorse on my past visit when I saw that my more expensive order still resulted in the same size cut of beef as the standard Lawry's cut...I snickered as I saw this again to be the case!

Anyways, the food was wonderful, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. The only thing that kept me from giving five stars was the distracted service. Our waiter only made sporadic cameos to our table...we had to ask other servers for our missing horseradish sauce, bread, and drink refills. Nevertheless, we had a wonderful evening and lovely holiday memory. Well worth coming back for!

This was our first visit to Lawry's and boy were we impressed. It was love at first bite! From our first step into the door, the hostess's professionalism and friendly demeanor was impressive and very welcoming.  The wait time for us to be seated was minimal and the ambiance here is of classic elegance. My hubby and I decided to eat here to celebrate our wedding anniversary and they did not disappoint.  It was the perfect place to celebrate and they sure made our anniversary a memorable one!

My hubby had the Jim Brady cut and I had the Lawry cut.  We both had a side of creamed spinach along with the other accouterments (spinning salad, mashed potatoes, Yorkshire pudding). And even tho we were stuffed, we had to finish off our meal with their oh so yummy coconut banana cream pie for dessert.  Our server, was very friendly and helpful and added to the enjoyment of our evening.  This was by far the most tastiest prime rib that the both of us have ever eaten.  Both cuts are very generous in size and perfectly seasoned.  They are cooked to perfection and have a rich flavor of meatiness.  You really do not need a knife to cut your prime rib into small pieces as the meat is fork tender.  The prime rib just melts in your mouth and the flavors send you away to a heavenly bliss. And if you thought that was as high as you could be, think again, the Yorkshire pudding is to die for especially when you use it as a mop to soak up all of the juicy goodness from the prime rib.  Just blogging about this is making me salivate and want to jump on the next plane from Hawaii to Vegas to have some of this awesome goodness.  The coconut banana cream pie was gigantic and baked to perfection. Chunks of banana's are mixed together with a Bavarian cream type filling and topped with a fluffy cloud of whipped cream and sprinkled with toasted coconut flakes. The cream is smooth and perfectly sweet and the banana is plentiful and ripe. If I had to guess, I think there was at least 2 whole bananas cut up into chunks in the one slice of pie.  The crust was flaky and perfectly done.  

Our whole experience from the beginning to the end of our food high at Lawry's was awesome and addicting. Like an out of control addict, the high that this place gives us, leaves us with an uncontrollable urge and yearning to come back for more and more.  One thing is for sure, this is now our favorite restaurant to feast on  prime rib and we will definitely be back for more the next time we are in the area...that's for sure! ;-)

Wow! I've never been to a Prime Rib restaurant before. Steak? Sure, but not Prime Rib. I'm actually not that much of a meat eater but I did get the PR since this is what it's known for. It did not disappoint. The sides that it comes with (creamed spinach, creamed corn) also did not disappoint! They come around with a cart and then cook the prime rib to your tasting next to the table. Thus, the food comes out quickly. The atmosphere is fancy table cloths with large chairs. It's a quick trip off the strip and in a nice area. I recommend it.

I've only been here for lunch - three times to be precise - and I'm just not as impressed as y'all.  For lunch, they have this strange buffet service for everything except salads.  Counterintuitive, I know.  Usually they don't have anyone at the front desk to seat you, which is awkward.  Just go into the dining room and someone will figure out that you are there eventually.

If you want a sandwich, you need to get your lazy ass up, order from the guy with the chef's hat behind the sneeze guard, wait until he dishes out your food, go to another station to get your condiments, and walk your food back to your own damn table. Given the fact that the servers only have to fetch salads and drinks, you'd think the service would be excellent.  But unfortunately that's not the case.  

Drink refills tend to be hard to come by.  So much that when they drop off your drink, they'll give you a little carafe of extra soda, ice tea, whatever you ordered.  Because they ain't coming back.  If they gave you the wrong drink while you were off waiting in line for someone to make your sandwich, good luck getting it fixed.  It's also hard to get the check for some reason.  But the servers look really busy and there are a lot of them so they must be doing something.  I can never figure out what.  It's really hard to get their attention.  And never come on Administrative Assistant's Day or Bosses' Day or any of those made up holidays because it only gets worse with all the offices around this restaurant.  We loves us some fake holidays.

The sandwiches are pretty good and this is the only place in town that I know of that you can get a full turkey dinner for lunch anytime of the year.  It costs $24 but, still, it's nice to have the option.  The food is pretty decent but, in my experience, the service falls short, at least during lunch.

We had some friends in from out-of-town and took them to Lawry's for a nice dinner. Drew was our waiter and he was really great! Attentive, but not pushy and always around when we needed him. I thought the prime rib was the best I've had in town. I got the Diamond Jim cut because the cuts the other folks at the table were getting looked a little small. I'm glad I did. It was just enough, even with the sides. Their side dishes were really good, ALL of them! My wife had a smaller prime rib and she liked it. We ordered the lobster tail to each have a bit and it was not great. Chewey and overcooked. I'm taking off a star for that. We enjoyed a couple nice bottles of wine, excellent company and a great meal. We'll go back again (this week, I think) and just not order the lobster. Everything else was fantastic!

The service is fantastic.  The main selection of dinner is a prix fix menu.  They bring a cart to your table and cut your prime rib as you like right there.  There are other things from the menu you can order, the lobster is one of the best we have ever had.  This restaurant gives a nice evening out for a couple or a group.  We joined the VIP club.  So far it is paying off.

Omg!! My boyfriend and I went here for our birthday dinner and it was everything we expected and more. We got calamari, both got the Lawry cut medium and creamed spinach. It was a lot of food so I'd suggest skipping on an appetizer. We will definitely come back.

A long standing tradition of class, elegance and grace. White table cloth service, black napkin for the lady and The best PRIME RIB you can sink your well glossed lips in. This fitness enthusiast was not disappointed and very appreciative of the gong and attentiveness to my special request and service! A must eat when you are in Vegas and looking for a dinner out that will not compromise your standards or integrity. This is a true class act setting the bar high for any other Steakhouse/ Carvery in Vegas. Skip the rest and stick to the best- indulge at Lawry's and don't be swayed to try cheap and seedy restaurants at the Palms

We just had a phenomenal time!! Couldn't be more pleased with our server he was extremely helpful and more than generous. He made my friend's birthday extra special and we appreciate Mr. P sooo much! He was very attentive and patient with our group. The manager Mr. Bruce took our night to the next level and exceeded our expectations!! An experience we will never forget.
This location is also very good.  I've been to 3 locations around the nation and they've all been great.  Tbey have this prime rib thing down!
I can not express how great this place is .Are server Julie was awesome .Do not eat a special meal on the strip go too Lawry's !!!!! You will not be disappointed!!

We went here for restaurant week which had the pre fixe menu. It includes salad, entree with 2 sides, and desert with coffee or tea. 

They sat us in tiny booth which made it kind of uncomfortable to for us. We started with a glass of their Cabernet. Then they brought their famous spinning salad. The salad was ok. Then we both got the prime rib with mash potatoes and creamed spinach. My boyfriend upgraded for a bigger cut than the 8 oz. the prime rib was soooo good and tender. They also served it with Yorkshire pudding, to me it just tasted like bread. I guess it supposed to soak up the juices. The two sides were just ok, nothing really to complain about. Except I don't like that they put the sides with prime rib and au jus. Then came the dessert we both got creme brûlée with hot tea. They bring out such a cute setting for your tea and also bring you a display case for which tea you would like. The creme brûlée was a little burnt and I could've done with out the berries they put on top. 

Service was good and the prime rib  was really good.

Hands down the best prime rib I've ever had! Came here for my birthday last weekend and it was my 1st time at a Lawry's. I had heard so much about their prime rib, so as a prime rib lover I couldn't wait to check it out! We made reservations in advance but I'm not sure if it is necessary because the restaurant didn't appear full, even on a Saturday night. 

Once you are seated you are presented with a dinner menu and wine list. Once we selected our bottle of wine - Lawry's private selection Chardonnay, our waiter explained the menu and ordering process to us since it was our 1st time at Lawry's. After this, for some strange reason our menus were taken away. If you would like to add a lobster tail to your meal or any sides besides creamed corn and creamed spinach, this is when you have to place those orders.

The prime rib is brought around on carts and sliced at your table. You are asked for the cut size you'd like, along with how cooked you like it. In my opinion, for prime rib you definitely have to go medium rare. I went with the Lawry Cut which is around 10 oz. All prime rib dinners include mashed potatoes and Yorkshire pudding, which is a puffed bread and not an actual pudding as I had thought lol. 

You have the option of adding a scoop of creamed corn or creamed spinach, which were good but definitely not worth the ridiculous 7 bucks per scoop price! Now we know. Other sides come on small plates and we opted for some mushrooms which were $9. The meat was perfectly seasoned and very juicy. Usually when you have prime rib, some areas are more seasoned or dry than others...that was certainly not the case here and even the parts without fat were juicy and flavorful.

At the end of the meal, our plates were taken away and a buser came by to de-crumb our table - fancy!. This is when we were handed dessert menus. Too full to order anything and about to depart for my UYE party, I was about to decline dessert when they brought out a small cupcake sized shortcake with a single candle on top. This was a nice surprise to close out our wonderful meal. 

I will definitely be back and can't wait until next time! Before leaving the restaurant, I was already thinking when my next visit would be!

We've been coming here every time we're in Vegas & it never fails to amaze us!! The prime rib is the BEST, great sides of creamed spinach & creamed corn, a pan of popover cooked in prime rib Au jus drippings & the spinner salad for starters. We've brought our family friends & in-laws here. I'm so glad I found this place a few years ago cuz there ain't nothing like it in Hawaii.

My bf took me because Ive never had Lawry's. I must say, I was impressed with how tender the prime rib was and the professionalism of the staff. I never knew prime rib could have such texture! I also have never had cream corn before (um do you live under a rock??) and Lawry's cream corn has become the standard of cream corn in my mind now haha  

I even took my leftovers home lol and it was still so good the next day!
Omfg the lobster tails are to absolutely die for! Everyone is also so kind and accommodating! Will def be back for my to go fix!

Let me start this review with the service. We had Ms. Monroe as our server she was informative and pleasant. I mentioned it was national prime rib day and she told us because we mentioned it we would get a free prime rib upgrade. Nice. We started with the artichoke hearts fried with 2 dipping sauces. They were pretty good. Then we had the spinning salad meh it was ok. We added the Lawry's seasoned pepper as Ms.Monroe suggested. It did give it some extra flavor. The wait between courses was perfect. So I upgraded my potatoes to the special Yukon gold mash,glad I did my husband stuck with the regular mash and mine were much better. The creamed corn was the best I've ever had. The popover was also pretty good. So you may be wondering why only 3 stars? The Prime rib was pretty much the worse I have ever had and I love prime rib. Gold Coast, South point, Both have better prime rib for a lot less money. It had no flavor, we asked for medium which was blood red. So we went for medium well. Which was still pink so it should not have been like chewing on gum. Tasteless gum at that. You would think that a seasoning brand restaurant would have some very well seasoned beef. My husband got the diamond Jim cut. Had a crust with no flavor. What? How can this be. We did not join the club. We will not be returning. To many better less expensive places to go. But we were impressed with the service and the side dishes.

I've never had a bad meal at Lawry's.  They're just fantastic.  Service is top notch.  And, the food is simple and good.  I love prime rib when it's done right, and they nail it.  Every.  Time.  

I prefer the thinly sliced English cut -- very nice because it doesn't overwhelm your mouth.  The spinning salad is tasty.  

I had the lobster bruschetta appetizer special one night, and the char on the bread perfectly set off the tangy tomato-basil-balsamic.  Couldn't get enough.  

The dining room in Vegas is wonderful art deco.  Just look at the backs of the booths.  Well done, simple, plush upholstery.  And, the people who come here are not trashy.  It's far enough off the strip that folks don't just wander in.  It's a destination for a special occasion.  Gussy up and have a beautiful night in a beautiful town.  

Also, their Lawry's VIP program is the best rewards program I've found.  I seem to get a $25 credit on my bill every time I go!  

I'm a yelp curmudgeon.  Yet, I highly suggest this restaurant and the rewards program.  I've not found better anywhere.

I've been going to Lawry's to celebrate special occasions for a couple of decades now, at both this location and the Beverly Hills restaurant.  I hadn't been in a couple of years, so I was looking forward to our visit last weekend.  I have seen the quality of the decor deteriorate over the years, with people coming in with shorts and sneakers.  This is a nice restaurant and the dress code should really be enforced.  Aside from that, we were greeted with a friendly smile and brought to our table.  We brought our teenage kids this time to celebrate as a family.  I was struck by the addition of appetizers and the plethora of non-prime rib options rattled off by our server.  We came to Lawry's for the prime rib - there are plenty of places in Vegas for other items.

We all opted for the prime rib and enjoyed the experience of having the carving cart brought to the table and our orders sliced fresh on our plates.  Asparagus and potato strings were ordered additionally, however, it took quite a long time for these side items to arrive at our table (we were almost half way through our meal).  The waitress overheard our conversation about celebrating our anniversary and brought over a chocolate cake for dessert.  They used to have a delicious trifle for this purpose, but it is no longer on the menu.  That is a shame, because it was super tasty.  We ordered the cheesecake and a macadamia nut pie to share - all tasted good.

Overall, the service was good; however, the ambiance was a little disappointing (primarily from the other diners).  The food was good, but not as good as I remembered.  I was a bit disappointed in the overall experience as I was looking forward to this dinner.  Of course, the bill came and it was through the roof, which was expected, but I can't justify another trip to this place given the cost and the experience.  There are simply too many other nice restaurants in this city to experience given the price point.

Lawry's definitely has one of the best prime rib dishes in Las Vegas, but this place is a little bit more pricey BUT completely worth it!

The prime rib was delicious. The meat wasn't dry at all and went immaculately well with the au jus that they provided. 

The decor is nice. There are a lot of booths and wood is an element heavily used at Lawry's, which gives off an old school vibe.

I enjoyed the service and the staff was always smiling. Can't wait to come back for more prime rib!

Me, my wife and and another couple came here and we heard good things and always wanted to try Lawrys out. Wasnt as great as we expected

- FOOD. The prime rib was very tender and good, the sides was they could have left in the back, I could popped open a can of Del Monte cream corn and made it better. Mashed Potatoes im sure was made from one of those brands that you make in a microwave instantly. Seeing the lilttle spinning salad bowl thinking we going to get a good salad be but all we got was a spin of .... shit, wasnt good!!

SERVICE. The waiter was some what rude, he was irritated because he actually had to serve us, right after we got our food, the cook came out and told us to not tip him because he racist..how an hispanic can be racist??
