The after we got our bill we seen the $15 split plate charge and disputed it as we wasnt explained this. The Asst. Manager was addressed and instead of pulling him to the side and discuss, he reprimanding him right at our table!! Very unproffesional and need to be RE-TRAINED. Oh forgot to mention it was the guys last day on the job...Yea my wife already trying to contact their cooporate office to voice her concern.

OVERALL
Well the prime rib seem like the only thing good, the rest of it need to be worked on and get some servers in there that are passionate and want to satify customers.
Our server Ms Bonner was excellent! Prime rib was great, I don't like creamed corn but I tried it anyway and it was delicious!

Lawry's is one of our favorite restaurant to go.  We were so disappointed tonight, I ordered a Lawry's cut prime rib with mashed potato.  The prime rib was so salty, it wasn't rub thoroughly.  I felt like I was eating a big bite of salt.  And the mashed potato was so thin that it won't hold the gravy in the middle.  Very disappointed.

This place is huge and I love how the waitresses are dressed in cute outfits. Everyone was extremely nice and constantly checked up on us. But it honestly seemed like a knock off House of Prime Rib.

The prime rib doesn't come with creamed spinach/corn so we ordered it on the side just to give it a try and compare it to HOPR. It was just alright so I wouldn't order it again. Mashed potatoes came with the prime rib and it was good. I asked for extra gravy and it was a good idea because the mashed potatoes needed it. The bread was good and their salad was mediocre. The prime rib was tasty and I loved their spicy horse radish to go with it.

Overall, if I had to choose, I'd definitely go to HOPR because not only does it taste better, the price is also a better deal.

Meeting up with family and dining in a large group can be extremely difficult in Vegas, especially at a casino restaurant. Lawry's made it so much easier. I was able to book 10 people online at the time I wanted. We were greeted promptly and sat without our entire party being present--which most restaurants won't do anymore. Our server, Ms. Taylor, was amazing! She had us rolling in laughter with her quick wit, sharp tongue and sassy attitude. SHE MADE OUR NIGHT!! You can't go wrong with any cut of Prime Rib at Lawry's. Sprinkle some season salt and pepper on everything and enjoy!

In the last 365 days, I've been to Vegas twice.  This weekend, I will be returning to Sin City for the 3rd time in one year.  And I'm hoping...that I can convince my friends to go to Lawry's at least one time for a meal.  I first discovered Lawry's two vegas trips ago when my college roommate had his bachelor party there and one of his groomsmen picked out this restaurant.  It turned out to be the best meal we had on the trip and one of the best steaks I've ever had in my life.  Hands down the best the prime rib I've ever had.

The table side service is unique, the cuts of steak are tender and juicy, the au jus is delicious, the sides are fresh, and the "spinning" salad is incredible.

There's really no reason I can think of not to like Lawry's.  I can't wait until I get to eat here again.

I love this place. I go to Lawry's every time I win some $ in Vegas. I've done really well in Vegas sportsbooks over the years. I love this place because I am a carnivore. 

I was in Vagas recently and had to celebrate a big 2-team parlay winner. Their prime rib was fantastic. I usually get their Lawry Cut and this time was no different. I like their creamed corn, but not their spinach. Also, the bread they serve is fantastic. Their Spinning Salad may be famous, but it is just ok tasting to me. Same goes for their Yorksire Pudding. I don't really order any dessert because I'm too full from the meal. 

One more thing, you can save some cash if you hit their lunch schedule (M-F 11:30AM-2:00PM) instead of their dinner schedule.

It is extremely rare to go to a restaurant numerous times and receive impeccable service and CONSISTENT FOOD! Every single time I've been there, it has been top-notch service, friendly, interactive, and fun. The food has been as delicious the first visit to our fifth! The salad is so well-balanced and fresh tasting with delicious dressing, crouton, and beets! The prime rib is always tender, juicy, moist, nicely seasoned, and cooked to perfection based on the temperature you request- medium rare, duh! Every time we come to Las Vegas, this is always on our food itinerary! I absolutely love this place and recommend it to everyone I know!

#firsttimer! I absolutely lovvvve this place. So I know this place is really known for it's prime rib. Being my usual self I went against the grain and ordered a rib eye. BEST DECISION ever! My friend ordered the lobster trio. Now don't get my wrong the lobster was like butter..... My rib eye tho.. was HITTIN. Needless to say my friend ate half of my ribeye and we shared the lobster. Oh wait, I forgot to talk about the spinning salad... Total yumminess...minus the beets. Since I don't particularly care for beets after eating half the salad it was prominent. 

Overall the ambiance and experience was unmatched. It's pretty pricey.. Wallet beware... For the large ribeye, lobster trio, side of bacon mashed potatoes a glass of prosecco and lemonade was $150. Which included a $20 tip.

ENJOY!

Food was great - had the prime rib, baked potato and chocolate lava cake. The VIP rewards program is a bit misleading and not all employees are knowledgable on the topic. I purchased more food than I needed (3 servings of each) because i thought I had points / dollars to spend

Prime rib is good,  what you would expect.  Creamed corn and spinach are both great. Kid meal is an absolute joke and the reason for the three star rating.  $20 for chicken strips and fries of which my seven year old ate  1/4 of the plate.
This place here speaks for itself lol OUTSTANDING if you're a prime-rib person! We can talk about this all day! The only reason I'm typing because my statement was to short! Lol

On what was SUPPOSED to be the happiest day of my brother and my new sister in law's lives, it was ruined by Lawry's horrible sound system. Yes, I know that may sound like such a small thing to claim it ruined their day, but think about it, EVERYONE looks forward to celebrating the new marriage with the reception following right? That's the point of having a reception. As my gift to the couple, I paid for an expensive comedian to MC their reception. I paid for this person's flight and hotel as well. Once I heard him on the mic asking for ppl to be seated for the grand entrance, I was concerned because everyone in the back could not hear him and the ppl that could hear, it was a muffle. This was unacceptable considering we gave this MC a 30 minute slot to do his act, not to mention the upcoming speeches and a special number by the groom's son. When the dj and myself asked the staff for help with their sound, there was NO ONE on hand from Lawry's that was capable in fixing the situation. Is it not common sense that when your establishment is hosting an event such as a wedding that you would have an TECH/SOUND person on hand to assist?! When we asked for such a person, they had NO ONE. This is simply and truly UNACCEPTABLE. The groom's son had to replay their special number to the bride and groom later that night in private just so that could hear how it was SUPPOSED to sound. I had to ask the MC/comedian to really project his voice because we could rely on the mic for him to be heard. The dj only brought a couple of small speakers just as back up because of the fact that Lawry's was so adamant on the dj using their sound system. If we had known how crappy their sound system was, I would have been adamant with dj in bring the speakers he would normally bring!! I myself ended up not being to eat at all because I was too busy doing damage control so that my brother and his new wife could have the reception that they deserved all because Lawry's effed up. Thanks Lawry's, you ruined the experience and the reception for the couple and everyone who came to celebrate with them. You suck.

Coming here was our excuse to finally put our fancy pants on during our trip to Vegas.  Maybe it wasn't entirely necessary and eating a giant slab of prime rib doesn't seem like the best combination in our nicest duds but we were in Vegas after all.

The service was great and our server was very attentive and informative.  We both got the classic cut and it was massive.  It was more fatty than I like and I kept giving those bits to my husband.  Honestly, this was the first time I have ever had prime rib and I will say that it isn't my favorite cut of beef but it was pretty good.  The sourdough bread is delicious and the spinning salad was cool, although I could do without the beets. 

We were also celebrating our anniversary and even got a slice of cake on the house!   

Another bonus for me?  In a town ruled by Pepsi products, they actually serve Coke products.  My tired brain needed the caffiene bad but getting if from Pepsi wasn't going to happen.

It was our 3rd wedding anniversary so my husband and I decided to have dinner here at Lawry's because we wanted to dine somewhere new to us. Well, the dinning experience was fabulous. The food was excellent along with the service. They even gave us a special anniversary dessert. I recommend this place for special occasions (it can be a little pricey), but worth the money. We actually went on July 3rd, I tried to write a review, but didn't know how so sorry for the delay.

Delicious and like stepping back in time. The service was excellent and the food was great. Loved hearing that the signature salad has been served the same way since 1937, and enjoyed all the trimmings from the yorkshire pudding to the classic mashed potatoes. The prime rib is of course fab. My husband added the lobster tail, and it was superb, tender, flavourful and tasty.

I love Lawry's ! If u are a Las Vegas resident and have and have not splurged for fine dining and be in spoiled, you are losing out I did not post any pictures because I do not want to ruin the moment! but ,everything here is amazing come and be treated like a king and queen that all of us need to be treated like and don't be scared about the bill! enjoy life! Mr. P was the best waiter and the rest of the  Lawry's  family was amazing!!

Okay so this place rocks.

You cannot go here without getting tyhe Prime Rib, it is amazing. The stick some mash potatoes and Yorkshire Pudding and I am in ex pat heaven. My one tiny tiny gripe is give everyone the yorkshire puddings in one piece so you can pour the gravy in and have a delicious bowl. That is how it is done, none of this cutting the yorkies into pieces business. 

The decor was semi fancy and the service was brilliant. Our servers all had a sense of humour, which you need when faced with a group of 15 guys out for shenanigans.

This place is a must when you visit Vegas.

Walking into this restaurant is like walking back in time to the 1980's....shabby velvet booths, waitresses dressed in ridiculous aprons and bonnets, dirty carpets and a wait staff of women old enough to be MY grandmother!  Prime rib was fatty and baked potatoes were undercooked.  The entire atmosphere seemed very dated, including the way they pull right up to your table to slice off a big slab of fatty meat for you.  We were very disappointed, as this place is literally right next door to our new vacation home.  Won't be going back to Lawry's.

This place has gone downhill since my first visit 18 years ago!!! What an embarrassment this last visit was to your location. I had 5 visitors in town from Illinois and had never ate at a Lawry's and I was extremely excited to have them experience the place that I once loved and talked highly of. After this last visit last night, I will never recommend nor take anymore guests to your location! I was in tears at this dinner reservation we had last night, and our awful server was lucky my boyfriend's father insisted on tipping your awful server! I had asked if I can have bone in my cut and he said that cost extra because that's the "Diamond cut"....yet my boyfriend and his mother got a bone in their "Lawry cut" just the same cut I ordered, except they did NOT want the bone and I requested one but had to pay extra for it??? Why? Because I wanted it??? What a terrible birthday dinner this was for me. He never asked if we were celebrating anything, which we were. A Mother's Day for 4 Mother's, my boyfriend's college graduation and MY BIRTHDAY! We had an awful experience and luckily our server got a generous tip from my boyfriend's father because I didn't think he deserved anything at all. I am extremely pissed and embarrassed with the entire experience! My guests asked ME after we were served our salads, "why is this called the spinning salad?" I said well he spun the salad in the bowl and didn't tell y'all what he was doing because he obviously didn't care that y'all were watching. Geezuz I want to throw "F" bombs all over this review, but I'm trying my best to hold it together. I just can't fathom we spent $500 on such a disgusting experience! What has happened to your location? I used to visit frequently and ever since you added men servers that place has gone to junk. The last few times I had men servers and they all sucked! And of course I got another one last night! Of course!!!! The men show no enthusiasm, no friendliness, nothing! They all seem like they hate that job! Why did I not put down specifics in my reservation?!?! Oh, well I guess that wouldn't have mattered anyway, because I did specify celebrations and no one cares about that either....
I really wish I can have my night back and would have never gone to your restaurant, I couldn't even sleep last night because I was boiling! What a sad, very sad place this has became. I'm so disgusted. So much for being a "VIP" member. What a joke...

Top notch service and prime rib! This location has never disappointed us. This particular Lowery's has been very consistent in wonderful food and service. If you are a prime rib lover, this is your place! 

Also, side dished and appetizers are delicious! Had the mashed potatoes, gravy, creamed corn and Yorkshire pudding bread! Yummy!

My girlfriend and I came here on a Saturday night. We got seated within minutes. Our waitress Ms. Taylor was amazing and very knowledgeable. The prime rib was the perfect temperature . Our food was amazing and the prime rib tasted amazing especially on the bone . I loved this place and definitely will come back multiple times .

I'm a big fan of the Prime Rib at Lawry's.

A glass of wine with a California cut or Lawrys cut (depends on how hungry I am).

Service great, we were a party of 10, but everything went smoothly. 

Don't forget about the corn and spinach, the perfect sides for a delicious mid-rare cut. 

Yes, I would recommend it!!

Been here twice. First time was delicious. Signed up for the Lawry's VIP Club and came there during an April Special Dinner for 2 $99. By the time I'm through with the salad and like 3 bites of the prime rib, I'm already stuffed. Good food, nice ambiance for a special occasion. If you go on Mondays, you get double points on your VIP card ;). Spinning salad is probably my favorite item on the menu.

The wait is long for the food and seating  without a reservation but with a reservation it's not long to get seated and the food will always take long but it is worth the wait the cream corn is a must have and you can't go to lawrys without the prime rib it was so good I plan to go back ....... And soon
90 minute ticket times. $46 beef Wellington that tastes like dog food. Worst part is my burps still taste like that nastiness. Would have been better off with the $12 steak from chili's!

I love this place and the food is amazing everytime but the reason I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 5 is because the service wasn't great. We sat for quite some time before we were asked our drink orders and there were a few times where I felt like they forgot about us.

SOOOOOOOOO  consistently great!  From super courteous, friendly, timely service to the hot fresh sourdough bread.... Spinning salad is always very good, although probably could go a touch lighter on the dressing.   Cutting to the chase... the mashed potatoes that come standard are excellent... fresh/smooth/tasty beef gravy.  But really, u GOTTA get the creamed corn.  Would recommend ordering that in a side dish as it's a larger portion which also makes it easier to share with one other.  Plus, the au jus won't run into it so much as it does on the plate.  We also shared a baked potato as it was excellent.  

But what good is anything if the prime rib isn't 5 star.  Have prime rib everywhere, including the HOP'er (House of Prime Rib in SF), and you just can ever go wrong here.  So consistently flavorful and tender from the outside of the roast on in.  I hate it when the only flavor is on the outer crust and the inside is just so bland.  Also, very helpful that the au jus is so flavorful as well but really, the beef is where it should be.  The Lawry's cut is seemingly plenty even for a big eater, but if you are super hungry, then go for the biggest cut.  For ladies, the California cut is also a very satisfying amount, especially with the appropriate sides.  

Didn't have time for dessert, but i tell you what... Consistently awesome.  We were in/out in 60 minutes, which isn't for every occasion.  But if running off to a show/quick date night with sitter at home, it's great.  So, it's not exactly a slooooooow, course out and take 2 hours super special event meal.  

Always a win!  How awesome is that in Vegas right?
Love the food. Plus I accidentally left my credit card and they called and held it for me until the next day. Great customer service
Fun atmosphere...  good food!  Came here with friends and we all enjoyed our meals and the service.

Great atmosphere and fine dining. Best prime rib in town. Food was great and the master carvers were awesome. Special thanks to Brook, Ashley, and Alberto. I'll be back for business and family dining.

I have been to the Lawry's in L.A. several times and the one in Las Vegas is no different. It's conveniently located near the strip. I came with my family of four. One 10 and 8 y.o. Service is very good and our waitress was attentive while making us feel welcome. 

We began our meal with a salad accompanied with an overwhelmingly strong and sweet heavy dressing. It was a cross between a Russian and Thousand Island dressing of the 1960's. 

Next, came the silver cart where our Prime Rib was carved to order. My wife and I ordered the Diamond Jim, a18oz PR on the bone, to share with our kids. It was just enough and we were not charged for sharing. 

My older son loved the Prime Rib and the experience so I added the fourth star. Personally the Prime Rib was a little above average but maybe my expectation was too high. The deserts were the highlight of the night. Both the chocolate bag and the coconut / banana pie were outstanding. The coconut banana pie is filled with fresh coconut shavings and the crust tasted like a macaroon.

My family was excited to come try Lawry's during restaurant week in Las Vegas. The four of us made a reservation days ahead of time at 830pm. When we were seated, our first server was pleasant until we asked about the restaurant week specials. Once a year many Las Vegas restaurants have special tasting menus with a portion of the profits going to charity. Our waiter rolled his eyes, turned his back on us when we asked about restaurant week, and told us he would be right back. 20 minutes later another waiter appeared.

Our second server was pleasant, but at this point it was almost 9pm and I could tell she wanted to leave even though we had a reservation for weeks. (The restaurant closes at 9pm)

When our food finally arrived, the sauce for the prime rib was luke-warm and very salty. The table-side carver was nice but gave me a medium-well portion when I asked for medium-rare. My wife's beef wellington was good; however the potatoes were barely warm. The food was good, but not great.

All in all, this was a disappointment and not worth the money. The first server was rude and our eating experience was rushed. If they don't want to serve people late, they shouldn't take 830pm reservations. 

Next time, I would save the $50 per person and go to a different establishment.

From the moment we entered Lawry's, everyone was very nice and friendly.  When we sat down, the waiters were also very nice and detailed about the menu.  When we got our food, omg, Lawry"s prime rib is a must have.  Enjoyed everything about this place.
Pretty solid.... As good as House of Prime Rib in SF, and they will seat you on time.

On March 15th my husband & I decided to celebrate his retirement at Lawry's Prime Rib. We had made reservations for a busy Friday night but due to circumstances out of our control - we called & let them know that we were running a half an hour late! Well Ms. Carolynn Stevenson greeted us as we again apologized for our tardiness. She immediately put us at ease, told us she would get us seated as soon as possible, and show us to the bar. We waited maybe ten minutes when we were called and seated! Our server turned out to be - in our opinion - the BEST - Mun Froilan!!!!!! If you want the most awesome dining experience then ask for him when you make your reservation!!! It is a must! He makes you feel as if you are the one and only guests he has to please and take care of and everything he did he seemed to truly enjoy! The restaurant's décor is a 1930's-40's era which I love since the staff's attire also reflects that time period. You start off with the artisan bread (OMG - SO SO DELISH) and their famous spinning salad. The prime rib just melts in your mouth! The cuts we had were good size - Mun made sure of that! - and I had the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach which was so fabulous. The dessert cart that he wheeled out looked amazing but we couldn't fit another morsel of food in our mouths! Highly recommend this GREAT restaurant!

From the moment you drive up to the canopy the doors open at the roundabout you feel like you're going to meet Frank Sinatra for dinner I absolutely love this place for that old school feel...I'm sure Marilyn Monroe sat in one of these booths because it oozes old Hollywood glamour, it's a must for any Vegas trip!

I love this place!  We have been to the one in Beverly Hills and this Lawry's is just as great!  We decided to go for lunch since the prices were so much cheaper.  Even though the prices were less for lunch, it didn't affect the quality of the product or the size of the cut.

The gf got the regular Lawry's cut and I went for the enormous Beef Bowl Cut.  This cut was so huge it had two bones.  I ordered it medium rare and it was cooked perfectly.  The meat was flavorful and tender.  It was so moist I could taste the flavor of the juices with each bite.  

The lunch came with two sides and we got the creamed corn and creamed spinach.  Both were winners!  I cannot wait to go again...

What IS fine dining? We had the slowest service EVER and my dad said, "it's because it is fine dining." I beg to differ.

We received our first course (salads) around 45 minutes after we sat down. AND he poured the dressing right in front of us. Did they have to grow the romaine lettuce in the back real quick? 

I honestly can't wrap my head around a 45 min salad. 

The iced tea that my friend ordered, came AFTER the salads.

Then, as we sat there with our salad plates cleared and nothing on our table, we had to stare at the prime rib cart, that was right in front of our table. The prime rib was already cooked and in a cart, sitting right in front of our table...and it took 15 minutes for that to get in my mouth!

 It is a good prime rib, though I've had better. I had to salt it a bit for flavor. Eh, cream corn. good mushroom side.

THEN, we wanted to pay and get to a show, can't find the waiter to pay!
This place is class all the way, it's like being transported back in time. Took my girlfriend there once and now she wants to go there all the time. Food is amazing.

Its tradition that my HE-MAN friends and I stop in every time we're in Vegas. 

They get the Beef Bowl or something of that sort and I get the 3 Lobster tails...cuz I dont eat red meat. 

All the sides are freaken shmazing!! And the service is incredible. 

Dress Attire. Great for groups!

Dined here for the first time about a month ago.  From the time you walk in, you're treated like royalty.  The bar has classy drinks and when your sat down to eat the tables are set with fine linen. The servers are phenomenal and the food is as expected,  delicious.  Five stars all the way through.

It was very good, but what made it unique was the presentation... They pull the table out, you sit in the booth and then they scoot the table back in. The servers are dressed like ol fashion maids... it's really interesting. The prime rib was very good, but not the best I ever had in my life but close... Over all I'd say it was good for the price.

If you do not come here you will miss one of the finest dinners around. 

We were told by 3 people we asked as to where to go for steak/prime rib.
They all said to go here.

The service was amazing, but the Prime Rib was out of this world.  Simply the best Prime Rib I have ever had, and I have had some really good ones. But this tops them  all.

You can't leave Vegas w/O coming here.

WOW is a understatement. 

You will not be disappointed. ......
I would make the 6 hrs drive just to get here.
The food and service was great! The server was so attentive and patient with us. Food was amazing, especially their bread and sides.  Overall I will be coming back

I don't usually review chains but I think Lawry's is a worthy exception.  The first one I went to was located in Beverley Hills.  At the time, I thought I had struck gold and made it a tradition to eat there every time I was down there.  I am totally amazed at how the quality is maintained and the opulence shines through.  Still the best prime rib around anywhere.  I've even copied their creamed corn recipe which is probably the only reason why people even bother to talk to me.

The ambiance at this branch seems a little cozier and more romantic than the one in Socal.  The icing on the whole experience was that the meal was expensed.  *sigh*

whoa, my boyfriend took me here for our 4 years, 7 months (:

All I can say is WOW. I LOVE their prime rib. I ordered the Lawry Cut and had way too much to eat. For women, I'd definitely advise the California Cut!

Reservations were very easy, through Yelp, and we were seated right away.
Wonderful experience as a whole.  Service was great, atmosphere was charming, and food was fantastic.  You will not be disapointed.

I never really liked prime rib until Lawry's.

It was really good. Really tender, cut like butter. I had the popular Lawry's cut that came with the usual sides (you can pick your own) but we picked mashed potatoes, creamed spinach and a spinning salad. We also had a glass of wine. She asked for my ID, which is typical for me but it was still embarrassing nonetheless!

I don't get what's so great about the spinning salad except they prepare it right before your eyes. Our server was pleasant and she made small talk while preparing our dishes. She was really sweet in a motherly sort of way, though, I think that's how they all come across.

When the prime rib came out, I was a bit intimidated but the first bite was so tender. The horseradish made it even better. I could barely finish my plate but it was really good, really moist and the mashed potatoes were so good! I didn't really care for the spinach but it was tasty too.

The only thing that really tasted weird was the yorkshire pudding - does anyone really eat this? I didn't get it...and I took a bite but it just wasn't for me.

If you love prime rib, you should come here. They also have things like surf & turf! Also, they were hosting a future mystery game dinner thing, where they play Clue with a group of people and you try to figure out who's murder. That seems fun :)
Service was outstanding! Prime rib, Excellent. Steak was delicious. Not cheap, but if you want a really great dining experience this is the place to go!

Went there tonight!!! Totally disappointed; service was awful and we ordered prime ribs which didn't get served until an hour later! We ordered a bottle of wine which was finished by the time they served our meal since it took so long and at the end they just gave us a hot chocolate fudge sauce as an apology!!!! Seriously????!!! Felt horrible since we were taking some especial guests there !

Although Lawry's is a classy restaurant that specializes in gourmet prime rib by night, this review is for the lunch. Lunch goes from 11:30-2:00... and is completely awesome!  Lawry's does great sandwiches for lunch, from about $10 to $14.  It includes a small all you want fruit salad bar.  We went on a Monday, and had the Monday special prime rib sandwich for only $10.  The meat cutter slices a fresh slab of prime rib in front of your eyes, and slaps the meat on a heated bread roll.  The bread rolls aren't amazing, but good... the prime rib just melts in your mouth though!  I had a little horse radish with my prime rib sandwich, which gave it a nice little zing to it.  I thought the sandwich could have been a little bit larger, hence the 4 stars.  However, this is definitely a new spot for the work buddies and me.  

Lawry's is actually a fast, cheap, and delicious lunch spot.  I definitely recommend this place for a quick work lunch if you are in the area, or have easy access to the I15.  Oh, and try the chocolate cookies for dessert.  They are almost like a cookie with a brownie stuffed inside.. only 2 for $1!

In my opinion, the best prime rib in Las Vegas. From the service, to ambiance, to the food, Lawry's is great. I ate the English cut prime rib, with mashed potatoes, and a spun salad. Fantastic food! Everything was great, but we paid for it. Lawry's is not cheap, but worth every penny.

Came here for my birthday, and what a treat it was!  I've been the the Lawry's in Beverly Hills and Five Crowns in CDM.  This place is right on par with the BH location because everything's the same but you get bigger side dish portions.  I love their creamed corn, and got a huge portion.  Loved the bread, Lawry's cut, mashed potatoes and gravy, and spinning bowl salad.  The only thing they forgot was to ask if we were dining there to celebrate any occasion.  I didn't get my trifle, boo.  It was a great meal anyways, and I'm coming back.

Still the best prime rib in the city! 

There's always at least one bootleg Vegas casino offering a cheap prime rib dinner, but nothing will ever compare to the art of Lawry's prime rib. Don't come here for anything else. Serious! Actually...come here for the creamed corn too. Soooo perfect paired with the juicy meaty prime rib! Order the Lawry's cut or bigger and you must get it medium rare or lose my number! 

The service is top notch and the shiny silver meat cart is super old school and unique. I love that they carve and serve the prime rib tableside. They also offer a salad spinning production tableside as well. Try not to blink your eyes or you'll miss all of the tasty action. 

We made reservations effortlessly on opentable on New Years Eve 2017. We were also running 30 minutes late, but the restaurant still accommodated our party with no problems at all. This restaurant is perfect for the last meal of the year because they deck the space with festive New Year party favors. Our table left the evening with horn blowers, hat's, tiaras and festive party necklaces.

It was a memorable dining experience and I would recommend it for any special occasion!

Thanks for picking up the tab Jeff V! $300+++ for a party of 4 is no bargain feat.

Lawry's is the Best Prime Rib in Las Vegas. What a great experience everytime I am here. The real reason that this is one of my favorites is for the creamed Corn. It is a little sweet which is the perfect accent to the Prime Rib. Lawry's has five different cuts of Prime Rib your choice when they bring the carving station to your table. Enjoy you wont be disappointed.

I went to dinner at this place and it's the best prime rib I've had in town so far.  The downside is the small menu.  If you are going with someone who doesn't want a hunk or red meat, you might want to go elsewhere. The wine list was good.  I sat at the bar and the bartender was very knowledgeable about the wines.  The prime rib was cooked perfectly and so were the sides.  My only minor beef was with the salad.  A little too much dressing for my taste making the lettuce a little limp.  I agree with Edward's comparison to House of Prime Rib in SF.  The downside was I was so full, I couldn't sample any dessert.

The quality of food that you receive for the price is ridiculous. The prime rib was cold and half of it was not even edible (pure fat). If you decide to share a plate they tack on an extra $20 charge without notifying you. You're much better off going to Herbs and Rye or another steakhouse in the area. You're basically paying for the ambiance. Our family was so disappointment; we will not be going back.

Over priced. Slow service. PR isnt that great. Definitely not worth the price. Not coming back. I've been here lots of times and the quality has gone down. There are better places to go in Vegas for PR.

Once again found myself entertaining out of town customers.  A balance between the best of quality and watching cost. Lawry's delivers on both. Started with house made chips and a Pimm's Cup in the bar.  The salad show always sets off the festivities. They even made concessions to leave the egg out of one my fellow diner's salad plate. Once seated, the three of us each ordered Lawry's 24oz ribeye. All three plates came out medium rare plus as ordered.  The entire meal was spot on. A great meal without a great expense. We each enjoyed dining at Lawry's.

Today i came to Lawrys, initially i was disappointed about seating and VIP 
status but Bruce the Manager made it "A" ok. He clarified my situation and comp us our meal. Thanks Bruce sorry for the misunderstanding. Mrs Taylor our waitress was amazing she catered to us and we very happy with our dinner date.

Eh - I was a bit underwhelmed. Maybe I had too high of expectations. I thought this place was going to be a bit more upscale, like a Mortons. The place looked a bit shabby to me, and the food was mediocre. We came on Thanksgiving night and admittedly had turkey instead of prime rib - I know prime rib is the thing here, and maybe my review would be different if I had that. The turkey dinner with all of the trimmings was okay, but I honestly thought the identical meal I had at Koo-Koo-Roo a few days earlier was superior. I was not a fan of the spinning salad at all. 

Service was polite, but I personally don't like places where they get all creative with the presentation. The spinning salad was prepared by a guy who thought he was an extra in the movie Cocktail, and the uniforms and medallions worn by the servers bordered on ridiculous. Spare me the theatrics; just feed me yummy food. 

If you are bringing all of your elderly relatives out to dinner, this may be a decent place - it had that vibe. But for me, there are so many fabulous restaurants in Vegas that I can't imagine coming back here.

First experience here and I will be back. Strangely enough, the group that I was with was not a fan of prime rib. However, we all had a great meal! Two with steak and one with sea bass. The atmosphere and experience was excellent!!

Prime Rib in Vegas -- got's to be great, got's to be a show, right?  Lawry's does both.  The steam table comes to you and the chefs carve and dish with great aplomb.  All the sides were wonderful, the meat was heavenly and the dessert awesome.  

We were in town for a bachelor party and doing the one fancy dinner bit.  Lawry's suited us perfectly.  Price was right considering the lovely bottles of vino we tippled and the enchanting afterglow that attended our group as we meandered through the casinos for the rest of the night.

This IS prime rib.  Look, I'm sure you've had prime rib other places and I'm sure you've probably enjoyed it, but it probably wasn't this good.  

After our first recommended venue fell through, we headed over to Lawry's just off the strip.  I didn't know what to expect, but I was so thankful that we ended up here!  

First off, art decOMG, this place is amazing.  I love art deco, so it is really up my alley.  Those calling for an update must hate classic architecture.  You heard me.  Lawry's is dripping with clean lines, metal accents and harkens back to a time when all the little touches added up to a genuine feel that is greater than the sum of its parts.  This is reflected in the walls, carpets, ceilings, tables, uniforms... everything is thought out.

The bar is superb.  Masterfully mixed cocktails by a friendly bar keep.  

Once our table was ready, we were seated in the main room and watched as the servers and carvers made their way around to each table.  Our server was prompt, helpful and cheerful.  I also smile at the fact that they go by "Ms." or "Mr." rather than their more familiar first names.  A little formal touch that I liked.  

Salad?  Great!
Calamari?  Super tasty!
That other thing we got for an appetizer that I can't remember?  Probably really good too!

But the real star is next.  If you get the salmon, or the chicken or something, just stop.  You want the prime rib.  Why?  It is in the name, first off!  Secondly, a giant (no kidding, he must have been 6'5") wheels up a massive pillbug from space made of metal weighing 700 lbs to your table, opens up the top and cuts the beef right there!  Oh, was it good...  I got the Lawry's cut, not wanting one of the big portions.  It was more than enough to fill me up.  Did I do what my mother always told me and stop eating when I was full?  Hell no, I didn't!  I'm not going to waste something that good!  We all polished off the meal with a glass of bourbon.  

What a great way to end the night.
Excellent, melt in your mouth prime rib , delicious sour dough bread, truly one of my favorites. When in doubt this is always a winner!

What a fantastic restaurant all around!  The food was amazing as was the service and the decor. It was a bit pricey, but was well worth every penny. Chad was our server and he was so knowledgeable but yet very personable (I kept him updated on the score of the Golden Nights game). My husband and I were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary and they even gave us a complementary piece of cake!  I highly recommend the Prime Rib!

Sadly, after 9 years of coming to Lawry's for dinner during the JCK Jewelry Trade show, we had the worst dinner we've ever had there. Surprisingly there was NO ONE in the lobby or the bar at 8:00 on a Saturday night! That should have been a tip off of how the dinner would go.The main dinning room was not very busy but we were seated in the side back room. We split a shrimp cocktail (which turned out to be the best part of the meal), and when the Prime rib cart came, we were not introduced to the carver, that we later found out was not one of the top carvers ( which we thought was the norm for all Lawry's carvers). My female co worker ordered a California cut, the order was given to the carver and he started cutting, and then I gave my order for a Lawry's cut.... guess what was handed to the server first.... the Lawyr's cut... not the CA cut, which he was told first, AND ordered by the only woman at the table (old school rules of serving her first was ignored) and then we watched the carver basically hack at not 1 but 2 pieces of prime rib and hack saw a piece off... which looked like the exact size as I got.... The Asparagus was underdone and not even ripe, was straw-like on most of the stock. The salad was ok. We both had 1 cocktail eacg. For $148 + tip for just 2 people, we probably won't be back next year. We have a great prime rib in San Diego for 1/2 the price and double the flavor and serving amount. Hopefully the management won't let a Vegas classic die out....

Service was good, food was good, ambiance was good, but nothing really stood out. Our bill was over $275 for 4 of us, but nothing we tried was exceptional. It was a neat experience being able to see our prime rib cut from the cart table-side. With all the places to eat in Vegas, I don't think I'd choose to go back again. Cool to try once, but my expectations where higher than reality.

Not sure how this place is for dinner, but for lunch it is more cafeteria than anything else.  Food is not served to you at lunch.  You have to get up and get it yourself even if you are paying almost $30 for a prime rib!

Eating at Lawry's makes me feel like I'm a Vegas mobster . This place is old school mafia chic, with the exception of the patrons who were wearing baggy jeans and flat brimmed caps, reminds me of myself 12 years ago when I first ate at Lawry's. The Food is still as good as it was 12 years ago and the waitresses are still sassy as hell. 

Side note, there is a titty bar across the street that doesn't charge an entrance fee, I remember going there when I was 21 and getting a $2 lap dance from cougars. Still there. Some places in Vegas stay the same.

Amazing!  Went to Lawrys last week for my mom's birthday before seeing Celine Dion.  Thank goodness we got reservations ahead of time due to the conference in town!!
Our server was Mrs. Morrison.  She was great...friendly, personable, and helpful.  My parents and I all had the prime rib...of course!!  Mrs. Morrison explained the Yorkshire pudding and that it wasn't a dessert, but used to soak up the prime rib juice.  Never would have tried it without her explanation.  Excellent!!!  Thanks!
Everything about the meal was extraordinary: spinning salad, prime rib, mashed potatoes and gravy, creamed corn and Yorkshire pudding!
After dinner they served my mom a mini bundt cake for her birthday. 
An excellent dinner for an amazing night!!!
I would highly recommend it to anyone!

When my 80+ year old Hero, my Daddy, said he craved Prime Rib, I knew there was only one place to go: Lawry's.
But which one? LA or LV? I live smack dab in between the two. I decided for the one where the drive would not spoil my day, after all, who wants to follow a great meal by sitting in traffic? Las Vegas, it was!
Dad had the prime rib, of course. Carved to order, tableside, is everything right.
I had the beef ribs. Four perfectly succulent ribs on a bed of garlic fries. 
Dad cleaned his plate and I took home leftovers.
Speaking of taking home, I ordered two portions of prime rib chili to go 
This way  my dad got another great meal, and I justified it all for my husband by giving him a bowl full of goodness.

Excellent fresh cooked and well seasoned prime rib (it better be for a place named for it, right?) - the sides; asparagus, creamed corn, potatoes and yorkshires are also great.  The prime rib comes in many sizes, they cut the size/taste off for you when you place your order.
Nice selection of wines, and the cocktails were only $7 - in Vegas this is a screaming deal.  
Fantastic old fashioned service (dressed in the original waitresses uniforms).  We were there to celebrate a birthday and our lovely server did a very nice job of wishing him a happy birthday throughout the evening and presenting a special candle lit dessert to him after dinner, nice touch.    
The only reason I won't give it 5 stars is because of the ambiance, the table for 2 that we were at felt like a deserted, exposed island in the middle of an ocean of huge tables - I think a table tucked along the side or corner may have been nicer.  That being said the ambiance is still nice, very traditional steakhouse type except for brighter.
Reservations are a must, even with reservations we still had to wait 10 minutes to be seated.
It is about a 10-15 minute walk from the strip (Paris area).  We will definitely go back when in the area, as the meal is truly fantastic.

Lawry's harkens back to a time when manners and service mattered; waitresses are introduced by their last names & our hostess made piling into a booth easier by pulling out our table for us. Sinatra tunes provided the soundtrack to our meal. Notably entertaining moments include the spinning salad bowl prep & the prime rib being carved tableside from an impressive rolling cart. 

I ordered beef ribs mostly because I don't eat prime rib. I appreciate that our waitress set a steak knife down for me...there's just no way to look gracious & ladylike while gnawing on a giant rib. Relished the condiments that came on the side (no pun intended) -- mango BBQ sauce & chipotle ketchup were both good to dip fries into. An okay meal in a dining room with cozy booths & an interesting ceiling.

Always a good place to eat and the food is consistently good. But this experience was lacking due to our somewhat abrasive server and it took away from the experience. I may not recommend Lawry's for their service anymore. I've always been a fan of Lawry's but this actually tainted my previous experiences.

One of the best restaurants I have been to!  The ambiance is amazing and the food is wonderful, creamed corn, asparagus to name a few. The prime rib is the STAR!  They wheel it in a silver container and slice it right there!  Beautiful!  Can't wait to return !!!

This is THE best prime rib dinner I have EVER had. Everything about this restaurant is classy. The food is impeccable! The service is perfect - they know how customer service is done here! My friend had her wedding reception here and they handled the whole event flawlessly. I even accidentally dropped a cocktail glass (I was drunk, ok..it was my best friend's wedding! ha ha) and it shattered ever so quietly (high quality glass right there) and a server came out and swept it up right away, with a smile on her face AND replaced my drink. If you get a chance you MUST have dinner here and you MUST have their Prime Rib!

Lawry's is a dining experience. Salad is spun table side and your cut of prime rib is presented in the same manner. This was my first time at the Las Vegas location (usually go to Beverly Hills) and the venue was similar, but I would have to say less crowded. 
Its not on the Strip, but if you are looking for a good prime rib dinner experience, then it is worth the drive. 
It's hard to leave room for dessert, but I've tried all the desserts and liked every single one.

The average of 4.5 stars for this Lawrys is a perfect example of why you have to be very careful with assuming stars mean "good".  I made a last minute decision to give this off strip steakhouse a try as I had already been to many of the better places on the strip (Stripsteak, Carnevino, Cut, Delmonicos, and others). I went thinking this must be great since it has 4.5 stars and Cut only has 4. I couldn't have been more wrong. 

The decor is OK, if you like 20s Art Deco. The service is OK, if a little slow to start. Also, I found it very odd that they try to sell you a membership. I've never seen this in a "nice" restaurant. 

They start you with the "famous" house salad. It's like something you'd get from Denny's. A simple mix that is supposed to be made better by being spun in a chilled bowl. It wasn't just boring, it also tasted like Thousand Island dressing.

My brother and I ordered the 12 oz Boneless Ribeyes. We also ordered a side of Asparagus and a baked potato. The steaks were requested medium rare but came out closer to medium. They weren't tender and were mostly tasteless. How do you mess up a ribeye?

The asparagus was 6 pieces and was over cooked. The backed potato was OK, but could have had a crunchy skin.

Lastly we gave them one more chance with dessert by ordering their Creme Brûlée. It was boring and the caramelization was over done, so was bitter and rubbery. 

Overall we paid about as much as if we had eaten at Stripsteak or Cut (both very good on the strip in casino steak restaurants), yet received a subpar dinner. I would not recommend anyone eat here unless it's at 50% of the price.

Prime rib is usually not my favorite cut of meat, but boy I have definitely changed my mind after coming here! 
I would highly recommend getting the Prime Rib Dinner which includes: salad, a cut of prime rib, a side of mashed potatoes, and Yorkshire pudding. The Yorkshire pudding was a little odd, but more on that later. 
The house salad is delicious, it's their signature "spinning salad" that is tossed table-side. After that they wheel around a whole cart of prime rib prepared to different temperatures depending on your preference. So you just tell them what size cut you want and the slice it right there for you. And I think my favorite part about eating prime rib is the horseradish sauce. Lawry's gives you two different kinds- the really concentrated kind which will clear your sinuses out for a week, and the whipped kind which is light a fluffy and better for the more sensitive palette. 
The prime rib is served on the side of some mashed potatoes. You also have the option of some a la carte veggies like creamed spinach or creamed corn.
Then they give you this Yorkshire pudding- which I always thought was a dessert. But it's a dry kind of bread that you let soak in the au jus and mop up all that delectable flavor. 
Overall it was a nice dining experience and I'll be coming back again. Good for a celebration, or even a romantic night out.

I went there for the prime rib and thats what we got, The servers are dressed in 30's waitress outfits, looked like a nurses outfit to me, anyways great service, very friendly. Ordered appetizers calamari, not good at all but we ordered the prime rib, the cook/carver comes out with this huge stainless steel serving station, he opens it and has a flame, carves the meat based on what size and how you would like it cooked, carves it right in front of your eyes and served to you right there no waiting. btw the sour dough bread is awesome......will try again.

A couple of friends and I had the pleasure of dining at this fine establishment for lunch. Everything about the experience was sensational, the service, food, and the ambience, such a great lunch experience for only $180. I highly recommend finishing your meal off with the cheesecake, best I've ever had.
We always go to Lawry's whenever we're in Vegas and it never disappoints! Love the food and service is usually good as well.

I have been going to the Beverly Hills location for many years, so I was excited to try the one in Las Vegas. Came here for my birthday last week, and I was not disappointed! The quality of the food and service were on par with the Beverly Hills location, but I think I like the interior of the Vegas location a little better. Started with the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail, which was excellent. The shrimp were very fresh, and the cocktail sauce had just the right amount of flavor and spice. For dinner, I had my usual Lawry Cut, medium rare with Creamed Corn. Lawry's still serves the best prime rib, in my opinion. They never disappoint! I'm sure I'll be back.

I got really worried when we drove in and I saw a bunch of men and women wearing evening dresses and suits. I was wearing jeans, a casual top, and sandals. I was happy when we got inside and I saw a family wearing jeans and tennis shoes. Then, as we got seated, I saw more jean-clad patrons. Whew!

The service was perfect. 'Nuff said for that.

This was the best prime rib I've ever had. If you love prime rib, you definitely have to come here. For me, it had just the right seasoning, and it was cooked exactly the way I love my medium rare. I don't usually care for horseradish, but they have their own recipe, and I loved that, too! All I needed was my prime rib, mashed potatoes, and gravy...never mind the vegetables or dessert....I was a happy girl....well, I had to have wine, too.   

I honestly don't remember how much we spent for dinner. I didn't really care at the time (I usually do!). When I'm happy and in love with my food, I don't care how much I've spent on it.

Let me start by saying that I love Lawry's and looked forward to going ever since my visit to the one in Beverly Hills last year. In fact, I selected it for my wife's 60th birthday dinner. While the food was great everything else was just okay, which was disappointing on such a special occasion. 

We started by waiting for a table when the restaurant was clearly not full. Then we were put in the back room at an awkwardly placed table and when we asked for a booth in the main dining room we were given an attitude and waited again. Certainly not the five star service of Beverly Hills. The waiter was also not what you would expect in this caliber restaurant. 

Overall, given the other many amazing restaurants in Vegas, I would look elsewhere and probably not return to this one.

This has been one of my favorite places for many years.  It's even okay for kids, but only if they are well behaved.

The prime rib tonight was excellent, as is always expected.  Some sticky toffee pudding to finish out the meal.  Now I need a long nap!

My favorite big name steakhouse. Love the service. Love the food. And considering the quality, the prices are VERY reasonable. I'd give this place 4 stars on the food and service quality alone, but I should give it a 5th star just on the price.

Only fault? Relatively small menu. That isnt a fault. I love Lawry's just the way it is. But I know of one other steakhouse that has as good of service & food with a deeper menu so Im forced to reserve the 5th star for them.

A must stop for my wife and I every time we're in Las Vegas.

I wont even eat at Morton's or Ruth's. They dont compare.

My wife and I, along with our two kids (4yrs and 7 yrs) ate here on 8/6/07. We were in Las Vegas and I was craving prime rib. I was not going to trust a casino serving up $6.95 prime rib to satisfy my craving. So, I put on jeans and a collared shirt so we could dine here. I have been to the Lawry's in Beverly Hills too many times to remember, but this is my first time to their Vegas location.

LOCATION: The restaurant is located just off of the strip. There is only ONE entrance I could find to their parking lot, which was on Howard Hughes Drive. I drove by the restaurant the first time and it took me 5 minutes to make my way back.

ATMOSPHERE: This is very similar to their Beverly Hills location. It is kind of like a throwback to the great steakhouses of the 1950's with red velvet booths and oil paintings. They have a separate bar area. They did not serve the potato chips and meatballs in the bar that they do at their other location.

The atmosphere and staff are genuine, the waitresses (there are no waiters) have oftentimes been there many years. The staff is all dressed in classic formal uniforms. Despite this, I felt comfortable eating here in jeans and a Hawaiian shirt with my kids (they are well behaved), my dress may not have been appropriate for their BHills location though.

SERVICE: The service as always was top-notch. I have never had bad service at a Lawry's. They did not have a sommelier on-staff (or at least working that night). I had some questions about a wine and the waitress was happy to get the answer from the manager.

Since we had our kids with us, we dined later (at 9:00) so the restaurant was not too crowded. They were able to seat us in a nice booth so that we would not disturb others, since some people may dread seeing smaller children brought into nicer places.

FOOD: I am on a constant look out for someone with better prime rib. Claim Jumper (a LA chain) comes a little close, but not nearly close enough. No one does prime rib better than Lawry's, period. The quality of their meat is the key, it is so silky. If you order it medium or cooked even more, I do not know what you will end up with. The only way to eat meat of this quality is medium rare.

Prime rib is a roast and it is slow-roasted. Because of this, there is no way for them to cook the meat when you order it. They do such a quantity of prime rib that they pull them out of the oven and right onto large silver carts. The carts keep the meat warm and allow the server to carve it right at your table. You can choose any type of doneness you want.

I had the beef bowl cut, their biggest with the rib bone attached. I generally do not recommend ordering anything other than prime rib, but my wife ordered the lobster tails. We then performed a swap and she had some prime rib and I had some tails.

The sides were great as always, but the star of the dinner is always the meat. As usual, it was as tender and tasty as can be.

My only complaint was that when I had a silver dollar sized piece of meat left, it seemed to have continued to cook and was now medium and not medium rare. This can happen if the meat is taken out of the oven and carved too soon (since it continues to cook for a while). I am sure they would have replaced this piece, but since it was small I declined to ask.

RECOMMENDATION: If you are looking for the best prime rib, look no further. If you are looking for cheap prime rib, look elsewhere. If you love prime rib, and have never eaten here, you are truly missing out.

If I died and went to Heaven it could only be so if it had Lawry's. Cause how could you have a place with eternal bliss if it didn't have the prime rib I had at Lawry's?

My boyfriend took me to Lawry's for the first time on my birthday. The usual fanfare, cool restaurant, reservations and our "good" clothes. I think I was unprepared for how good it was to be. Our server introduced himself and his assistant to us. He then proceeded to recite the entire menu and ask if we had questions. He then took our beverage order and explained he would be back with the salad. My wine showed up along with a nice basket of bread and the evening took off from there.

The salad was quite a show. I didn't think he would actually be spinning the bowl of salad on a bed of ice while he poured the dressing on high. Then he artfully tossed it and plated it while the bowl was still going. I'm not a big fan of romaine and I normally can't stand Iceburg lettuce but this may be the exception. The dressing, chopped egg and the croutons "make" this salad. It disappeared from my plate in a jiffy. I want to note that I think the service was awesome. The timing on everything was uncanny and we never felt rushed or ignored. No sooner than we had finished our salad the the server appeared with the carver and the giant silver cart. We each told the server what we wanted and he relayed our order to the carver. Now I do think it was a bit amusing since I am sure the chef could hear us but I guess it only added to the ambiance of the experience. I would say it was more like the style of the waiter conveying our order to the "kitchen."

So on to the prime rib. I got the Lawry's cut medium rare with a side of creamed corn. I don't think phenomenal is a good enough word to describe the taste explosion I experienced. The beef was tender, juicy and it melted in my mouth. It had a meaty rich taste and the first bite almost caused me to salivate instantly. It was exquisitely medium rare and rested gently in a pool of heavenly au jus. The mashed potatoes and gravy rivaled anything my mom could make (Sorry Mom!) and the creamed corn was like eating the most delicious candy you've ever had. The crown for all of this goodness was a eggy yummy Yorkshire pudding. The outside was crispy and the inside was soft and a giant hunk of it vanished from my plate instantly. I was really pleased that they also gave us both straight up horseradish and the creamy as well. That way I was able to blend just right. If I hadn't been so pleasantly full I would have gone for a dessert. Everything on the dessert menu was simply mouthwatering.

All in all, wonderful service, taste bud shattering food and even though it is a bit pricey really worth it. I will just have to go again.

You wonder what they do with the horses that lose at the track ? They go to Denny's for the steak and egg breakfast. No, only the toughest gristle laden beasts get to pass through Lawry's broiler. At first I thought I needed my teeth sharpening, but I soon realised my full set of incisors and molars was no match for the desert donkey they had cremated to medium rare. The taste ? As gamey as the hookers in the bar, who also looked suitably dry aged. 

Would I return ? Sure , if I developed a sobriety issue and theirs was the last bar on earth.

4 Star food...
5 Star experience

Lawry's is a great middle ground steakhouse (okay, more so prime rib) restaurant for those who want better than the neighborhood Outback but would rather not drop Alexander's-esque money.  In my opinion, the prime rib at Lawry's is in the company of Ruth's Chris and Morton's, all the while being a touch gentler on the pocket book...

The decor is fancy and refined enough to be impressive and date-worthy; valet parking, leather couches  and a stone fireplace adorn the lobby/reception, dim lighting, a mellow bar, a spacious dining room.  All the while, this location in particular [Vegas], also seems open to the casual "propriety be d@mned" customer base probably isn't uncommon for this town...

Service on this night was excellent!  Our server, Ms. Hughes, was fast, attentive, and personable; checking on us throughout the night, taking the ladies' orders first (a nice touch!), serving the ladies first, suggesting accompaniments, pouring our wines... She was matron-like in her charm and attention...

Part of the allure here is the spectacle/show they make of service.  Order wine?  The server pours it for you in with a flamboyant move, cascading a stream of wine from some height into a swirling glass.  The salad course, which is included in the price of any size prime rib entree, is prepared table-side; the server rapidly spins a stainless steel bowl in a large vessel of ice, adding condiments and dressing, gingerly mixing the salad within until the bowl comes to a halt.  

And then there's the prime rib.
Like House of Prime Rib, anticipation of when one of those big chrome carts of prime rib will finally tend to your table helps build your hunger and makes the experience fun.  The cart arrives, the carver wields his blade, and the server asks you "what type of cut and what temperature would you like that?"...its on...!

Now for the price of the prime rib dinner, ranging from $31 for the California Cut, to $34 for the Lawry Cut, to $40(?) for some "this is ridiculous, who can eat all this?" cut... the price also includes the spinning salad, 2 choices of a number of sides, and Yorkshire pudding...

So, if you've already broken the bank on craziness on the strip... Lawry's is a nice escape just a couple blocks off the strip...

This was my fourth or fifth visit to Lawry's, and it surpassed my previous visits overall. The service is always first-class, but this visit seemed to be even more precise and remarkable. The Prime Rib was the moistest, most-tender and delicious its ever been, and that's saying something. Amazing side dishes, including sauteed mushrooms, fluffy mashed potatoes and creamed corn. Great food, service and atmosphere.
Delicous.  Had the Lawry cut which was awesome.  I really liked the Spinach and Creamy corn sides.  The bread was great too.  I liked it better than Mortons Steakhouse.

Let me summarize this way: this restaurant is one block off the center of Las Vegas Strip, and it is only 75% full around 7:30pm on a busy Saturday night, when there is a minimum wait of 30min for some worst buffets on the Strip.

I am a prime rib lover, and go to "House of Prime Rib" in San Francisco 5-6 times a year. It has been told that "House of Prime Rib" is a cheap imitation of Lawry's. So we decide to try the original. We made the reservation 2 month ahead and thought this place would be totally packed like House of Prime Rib on a Saturday night, especially it is right off the strip.

We were 30 min early thinking it gonna be a super busy time for them as our reservation was 7:30pm on a Saturday. Finding it was pretty much empty (about 50-75% full), we asked if it is possible to seat us early. The answer was a firm NO. The reason? "We were fully booked."

At 7:30pm, we were seated promptly. Their menu looks just like House of Prime Rib, except Lawry's has lobster tail and mushrooms. Their price point is almost identical except you have to pay extra ($6) for cream of spinach.

The waitress has funny uniforms, looks more like in a road side diner in 1950s than a fine restaurant. And they forgot our bread (inexcusable for a $50+ per person restaurant).

When they started serving our prime rib, it was 8pm. The restaurant is pretty empty, with about 50-75% full in the dining room, and totally empty in the bar and the waiting area.

The "spinning salad" is not fresh at all. The lettuce looks a little dry and shows a little brown. This was a total disappointment as I love the salads in House of Prime Rib. Lawry's salad dressing is also a little more sour, which tastes like those bought in the supermarket (so much for their world famous salad dressing).

The bright spot is the prime rib. It is fresh, juicy and a total 5 star! But the portion is on the smaller side. My wife and kids ordered the smaller prime rib and it is so small, they finished in 5 minutes. My Lawry cut is pretty decent in size, although still smaller than House of Prime Rib.

Weird thing is that Lawry's does not serve au jus with the prime rib. Hmm, did they forgot it or they just do not serve it?

Their Yorkshire Pudding is a disaster. It is burned and dark. Looks like they did not put any egg in there. Did not taste good.

They neither have choices of how potato is served. Mashed potato only. I love the baked potato from House of Prim Prib :(

Did not ask if they gave second serve of prime rib for free as in House of Prime Rib. Given how we experienced so far, I did not want to embarrass myself by asking the question.

Obviously we won't be back to Lawry's Vegas. Already made reservation for my next trip to House of Prime Rib ...
Old school rules. Go with the lobster bruschetta, if you're lucky enough to be there when it's on the menu.

The location is close to the strip! The prime rib dinner was great and perfect for the price. (Lawry's cut) The service was great, Ms. Pleasant was very sweet and attentive. Highly recommend this location for quality, service and price. You won't be unhappy. Get a reservation just to be sure.

It is always a treat to come here! If you're from LA, you know how crazy busy the Beverly Hills location is! Reservations are easy to come by. The food is always consistent and I LOVE that darn spinning salad! Of course the prime rib is always on point! The kid's menu s $20 which is pretty steep. Ask for Ms. Taylor! She has the best personality and loves her job and the people she works with. :)

I hated my experience in this place, last May 28. 

The sound system was horrible! 

I didn't get a chance to chose the size of my prime rib, they just served me a prime rib without asking me what size I wanted.

YUM. Lawrys is known for its prime rib and now I know why! This was my first time at a lawrys and it did not disappoint. It's located 10 min off the strip next to a bunch of other nice restaurants and casinos. My boyfriend and I ubered there from the Aria, but they also have free valet service if you happen to be driving. 

I called earlier in the day to make a reservation for 7:30 for two. Luckily, we were able to get a spot last minute. The place itself is huge! There's lots of seating, but reservations are recommended. It's good for big and small parties. 

I ordered a glass of Kim Crawford but our waiter recommended a similar wine for around the same price. I decided to go with it, but can't seem to remember the name. It ended up being $18 versus the $15 glass of Kim Crawford. We both got the Lawrys cut prime rib. Each meal comes with their spun salad, mashed potatoes, and Yorkshire pudding. If you're a meat lover definitely get the lawrys cut because it's thicker. You can also get creamed corn or spinach on the side but honestly, the set meal is just enough food. Service was really good although our meal took a while because our server was also helping a huge party before us. Also, it's really good for special occasions! We went for my birthday and they brought out a complementary vanilla bundt cake with peach compote!

We had dinner tonight at  Lawry's Was very disappointed with the portion sizes. We brought another couple with us that have never been to Lawry's and they went along with us when ordering the prime rib Lawry's cut portion. I was shocked when the meat was served to all 4 of us. My wife and I had just ate here 4 weeks ago and we're completely stuffed. As for this trip it was no joke, half the portion. We asked about it and a manage came by and offered us another portion. She then proceeded to offer 4 slices of roast beef sized  prime rib for a sandwich. Just down right embarrassing for us as we ranted over how we lived this place to our friends. My cream of corn was weak this time. The  pictures are from our last visit.

Ok, it's important to realize, right up front, that I do not normally like prime rib. I do prime rib because it's my wife's favorite food. I, on the other hand, would rather have something with a much lower fat content. 

So, that said, I'm annoyed that I can only give Lowry's five stars. I now *understand* the appeal of prime rib. And soaking up that amazing juice with the Yorkshire pudding, getting the gravy from the mashed potatoes all over it.... ungh. If I hadn't been there on a business dinner, I'd have rubbed one out while licking the plate; I seriously have never had meat taste that good in my entire life. My server, Miss Post, was a delight; she explained everything on the menu quite well, made some excellent suggestions (for example - TRY THE STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING - you will not regret it), and was fun and friendly as well. 

Overall, the best dining experience I've had in a LONG, LONG, time.

This is my second time back.  Hands down one of the top 3 restaurants for locals to check out.   Service on key,  Food on key,  very professional.  Prime Rib Lowry Cut is what I ordered it was beyond perfect

This place was wonderful. From the minute u walk in, they take of you. The spinning salad was amazing and the table side prime rib cut  was outstanding. Service was impeccable. It say classy attire but, lots of people in jeans

I came here for my birthday dinner with my parents and sister; they have been coming for years and were so exciting for my sister and me to try it. The staff is great, we were welcomed and attended to very quickly. However, the experience here wasn't all the great. I ordered the California Cut and includes the prime rib, mashed potatoes, yorkshire pudding, and salad. The salad was ok. I didn't really like the dressing and there was more beets than there was lettuce. The worse part, however, was the prime rib. I've had way better prime rib at a way lower price point. The meat was cold, fatty, and lacked flavor. The mashed potatoes just tasted like unsalted butter, with a not too flavorful gravy. The yorkshire pudding wasn't too bad. I did order a side of the buttered peas to go along with my plate and they were great (but you can't really go wrong with making peas). They did bring out a free dessert for my birthday. It was a coconut cake with ice cream, but they poured canned pineapples all over the cake so I was unable to try it because I'm allergic. I expected so much more from Lawry's, but all I got was overpriced bland food. I will not be returning that's for sure!

All I have to say is this.  I am not a beef eater...I do not eat cows. However, I have been known to forego this principle of mine for a night- or two, for Lawry's prime rib.  It is melt-in your mouth good!  And the creamed spinach is delicious!  Love this place.

Fun place to go for sure. Used a deal I saw on TravelZoo so I was presented with a different menu. The only downfall was that our waitress didn't know our deal exactly and I had to keep correcting her. She said they offered a bunch of different deals and I can understand that.

First of all, it's a fun experience as they do prepare some items in front of you (like the spinning bowl salad and ice cream sundae) and you also get to see your cut of meat cut from the bone in front of you. Yum!

Food was delicious, and you get a lot of it. Salad, bread, yorkshire pudding (which was a first), mashed potatoes and of course, huge prime rib. We also received a side and 2 desserts with our deal. I had to roll out of the place. 

Overall, the basis of old fashioned service and high quality food was a great combo. I would definitely recommend this place for a nice evening off the strip.

Pricey dinner with delicious beef wellington and excellent service by Ms. Bonner. However someone at our table said their prime rib was tough and fatty. The worst part of the evening belonged to  the valet parking company. The valets couldn't find the fob to my car, claimed I never gave it to them and asked me to check my pockets. I took off my jacket, checked my pants and coat pockets, knowing full well I had given it to the attendant. A pair of panicked valets said they would "double-check" the automobile and turned up nothing. I walked outside to my vehicle, which was locked, an action that cannot be taken without the fob. I explained this to yet another manager who claimed, "Some cars can be locked with the fob left inside the vehicle." After about 30 minutes of watching confused valets run around the parking lot, I realized they were trying to open the wrong car! This is after they did the same thing to another member of our dinner party!  If you go, park your own car or take a cab.

Lawrys prime rib house where do I begin! This place is A+ when it comes to there food and service. I definitely recommend the Brady cut. Actually all cuts are good from California cut to the big bowl cut.

Really good prime rib. Huge portions. It's a nice way to get off the strip for a little while especially if you're traveling with people who can't have conversations while the option of gambling is hanging in front of their faces. 

The salad is delicious. The California cut was still to large for me but that's definitely not a bad thing.

Its all about the experience - Always the best in service and quality. That's why I go to Lawry's. I'm From Chicago and 1st time around Lawry's in Vegas. Our waiter Lou Williams was patient and informative and made our night very Special! I think Brooke was helping him and she was bubbly and upbeat too. Will visit Lawry's always in every city in visit.

I went in knowing what to expect.  Classic menu, a little old-fashioned in every way.  The bruschetta was decent, so were the sides.  We got asparagus and mashed potatoes.  We all got prime rib, which was yummy.  3.5 stars, so I'm rounding up.

Fantastic!!!  Great service and the food is 100% amazing!!!
$14 sandwich is enough for 2 people.  An absolute treat.

From the time I made the reservation over the phone with Fernando arriving to our booth and being served by William and the Prime tray Chef Andrew until we got our car by the valley guy every and each person was outstanding! They made us welcome and treated us very nicely in a friendly way. We enjoyed every minute of our time of celebration. Honestly The food was cooked great and served at our booth - the portion was big and everything tasted fantastic! Best dinner experience! Highly recommended! Thank you guys for making my dads birthday very special! We all felt that these people had a lot of love in their heart working hard!

Fancy a fancy night out? This may be the place to go. 
I remember a little bit about coming here as a kid. It was a time i had to wear those shoes with the fluffy socks. Now as an adult I was were socks with polka dots but you could see them under my boot. This is a fancy place, we talking jackets and dress. The also have a small valet outside if you're feeling like a VIP. We however self parked and walked through the revolving door. We checked in with the hostess and maybe waited 5 minutes. While be walked to the table they were being really courteous. Asking us questions like if we lived here and if we were celebrating anything. Of course we were just here to stuff our face. :) 
We sat down and already had an idea of what we were ordering. We went with the Diamond Jim Brady Cut. It's an extra thick portion. Me and my friend decided to split everything. They started with the salad. This was so fun to watch. It's a spinning bowl and they pour the dressing in and mix. After finishing the salad they brought the prime rib station over. They cut our piece and gave us an extra plate. They asked us how we wanted it cooked and we said medium well and we kinda got medium. We just ate it anyways, not a huge deal. The prime rib came with mashed potatoes and Yorkshire Pudding. The pudding is like bread and by itself is good but dipping in the juice and potatoes with some seasoning was very tasty. My favorite part of the whole entire meal was the seasoning pepper. I have a slight addiction to pepper and I was not disappointed with this all over my salad and even a little on my prime rib. We also order a side of scalloped potatoes and asparagus. The asparagus weren't cooked enough for me, but the scalloped potatoes were a mouthwatering side. With our dinners we had a ginger ale and a glass of wine. We order a mocato and it was the best I've had. We asked for the name again and the server wrote it down for us. She was so sweet. She explained everything to us and gave us the rundown on the menu too. We ended our meal with creme brulee. It was topped with fruit and probably the only good picture I took. The hard caramel was left for last to enjoy and savor..  We left full and were really happy with our choice to dine for the evening.

Prime rib is the best! It's very tender. 
Served with mashed potato and Yorkshire pudding. 

Lobster is good too. 

Service by Mr. Caseri was awesome. He was very attentive. Made my first visit remarkable.

There are so many things I love about this restaurant. 
We go when friends are in town or for special occasions and it never fails to deliver great food and excellent service. 
And on top of it all.... you can bring your own wine for a corkage fee of $10. 

The prime rib is fantastic... best in town, I think. Mind you... I only have prime rib like twice a year and one of those times it's at Lawry's so take that for what it's worth. 

The spinning salad is really cool to watch being prepared but the salad itself is just "ok"... nothing super special. I'm not going to Lawry's for the salad so it's not a deal breaker. 

The side of mushrooms are awesome but I wasn't all that impressed by the side of asparagus... it seemed small compared to everything else we ordered to share and they were salty on too which was odd. 
Mash potatoes, cream spinach, yorkshire bread for dipping... all fantastic.
