I'm not sure why we ordered the sampler dessert... but we did even though we were all stuffed....can't say that anything on the sampler plate was anything all that great. So, what I'm saying is... don't bother with dessert... just enjoy the prime rib dinner.

First review posted from 30K feet.

Outstanding food and service. I've been to Lawry's in the past, but this is the first time I got the ribeye instead in the prime rib (pretty much the same thing just cooked differently). I got the 24 oz. bone-in. OMG. In the top three steaks I've ever eaten. Will return.
This was my first visit to a Lawry's. The food and service were excellent. I would defiantly return. You can get prime rib exactly the way you want it cooked.

Great prime rib and the service was top notch. I had never been to this location prior to tonight and I've only gone to the Lawry's Carvery in Los Angeles. I was really amazed by the level and detail to service at this location.

I booked this location for our annual company dinner that being said this review will only cover large party service (60+)

The location is a few miles off the strip with valet parking. Lawry's boasts a very House of Prime Rib (San Francisco) look and feel.  Decorated in old school steakhouse fashion with dark woods and antique decor.  The staff is dressed in full uniform with the females wearing what looked like to me WWII nurse outfits complete with the little white hat.  I understand this is supposed to add to the charm of the location but for me it made me feel like I was in a hospital.

Our function was located in one of the two private rooms.  Lawry's has one room with fits up to 70 and another room for parties greater than 70.  I found the mismatched chairs at the tables odd and cheesy looking.  We had picked one of the set banquet options which included: appetizers, famous salad, bread, one vegetable, prime rib, chicken or salmon and dessert.  Upgrades for meat size, shrimp cocktails and lobster tails were also available.  The base price of this dinner was pretty reasonable in the $65 range per person.  

The appetizers were quite good with chicken satay, mozzarella tomato skewers and mushroom bruschetta being served. Servers carried platters around to each table and visited each table at least three times.  A big part of the charm of Lawry's is the presentation ie the mixing of the salad and slicing of your prime rib from the huge rolling meat station.  Unfortunately since this was a big party we really didn't get to enjoy that aspect of the meal.  The creamed corn, mashed potatoes and Yorkshire pudding were all delicious.  The salad lacked flavor most likely the dressing was not strong enough.  Several people at our table ordered the lobster tail and they were all terrible.  We actually had to ask Lawry's to remove them from our tab as they were small chewy and just not fresh.  The prime rib was good but not great.  My 16 oz cut had way to much gristle making a large portion of it inedible.  Two people on my table ordered the 22 oz cut and they didn't look anything alike!  One cut being much larger than the other.  Desert was chocolate molten cake and it was so sweet I could not eat it.  Dinner also included tea, coffee or milk.  The coffee was strong and tasty.

For now I am assuming the quality of our meal was impacted by the fact we had a large banquet type service and rating this experience 3 stars. Overall the wait staff provided excellent drink and meal service and combined with Lawry's customer awards program this is a solid choice for your company function.
I loved it. Its different then the usual prime rib in that its bone in, but the service was great and you get to see them slice that bad boy off the roaster. Wouldn't have it any other way.

Very yummy Prime Rib.  Nice and tender.  I come from San Fransisco Area and it's ALOT better than that "Other" place in The City.  I loved the service and the old style charm.  Second time here and more defiantly will be coming back.

it was ok.  very simliar to house of prime rib but the meal doesn't come with two sides.  salad wasn't that good either.  the best part was the bread.  it was warm, soft in the middle and crispy on the outside.  that was yummy.  the dining area looked like a hotel meeting room.  looked a little too modern for my taste.
i'm glad lawry's not in sf and that i get to go to house of prime rib instead.  and don't go to broadway prime.  it's worse than lawry's.  trying to copy but can't get it right.

I came here with a group of co-workers and definitely enjoyed the prime rib! Their horseradish sauce is not quite as flavorful as I hoped, but the cut was delicious. Since it's prime rib, everything is done a little bit more, which means that I got a nice and pink rare slice. The sides were REALLY delicious. The prime rib comes with the mashed potatoes, but there is an extra cost for the creamed corn and creamed spinach. Both are fantastic and I loved it, but just know that it will add to your bill.

The ambiance is nice with the waitstaff in costume. It feels pretty homey and would be a nice place to go if you want some steak but wan't an atmosphere that is different from the casinos and the strip.

First, let me say that I am usually not a fan of places that really focus on the presentation of the food, as they usually tend to disappoint me with the actual food.  Lawry's The Prime Rib does well with both.  I was there entertaining clients, and they were impressed by the comfortable dining room, as well as the food.

The Pros:
- Comfortable dining room
- Great meal (All inclusive dinner with salad and potato side)  addl sides cost extra.
- Affordable compared to Del Friscos or Mortons
The Cons:
- If I am going to nit pic - Selection is limited, but you should know that going in if the place is called The Prime Rib
Simply fantastic! The service, the food, and the decor are like nothing else. Don't come here often but when we do its a treat.

Amazing Prime Rib! This place never disappoints! Excellent food & service. Great wine selection and the food is amazing. I also go to Lawry's in Beverly Hills and always leave both locations with such a positive dining experience. Spinning Salad, Prime Rib, Yorkshire Pudding, Baked Potato, Steamed Asparagus....Yum! English Trifle dessert is excellent. 

Side note...join the Lawry's VIP Club, it's well worth it!

Everytime I am in Las Vegas, I HAVE to eat at Lawry's The Prime Rib.  I love the atmosphere, the whole "old school English" style setup, and the food is sooo yummy.  I always get the California cut and am so excited for the spinning bowl salad.  It's delicious.  The mashed potatoes and gravy are one of my favorites.  For dessert I always get the English triffle to go because I'm too full from dinner.  The service is always phenomenal and the prices are reasonable.

Our whole trip to Vegas for Thanksgiving weekend was based on the idea of having Lawry's for dinner.  Have been to Lawry's in both Vegas and LA a few times over the years... and always a good meal.  But this time... not so much.  I have prime rib... and it was good but not great.  Wife had the turkey dinner... which was mediocre and wasn't served with all the sides (missing the cranberries) and by the time we got a visit from our server... meal was pretty much done.  Also ordered the pumpkin pie... it was horrible.  On the bright side... the kids got to eat in a classy restaurant for their first time (ages 8 and 5) and did fine... but wouldn't consider this place kid friendly.  Several close calls with the drinks in tall glasses.

Mmmm, so very good....

It's a beautiful restaurant, with a quaint 1950's glamor and style to it.  There is a complimentary valet parking, and there's a waiting room was plush with beautiful and immaculate furniture.  The host was very nice, and we were seating almost immediately.  

The table was just the right size for our party of 6.  The waitress was a mature lady, dressed nicely, and was to be addressed as Mrs. Tremble, as she informed us.  She was very explanatory in all the aspects of their unique restaurant, and kindly offered us our drinks after a brief pause, giving us just enough time to consider what to order.  

The service was very prompt, and the drinks were served nicely in beautiful glassware.  At some restaurants, the service sort of deteriorates if we don't order such things as appetizers, but Mrs. Tremble was gracious in everything we ordered and everything we didn't.  

They started first with their famous spinning salad.  It was nothing short of stunning, and it was worth coming for just that.  Next they served the prime rib, sliced fresh at the table.  My cut was served perfectly at medium rare, and I had an order of the creamed spinach, which in my opinion wasn't quite as creamed as I'd have liked, but still really good.   The mashed potatoes were delicious, but not the best I've ever had.  The centerpiece here is clearly the prime rib, and here it did not disappoint.  

The occasion was my brother's graduation from high school, and when the reservation was made, they asked immediately what the occasion was.  And after the meal was over, my brother was given a complimentary dessert, with "Congratulations" on the plate.  

I'd highly recommend Lawry's for any special occasion, though it might be a little bit pricey to go without an occasion.  Give it a shot, but expect to pay a little under $50 a person.

Lawry's is by far my FAVORITE prime rib place. So coming from LA on a mini vacation I had to dine here. My typical location is the one in Beverly Hills. Well this location here in Vegas did not disappoint either. Food was delicious, service was on point, and did I mention complimentary valet parking?! I'm used to the BH location which charges for parking I believe like 8$? Not sure on the exact price (obviously it's always courteous to tip the valet guys). California cut is always my go to menu item so that's exactly what I ordered. The cut had such a perfect texture, flavor, and was like heaven in my mouth. My two favorite sides (that are at an extra cost) are the cream of spinach and cream of corn. Totally worth the extra money for those. My favorite aspect about this restaurant is how the Prime Rib is cut at the table side. The man cleaning up the dishes/filling waters was also great! My cup was never empty he made sure that I always had enough water throughout my meal and cleared out any excess plates. My server was amazing as well, believe his name was Drew? This place is definitely worth the money, I love it.

Well this probably isn't a fair review, but we didn't even go inside because the sign outside said you had to be dressed in certain attire. I would not doubt that it is a high class restaurant, but in 107 degree weather I was not in any mood to put on my Sunday best. Guessing they can pay the rent fine if they don't need vacationers to stop in.
That's all, we ended up at the Outback Steakhouse and probably had a much better lunch, since we didn't have to worry about what to wear...seriously how outdated can you be?

Amazing! We had a large group and had the private room. Mrs. Ingrassi (I hope that was her name) was the best waitress. She was so great with my fussy nephews. I've never had such outstanding service anywhere before. 
Now the food...the prime rib was melt in your mouth! Perfection. I hate cream corn and that was the best cream corn. I could eat it again. Cheesecake was incredible. I also got a creme brûlée. So good. Just amazing.

I got the California Cut and my BF got the "Diamond Jim Brady" Cut, which was absolutely crazy huge. Spinning salad was awesome, the Yorkshire pudding was surprisingly good, Mash Potatoes were like what you normally would expect a fine dining restaurant, and creamy horseradish was also great (if you like horseradish). Everything was yummy! We also added lobster to the mix which was awesome with the butter and lemon! YUM!!! 

Always a good choice for dining!

On our occasional visits to Las Vegas over the years we have made it a point to dine at Lawry's ever since a colleague introduced us to this place many moons ago.

We love the prime rib, décor, and the service - as well as the rolling steam table with service tableside - it's great, and a special treat these days.

The sides are always delicious, too.  The side salad, freshly prepared, mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, sautéed mushrooms, popovers, are all delicious and great quality. 

On this visit, (8PM reservation on a Friday evening) I ordered the Beef Wellington "to try it" and it was very tasty, generously portioned, and came with a very nice potatoes au gratin and nice mushroom sauce.  It was great but in the future I think I will stick to the Prime Rib - the main reason Lawry's steakhouses are so successful, after all:-)

Also, our server quickly and professionally averted disaster, as he'd had the carver serve my husband his Prime Rib before my plate had come from the kitchen.  When they walked away, I knew we were counting the seconds until I got my plate and my husband (ever the gentleman!) could start eating.  As it happened, the second the server arrived with my plate and my husband's Yorkshire Pudding, he took one quick look at my husband and said, "Let me make you a fresh plate", and my husband replied, "Thanks for making things right!"

We finished off with the famous Banana Cream Pie and hot coffee.  A delightful end to our meal.

The valet was very friendly and helpful, too, in calling us a cab after dinner.

One special note:  There is a sign at the entrance which suggest "appropriate attire" - as it should be.  Lawry's is a special place with a great dining experience.  However, we noticed LOTS of guests in novelty T-shirts, cut offs, and flip flops. It really detracts from the dining experience.  And another interesting observation - the folks exiting the restaurant and driving cars were nicely dressed - the car thing makes me think that most of them were local residents.  The "sloppily" dressed guests were bring picked up - making me think they were tourists.

As a tourist myself - a suggestion:  Folks, when visiting Las Vegas  Lawry's - show a little class with the wardrobe selections, okay?

And everyone should know, other than that, it was a very good experience.  We will definitely return again.

The food is awesome but the presentation and ambiance is even better. We had a large group and the service was superb.  It was an amazing and unique experience and we will certainly be back on our next visit to Vegas.

Now if the name Lawry's rings a bell - yes you have seen the name before. Lawry's garlic salt, Lawry's seasonings, etc.. found in your local grocery store. So yes one and the same. 

I have eaten at this place 2 times, once last year, and the year before that. Both times all I can remember is being stuffed full, and taking home leftovers both times! 

The atmosphere puts you back to the turn of the 20th century times a bit. It definitely gets filled up, so holding conversations do become a little difficult when it gets noisy.

You are brought out a salad which is mixed, spun, and served all table side. For the Prime Rib (which is MOST recommended to order from the menu, as they are famous for it here). You get served table side - and are offered a choice of wellness done. All carved and served table side from a fancy rolling serving cart, and you are allowed to pick your sides which are also on the cart. You are served Yorkshire pudding to help mop up the extra gravy bits. 

The meat - is melt in your mouth. So tender and full of flavor! You get two varieties of horseradish - hot or creamed - both full of zest and good bite.

I don't remember all the details from here - since it has been such a long while coming here, but the service you get is great! The staff are very pleasant, and aiming to please in every aspect.

So definitely another top notch place to eat.

Pretty disappointed ate here last week it wasn't great. Food was excellent but the service was horrendous. Waiter took forever to get out drinks and he kept looking the other way when I was talking to him. Talk about rude. This was the first and last time going to lawrys Las Vegas.

Very good food, great service. Steaks were served at ordered temperatures, a good vehicle for their salt blend and fresh horseradish. Calamari perfectly tender and light. Potatoes buttery, a few lumps but not unpleasant. Walked in on a Friday night around 6:30 for a table for four and were able to be sat immediately. The restaurant seemed to fill up quickly, but emptied equally fast. The prime rib is served on rolling carts with accompaniments. Table side salad service. Great mixed drinks. Good desserts. Booths are a little tight and uncomfortable if you are tall/bigger. Very clean with Art Deco style. Service staff dress in period clothing consistent with the theme. Expensive.

OK, so House of Prime Rib (HOPR) in San Francisco is basically my gold standard for prime rib. I had such high hopes for Lawry's since it's the same premise and they are also supposed to be well known for their prime rib. Sadly, it just didn't measure up at all.

The restaurant is super old school, with lots of wood and large booths. Our server was nice and explained everything since we were newbies. All prime rib dinners come with their spinning salad bowl, bread, mashed potatoes, yorkshire pudding and horseradish. Creamed corn and spinach are extras here, while they are included at HOPR. 

We ended up with two lawry's cut and one ribeye. One of the lawry's cuts came with a bone, while the other didn't. Not sure why. The 24 oz. ribeye was massive, and came with a huge pile of friend onions and scalloped potatoes. I thought both the mashed potatoes and prime rib were pretty bland. Had to add salt to both. The prime rib was just ok, not as tender or flavorful as I was expecting. Also, the creamed spinach wasn't very creamy and lacked flavor too. Overall, I think Lawry's is ok for the price, but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here.
Beat the dinner crowd with a Prime Rib lunch. What a great experience. Diamond Jim cut was sensational. Service great.

Awesome prime rib, creamed corn, Yorkshire pudding, spinning salad, bread basket, creme brûlée. I just wish I had more opportunities and money and calories to eat there! Old fashioned inside but classy not hokey. Beverly Hills does not have a kids menu but the Vegas one has chicken fingers for finicky kids like mine.

A real treat when in Vegas!  Great service by Ms. Williams (Brandy), delicious food.... full meal includes prime rib carved at your table, spinning salad prepared for us by Ms. Williams, Yorkshire pudding, mashed potatoes and sour dough bread. Loved it all.  We will definitely be back.

I came here with some business partners during a show.   Granted EVERY nice restaurant in Vegas was booked up during the show, but we waited for over 45 mins even with reservation.  I do have to say there is a lounge/bar area that you can sit and have a drink while you wait, but over 45 mins with prior reservation is still too long in my opinion.

I have to sat the restaurant was packed when we say down, but it still took about 10-15 mins for the waitress to come and greet us.

Ok so we went for our anniversary and they made us feel special by adding a ribbon on the table so they knew we were celebrating. I was so excited for the prime rib, but I was a little disappointed. Maybe it's because we went real late and the food didn't taste fresh and hot, well the prime rib at least. Sides were good nothing too extravagant. The cut of the prime rib was great but it wasn't hot and it didn't taste fresh. It got cold real fast. 

Service was ok. Felt like server couldn't wait to go home felt kinda rushed. We got the surf and turf lobster tails. 

I would like to try this place again maybe early dinner when everything is fresh. 

Great touch by adding complementary dessert for our anniversary.

We've never gone out for Thanksgiving dinner, but found ourselves traveling for the first time this year...but that was ok because we were made to feel very much at home at Lawry's.  

This was just a great meal.  Table was great.  Service was flawless.  Food was, as always, superb.  Lawry's is an island of civility in the sea of chaos that Las Vegas is.

By Las Vegas standards, the price was fair.  An enormous amount of very high quality food, fresh, hot and delicious.  We were very impressed that they offered my 11 year old daughter a "childs portion", which included drink and desert and an entree portion almost identical to the "california cut" for less than half the price.  A nice accomodation not seen often anymore.

To me, Lawry's is and always will be the anti-Vegas.  I make it a point to visit there on every trip.

Cheers.
One particular thing that stood out

Another great dining experience this past Veterans Day weekend.  What can you expect from Lawry's.  Been to their Five Crowns restaurant in Corona Del Mar, their Lawry's location in Beverly Hills, and their Tam O'Shanter restaurant in Los Angeles.  All excellent.  You can't beat Lawry's Prime Rib for prime rib.  Service was excellent too.

We tried the house of prime rib in San Francisco a few months ago and wanted to look for something similar close to home. We came on a Friday for lunch around 12:30, it was quiet and not busy at all. The lunch prices were definitely a lot cheaper. We ordered the English cut- their thin sliced prime rib. the waitress told us it was also one of her favorites because it melts in your mouth tender. She was right! The best cut ever, and with three pieces plus sides, it was more than enough food. The only exception for lunch is no salad, but you can order that a la crate. Only $26 for our cut was definitely a deal for lunch. I knocked off one star because I prefer a baked potato rather than mash with creamed spinach and creamed corn. It made it all seem too mushy. Also the Yorkshire pudding could've been bigger. Over all the dining experience and place was very nice.

Celebrated my 40th birthday here with my family!  A special dinner during a special weekend.  Not only do I think Lawry's has the best Prime Rib I've ever had but I think the way the restaurant is ran, it's one of the best overall restaurant experiences.  The Prime Rib sits in a cart that is brought to your table and sliced individually.  The waitress was extremely polite and impressive.  I can't afford to eat here often but I do believe treating yourself every once in a while is required.  Make reservations early.  We didn't get to go the night we initially wanted due to the popularity.

Amazing amazing prime rib that melts in your mouth!  When you walk into this restaurant, it's like a trip back in time.  The decor does not look like it has changed since their earlier days.  They did a great job keeping up the quality of the decor.  The waitressing staff wears the same attire from the late 1950's.  Our waitress was a pleasant older lady wearing something crossed between a french maid and a waitress.  My husband and I both ordered the California Cut that came with yorkshire pudding and mashed potatoes.  We also ordered the cream corn and asparagus.  Our salad was simple with a delicious french dressing (which I usually do not like french dressing- but this one was tasty and refreshing).  It also came with pickled beets that I surprisingly enjoyed.  She hand spun our salad table side which was nice because she gave us a quick history of the restaurant and we learned where the recipe for yorkshire pudding originated.  

The master carvers pushed their huge  shiny metal carts to our table.  Ours in particular was wearing a shiny gold medallion around his neck indicating that he completed a master carving school.  LOL This meant we would be guaranteed a perfect cut of prime rib.  I found all this presentation impressive and slightly comical, but Oh Boy did our master carver deliver.  He executed our cuts tableside.  Our prime rib cut was delicious and plentiful drenched in perfect gravy.  They serve on the side 2 Lawry's seasonings and 2 horseradich options.  I preferred the strong one that makes your nostrils burn (so good).  The mashed potatoes were very creamy.  My first bite of the prime rib was heavenly and I could almost hear the heralds singing.  Then I tried the yorkshire pudding which is like a soft but perfectly browned bread pudding/roll.  The proper way to eat it is by dipping it in the meat juices/gravy.  This was so delicious.  This is my first experience with yorkshire pudding.  I never really knew what it was & I am so glad I have experienced it finally at the age of 32.  Wow I was missing out!

The creamed corn was cream and well made.  The asparagus was perfectly steamed and not too soft.  

We went there for our 5th wedding anniversary.  A nice surprise at the end was when they brought out a beautiful strawberry cheesecake.  It was perfectly creamy & topped of our after dinner sweet tooth nicely.  I found this very thoughtful and left a great impression.  

I woke up the next day wanting more Prime Rib from Lawry's.  I cannot wait for my next trip back.  I will hopefully check out the LA location in the future.

It's nice to get away from the flashing lights and the 'ding-ding-dings' of slot machines to enjoy a great dinner.

The decor was upscale and the staff  very friendly--they accomodated our table of 12 with ease.  Instead of separating us, or seating us at a rectangular table, we had the pleasure of sitting at a large round table. This was great because everyone could now converse with one another.  All the waitresses and carvers were fully clad in traditional attire--they all looked like busy pilgrims.

Everybody ordered their signature Prime Rib, but I opted for their 16 oz Bone-In Rib Eye. The meal was preceded by a salad that our waitress prepared in a very special way--she spun a metal bowl over ice, mixing in the salad and dressing as it rotated.  After everyone devoured their salad, the real feast began..

My eyes widened as I stared at the gargantuan plate of food set in front of me. The Rib Eye was HUGE! This slab of meat was cooked to perfection, slightly blackened on the outside, but tender and pink on the inside.  Instead of mashed potatoes, I received Au-Gratin Potatoes and  Crisp Fried Onions, which were much better than the traditional mashed spuds. I also had a few bites of their Prime Rib-- it was almost as delicious as my Rib Eye. The Prime Rib was moist and flavorful, but I preferred the smokier taste of the Rib Eye. Creamed Corn and Sauteed Mushrooms were the best dinner accompaniments one could ask for, definitely a must-have! 

As for dessert....well,  I didn't have any. In fact, nobody did. This hearty feast left no room in our stomachs for dessert.

Wow, did I really go to the same place as all the other Yelpers?!  I feel it my civic duty to add my 2 cents. 

As a disclaimer, my husband and I enjoy a good prime rib.  We used to live in the Bay Area and frequented HOPR in SF.  Our options are limited in SD and thus we arrived at Lawry's Vegas looking forward to a nice piece of meat!

The service was just eh for the price you're paying.  Our waitress at one point came over and excused herself to "need to attend to something" before taking our order.  She then immediately went to the table across from us and chatted up the couple and their child, who sat down 10 minutes after us, for a good 15-20 minutes!!   She obviously knew them and was in no hurry to tend to us.  The one star she gets was the fact they noted it was my husbands birthday and thus brought out a comp dessert.  

The food was rather mediocre as well.  The salad was rather bland and non-descript.  As per usual Lawry's style, the prime rib is served straight from the carving cart at your table.  The meat was actually a little cold - I guess that's what happens when the restaurant is more than half empty.  The flavor of the prime rib was also quite lacking.    My cut was especially tough (despite being "medium rare") - you know when you chew a piece of bad meat and just have to chew and chew and chew until your jaw is sore and then finally you can swallow?  So incredibly disappointing.  On top of that paying Vegas prices for sub par food.  

Do yourself a favor and PASS on this chain establishment in Vegas.

One word describes Lawrys: MOO!! OMG best Prime Rib I've ever had.  I asked where the steak knives were and the waitress said we didn't need them.  She be right!  
Restaurant is very nice and I wish I had known that as I felt underdressed.  

I am local so ordered the Jim Brady size.  It was enough for 3 meals.  The sides were excellent as well and they gave me extra gravy and au jus which I hoarded.  Get your mitts off my private gravy bowl!  Two horseradishes, one grated from the root and one creamed.  YUM! 
We also had dessert.  Divide a dessert.  The pie my husband had was huge.  Banana Coconut Cream. Sigh! 

With a bottle of wine and 2 desserts for 3 was $275.  Was worth every single dollar and every single tender bite.

Well this is it. If you want prime rib, you won't find it better anywhere. I'm quite the enthusiast of this cut of meat. It makes the world a better place and me a happy boy. Lawry's will not, cannot disappoint. I love the atmosphere, the waitstaff, the presentation (yeah, the giant wheeled silver eggs are something else...) and most importantly, the food. Wow...just perfection. Are you going to pay for the meal? Yes, but you'll also remember it for quite some time.

Lawry's The Prime Rib... Where do I start? So I have never really been a huge fan of prime rib however I was afforded the opportunity to come here with my company for an awards dinner. I have always seen those Lawry's seasonings in the store and perhaps even used some while cooking before. When I arrived it pulled into valet and was kindly greeted by one of the valet attendants! They do offer complimentary valet so why not? Self parking is also an option for those of you who may be wondering, it's located near the back of the restaurant. The ambiance of the place is pretty cool! 

Our company had already selected some dishes that we may choose from. We started off with trays of appetizers one of them which was a smoked salmon on a cracker bread type thing and the other was some sort of taquito type of thing. Next up they brought out plates of "The Famous Original Spinning Bowl Salad" which was fantastic! Some people at my table didn't really like the egg taste it had however I loved it. For my main course I selected the Atlantic Salmon.  I know I know, who the hell comes to a place that's known for it's Prime Rib and get's some damn fish?! Ha! Me! But I had a plan and that was to order this fish AND eat off my co-workers plate to try their prime rib! Sharing is caring remember? Let's talk about how they bring out this cool oven like carving station kind of thing. That was pretty fascinating! The severs were all very pleasant and I thought that the uniforms were umm idk like are they were maids/pilgrims/omish type of theme. Talk about attentive! My glass stayed full of water and for those who ordered any other kind of beverage they never let it stay empty! Once the food came out those of us who ordered fish received ours first and the others who had prime rib had to wait since the type of temperature of how the prime rib was cooked would be different for each person. My Atlantic Salmon was delicious and the fresh asparagus it came with was a great pair! As far as the Prime Rib, I got to try medium well and also medium. Both were good however I would opt for medium IF I was to ever return for another dining experience. The creamed spinach was amazing! We closed the night out with their signature Crème Brulee and it was amazing! All in all it was a great experience and I would love to come back sometime in the near future!

3.5 stars.

I had really high hopes given the stellar reviews, but I didn't really think it was that great. While I can see the appeal of having the prime rib sliced table-side, I thought it gave it a cheap buffet line carving station feel. The prime rib was good, but nothing extraordinary. It satisfied the red meat craving, but that's about it. I don't often get prime rib as it's not my favorite cut of steak, so the only means of comparison I have is The Prime Rib in DC, and Lawry's didn't come close to comparing. The bread pudding type stuff that they serve with the prime rib was delicious though; I have no idea what was in that stuff, but I ate almost the whole skillet meant to be shared with my husband.

The waitress was friendly, though I found it weird that they had to introduce themselves as Ms. ____. What is this, pre-school? And their uniforms looked sort of like flight attendant uniforms, and not in a sexy Vegas sort of way, more like a flight attendant meets Mary Poppins sort of way.

By far our best steakhouse in Vegas!  We go there every time we are in town and are never disappointed!  Can't wait for the next time. I'm a very picky meat eater and their prime rib is always tender, well cooked and tasty!  Their creamed corn is to die for, salad is awesome and mashed potatoes are great!  Love, love, love!

I and a bunch of  friends went to Lawry's in August of 2016.  We were sorta impressed -but not really - you know - that impression?  It supposed to be pure perfection - but there were slip ups.  The prime rib wasn't knock your socks off great.  We had to send back a ribeye that was rare - not over medium as ordered.  And a couple of other minor details were lacking - but all in all - not bad at all.  You can tell there are a lot of regulars that repeat visits to the joint - the staff greeted them by name - nice touch!  There is a valet right at the door and he was on it with the car situation.  I thought the desserts were pretty damn good!  The restaurant is beautiful inside - there is a separate bar near the entrance.  Nice!  I just was not blown away like I expected to be!

This place was absolutely the best!! I ordered the end cut of the prime rib and it was tender ,medium rare and loaded with flavor!!! the creamed spinach and mashed potatoes were phenomenal as well. Mrs. Amirr was one of the best waitresses I've ever had. This place was so very busy but the managers were running around and helping wherever they could. A total team effort!! Thank You Lawry's , we definitely will be back soon!

Worker at the Casino recommended this place. I ordered the Prime Rib. It was good but it was $42!!! I can get a prime rib special anywhere in Vegas for $10 and just as good. Bottom line, the place is good but way to expensive.

Who's not a fan of Lawry's Prime Rib? They never disappoint - service or food. I'd say the Beverly Hills location beats the Vegas location, though. Because you get free meatballs and chips at the Beverly Hills location! The place is big- lots of seats. There's a full bar in the front near the lobby, so you can grab a few drinks while you wait - you're in vegas! Drink up!  

I've always had a great experience here. Affordable, fine dining.

I had very high expectations for this place and unfortunately they were not met. 

1.) Waited almost 30 minutes after our reservation time, as did most people there. Which is fine, I see that reservations for them are more like call aheads. 

2.) TAYLOR our waitress was extremely rude and condescending. She also has a very in your face personality and is unprofessional at times. SHE IS THE REASON WE WILL MOST LIKELY NOT GIVE THIS PLACE A 2ND CHANCE!!!

3.) Waited very long to be greeted, have our order taken, to be checked on after we received our food, and for our check. 

4.) no explanation of how the menu worked so we started ordering and then were told no that's not how it is and then still gave us a careless, hurried explanation of how the process is. 

5.) there was a misunderstanding with the check that the waitress admitted that it was her fault, but still spoke to us with disdain in her voice as if we were inconveniencing her. 

Food was okay. Prime rib was above average. Mash potatoes, creamed spinach, mushrooms all average. Lobster & bread were delicious. 

Service to me is just as important as the food. After this I don't think I could ever go back and if I do I will definitely make sure Taylor is not our waitress.

Before I start with this review I have to say that my expectations were extremely high because I've heard so much about this place.  Lawry's was very good, don't get me wrong, but it is a lot of fattening food in an odd way of serving it.  

The server was super friendly.  I think her name was Michelle.  I don't know why because I have the worst memory ever but that name comes to me.  The potatoes were great and the prime rib was delicious.  The outfits had to go though because it negates any ambiance that the place could possess.  It really does alter the feel of the place.  The creamed corn - I was unimpressed!  It wasn't BAD, it's just that not only have I had better (at maestro's), I found a recipe online that blows this creamed corn away.  It was too thick almost like it had been sitting on a burner.  

All in all, the food was very delicious, just not something I could eat on a regular basis!
When paying $45 for a 10oz. prime rib, I do not expect to be served out of a cart wheeled  to my table. I expect the food to be brought from the kitchen. That really cheapened the experience, IMO.

After more than a decade still my all time favorite prime rib spot.  Love how they keep the traditions and you can expect to get the same experience and quality every time.  Wish we had one in the bay.  For now I'll have to visit Vegas and LA when I have the craving.

I love this place. Ms. Pleasant our server she was AMAZING. We went here for a birthday celebration and what a wonderful job they did. I am glad that this restaurant is always on top of their game. If not they know how to fix it. Thank you for being my favorite restaurant.

So I went here with a large group and we sat in a large round table in their dinning room.  A bit noisy but that didn't bother me because of how good the food was.  

Their spinning salad and potato were good, nothing special, but the fact that you get a salad and potato with your steak is pretty good, compared to other places like Ruth Chris.  

I'm a sucker for really good prime rib because you just can't duplicate it at home.  I got one of the larger bone in cuts,  which was absolutely amazing.  So juicy and flavorful.  Everyone who got the normal cuts seemed to enjoy theirs.  A couple of my friends got end cuts, which I'm not a fan of, and they both said the ends were some of the best steaks they ever had.  They also have a "ribeye" which is a cut of prime rib that is then cooked like a steak.  Had a bite of that and have to say I may have a tough decision next time I am there.

Overall it was a great dinner, and I will be back.

Another place where we exploited the company credit card, having prime rib slabs cut tableside at Lawry's is one of the best meals you can have in Vegas. Pair it with creamed spinach and mashed potatoes and you'll be more than satisfied.

The service is great, as is customary at Lawry's. They basically set the standards for everyone else back in the day.

Wow this place is orgasmic. YOU, ME, and the PRIME RIB.. threesome, yeah?! What happens in Vegas becomes a Yelp Review for 5 stars!

First of all, all the waitresses are wearing these cute dresses with pyramid hats.. It's hard to explain but they look like sailor dresses and those triangular paper hats you folded in 2nd grade.

I went with my company so we reserved the private room and got the premium customer service.  The waitress was so nice and she had an assistant to help serve the food.  The private room has a showing of all the wines they have in stock.

I ordered the 16oz. LAWRY'S SIGNATURE RIB EYE STEAK instead of the 10oz. because it comes with the bone.. my co-worker suggested that if it includes the bone it stays tastier ( I guess only a steak expert would know that).  wOw the steak was amazing.

The steak special came with two sides.  The potatoes au gratin potatoes were great but the crisp fried onions were kinda funny.

I also tried... (I'll sound like a fatty after this confession):
-SPINNING BOWL SALAD.. not too bland, not too salty, not too soggy.. just perfecto.
-BRUSCHETTA (with tuna maybe?)-bleh didn't taste fresh
-SIDE OF ONE LOBSTER... it's the small lobster (about 4 inches). I didn't like the chewy texture but others told me they liked it.
-BANANA CREAM PIE-they say it's their most popular and they're very proud of it but beware this thing has coconut and LOTS of cream.

I can't wait to go back.. soo loving it right now. This place is only a short cab ride away from the strip and there's a strip club right across the street for the dudes.. haha.  The best part of this experience was that I took my leftover steak back to my hotel and it was some crazy drunk food to munch on at 4am back from the club.  

**I just found out that they include their recipes on their website! woot woot!
**Ooh, and they don't sell their seasoning anymore.. it was sold and is now owned by McCormick.

This is one of my parents' favorite places to go. In the 5 times I've been here I've had great service every time. The food is exactly what you'd expect. PRIME RIB. No... I've never ventured off to have the sea bass or a some other daily special. I just go for the steak. A little au jus and some horseradish and I'm good to go.

Desserts here are ginormous. I HEART the ice cream sundae though the strawberry shortcake was a leetle bit dry.

The food is not extraordinary but the whole dining experience is a great one. I love the space. The booths are big and roomy. The ceiling is really high and a bit art deco. It's not too loud and they play vocal or big band era music. 

The menu is uncomplicated and so is their wine list. It's basic food surrounded by a great atmosphere and good service.

This a great place for banquets too.

Went there with my family on Thanksgiving. The experience and the food were great. The service was not perfect. We ordered a second bottle of wine and it came after the meal. Our server, Ms. Pleasant, was a very talented person. She is a total delight. 
The food was very good.

Beautiful place. Tasty food. Worth going to for special occasions. Yes pricey, but worth it. The waitress and everybody were so nice. Helped us out on what to order since it was our first time and totally worth it.

Really disappointed with the overall quality an taste of the meal.  Especially for the price.

The meat (prime rib) was good but not great, the Yorkshire pudding was burnt, spinach was just OK.  All of us agreed that the prime rib we had at the Flamingo buffet was much better and was half the cost.  Again, really disappointed.  Will not be back again

Service was excellent as was the ambiance.  

If you are not used to great steaks and want a great place to take a date and don't mind spending the money then this might be for you.

We've wanted to try this place forever.  Should have gone much sooner.  We had a great time entertaining son friends from Staten Island.  Food and service wad top tier.  Going back.  Highly reccomend!

Amazing tender prime rib. Delicious and unique salad that you can't get anywhere else. I am not usually a fan of big chunks of meat but Lawry's is the exception. My boyfriend took me here for our first trip together and it was heavenly. I waddled out of that restaurant 10 pounds heavier and it was so worth it. We now go at least once a year and have made it a tradition of sorts. 

We also tried their asparagus and lobster tails. The asparagus is okay, nothing to write home about so definitely not worth the $9 they charge for it. Lobster tails were very good but their specialty is not seafood so I would not go there for lobster. Just get the prime rib!!!

Thank you Lawrys!! You've introduced me to the wonderful world of prime rib!

I've been dining at Lawry's for at least 10 years. It's extremely consistent and delicious every time. I even had my engagement party here and the staff was phenomenal. They made it very intimate and easy. Food arrived hot and made accommodations for people that didn't eat meat. My favorites - the spinning bowl salad and the classic Lawry's cut. 

Truly a gem of a place. Classy, just off the strip and great for special occasions. If you're in town looking for a special meal go to Lawry's, you won't be disappointed.

This is a mediocre steakhouse with NY steakhouse prices. You enter the restaurant and feel like you've been transported back in time 50 years and the smell and taste of the food matches that sensation. When they shouted my name to let me know my table was ready i should have known this was not going to be a great experience. The  prime rib is ok at best and the powdered mashed potatoes are bland. The wait staff was attentive but when Mr. Boyal (yes the waiter goes by Mr.) asked me if I wanted creamed spinach with my prime rib and mashed potatoes I did not think I would be charged extra but I was. Not a big deal but this sums up this place. Save the time and money and find your way to a top rated steakhouse.

Been to Lawrys several times but Las Vegas Lawrys is so good and the service was great.  We brought our kds with us and they loved it!  They even had a kids menu ($20 per entree) which was good!  Will definitely be back.

Best Prime Rib I've ever had.  I love going here.  The whole experience is incredible.  The Prime Rib is melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  I get the English Cut, which is thin slices of the Prime Rib.  They cut it table side, as well as the "spinning" salad bowl is prepared table side as well.  And it comes with the Mashed Potatoes & Yorkshire Pudding.  Compared to what you'll pay on The Strip for a great dinner, this is a MUCH better deal.  Highly recommended!  The service isn't the best, but it is still pretty good.

I'm late in writing this review.  Honestly Lawry's doesn't deserve my neglect - if anything, this has risen to one of the few joints that I'll be clamoring to get back to.

We started off in the bar while we were waiting for everyone to show up - quiet and completely unobtrusive.  The bartenders were very friendly and managed to keep us in conversation about the international locations - places we've now vowed to get out to.

When we sat down, the waitress attended to us quickly and in less than 10 minutes, we had our orders down, another round of drinks, and our spinning salad.  We enjoyed that and then the meal came around...

I ended up ordering the California cut (anything larger would have been tremendous) with creamed spinach, a baked potato, and mashed potatoes.  The waitress actually suggested we could go half/half on our sides to make sure we could try others - certainly not a courtesy that I expected.

We couldn't finish the meal - it was so much food we ended up giving the leftovers to my brother's pitbull (she'll tear the hell out of those bones).  Again, I'll be back - a good prime rib place is important to have in LV...just before a visit to the Rhino!

We went here on a Friday at 6:30pm which was perfect because it was not very busy yet.  The dining room felt glamorous  and intimate. Our hostess Mrs. Fraley was an absolute  doll and took very good care of us. The whole donning experience was more interactive than a typical steakhouse which I loved.  The carver brought the prime  rib cart to our table and we watched as he played our meal. Im sure everything on their menu is delicious... but order the prime rib! You will not be disappointed.  The spinnung salad was a perfect started to our meal! Bu the BEST part about dinner was that the food was seasoned beautifully. We ordered the mushrooms and asparagus for sides which were full of flavor! I opted for the California cut of prime rib which was perfect portion for me! I was totally  full but did not feel uncomfortable full. My boyfriend choose the Lawrys cut and felt like a king.  There was not a single lump in our mashed potatoes and the gravy... ahhh the gravy.  Delectable. Our carver even came back to check on us! We went to celebrate my boyfriend's  birthday and I'm pretty  sure I got the Best-Girlfriend-Ever-Award for surprising him with this amazing meal. He even got a free apple cake for this birthday.  Our total check was $135.13 which included two prime rib dinners, the extra 2 veggie sides, 1 beer, and 1 cocktail. If you ask me this meal was priceless. Probably one of the top 3 meals I've ever had.
Always a pleasure dining here.  The best prime rib anywhere!
Amazing. Come during the holidays when they have Carol Singers - truly magical.

I've been to Lawry's twice on special occasions, and I love it!  Located a little off the strip, Lawry's is about a $10 cab ride from the MGM.  I've made reservations on both occasions, and that seems to be the best way to do it.  The staff is very accommodating, I've rescheduled reservations several times without a problem.  Walking into Lawry's, the ambiance is very old school.  The restaurant is a bit formal so I dress up whenever I visit.  Lawry's is mainly known for their prime rib, but they do serve other dishes as well.  I usually go with the prime rib though.  There are several different cuts of the prime rib that you can choose from, and all dinners come with their famous spinning bowl salad, mashed potatoes, and yorkshire pudding.  The spinning bowl salad has shredded beets in it which is a nice touch.  Lawry's also has their own homemade spices made specifically to season their salads.  The Lawry's cut is the perfect amount in my opinion.  I've gotten a larger cut the first time, and that was way too much prime rib.  I always get a lobster tail as well with my prime rib for an extra charge of $12.  Service is always friendly and on point.  They do offer a point system loyalty card for a one time purchase.  If I lived in Vegas I would definitely get that card for extra benefits.

Lawry's is old vegas. 

When you step inside it's a little of a time warp, old school meets Golden Girls decor. 

I came here with a large group (25 people) and the 3 servers who took care of us were amazing. They explained how to order and ho everything worked and we were left to figure everything out. 

I enjoyed the salad, pretty basic but crisp and fresh; so good I could have eaten it all night. I opted for the basic California cut. I'm not a meat lover but the cut was AMAZING. Tender, melted in my mouth and I could have eaten more. I also opted for the creamed spinach which was ok. 

Overall, Lawry's was a great atmosphere. There were lots of elder patrons and foreign tourists which defiantly was the vibe of Lawry's. Good food and great service, it's hard to complain.
Melt in your mouth prime rib!!!  Spinning salad, great sides and good service!  If you want meat--definitely the place to go!

We LOVE this place!  Something different, excellent food, service and decor!  

The two of us just love beef and prime rib.  If not the best, then this place serves one of the best prime rib dinners.  Excellent, melts in your mouth.  The way they serve it-- by cutting it at your table to your liking-- is fabulous.

The decor is art deco.  It feels dark, cozy and like I am transported back to the days of Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra.  Fine with me!  Staff is polite and super friendly.  

Besides the prime rib-- their creamed spinach and horseradish/whipped cream sauce are to die for!  And how many places serve Yorkshire Pudding, which pairs so darned well with the prime rib!?!?!  We love the spectacle of serving the beef tableside... plus the salad!  It is also brought to table side in a shining silver cart, where your wait person spins the dressing onto the greens.  It is an "old fashioned" 60's style salad of beets, hard cooked eggs, romaine, etc.-- I LOVE IT!

Who has any clue what their desserts are like?  I am always so stuffed full after my meal, that I have no interest in dessert.  However, I do love their coffee, served in a silver pot, and maybe an after dinner brandy to go with it.

There is a parking lot in front, but not too far from the Strip walking-wise.  It is a wonderful change of pace from the typical Vegas schmaltzy Buffet dinner, and totally worth the price.   I highly recommend it!

Well I don't think I've ever not finished a piece of Prime RIb that's been placed in front of me.  And Lawry's is somewhere I would frequent regularly if I lived near one.  I enjoyed the atmosphere - with the staff/waitresses in uniforms that haven't changed for decades.  It was definitely like being pleasantly transported to another era when service was better and decadence wasn't tacky.  Anyhow - the spinning salad was delicous, and of course who doesn't like seeing a meat cart.  I will go back.

Lawrys is dependable - exactly what you expect. That's not a bad thing. There are times I like a new restaurant experience but tonight I wanted tried and true prime rib.

First a martini in the bar. Quick and friendly service and a nice pour.  Then into the restaurant. The servers wear bizarre outfits but they do a great job table side.

The big silver serving tray looks like the front of a WWII bomber- silver and shiny. Inside is the meat.  They cut it right at the table which is a nice detail.

Staying w the traditional order I had mashed  potatoes and brown gravy,  corn and spinach and Yorkie Pudding. All tasty.  Honestly I've had better prime rib but the presentation, sides and overall meal was quality 

Recommend

I went to Lawry's for lunch during the week with a coworker.  The place seemed pretty dead, but the restaurant has a very business-like feel so I imagine it heats up for late lunch and dinners.  I heard good things about the prime rib and salad, which are cooked and made, respectively, in front of you, so I decided to try one of them - the Lawry's Prime Rib.  Since it was lunch, the prime rib cooking aparatus came around to our table and was cut directly in front of us. It was very good but I thought it was over-hyped and over-priced.  It is very interesting and unique that they cut the meat in front of me, but I was not overly blown away by my experience.  i would try Lawry's again, but it is not on my must-try-again list right now.

Went to dinner the other night--was celebrating my dad's birthday--and had a wonderful time.  The atmosphere was 1930's art deco--very attractive.  The service was attentive but not over your shoulder bothersome, and the food was great--they know how to do prime rib.  This was some of the best prime rib around!
Fantastic experience. Went there for Christmas Holiday Party. Great atmosphere, service and delicious food. Will highly recommend to everyone.

Lovely surroundings with professional service in a quiet, relaxing atmosphere with the best prime rib and steaks in town - what more can one ask for?

We started with cocktails in the cozy bar - though I didn't see their French martini on the menu, the bartender was quick to accommodate.  Once seated in the dining area in one of their traditional "show room" booths, we started our meal by sharing a shrimp cocktail appetizer - five huge shrimp and just right spicy cocktail sauce.  This was followed by the traditional spinning salad bowl with egg, shredded beats, and the Lawrys French dressing.  Sour dough bread and butter were included.  We chose the prime rib with accompaniments of the traditional creamed spinach and asparagus topped with hollandaise.  The homemade mashed potatoes are fabulous.  I love the English cut of prime rib.  It is three thinner slices and just seems to soak up the juices.  One of the party added a medium sized lobster tail for $16.  As expected, everything was cooked and served tableside to perfection.  A glass of the Lawry's house Merlot and one of Cabernet topped off the meal.  No dessert this trip.

Is this what it's like to be born with a silver spoon in your mouth? I would hate for anyone to be born with a silver spoon in their mouths cuz that sucks!  Everything just isn't as good or enjoyable once you've had the ultimate undeniable best... While everyone here is giving Lawry's "THE PRIME RIB" 4 n 5 stars I'm here baffled.  Perhaps HOPR (House of Prime Rib) in SF was my silver spoon this entire time... Consistently serving juicy tender cuts of premium well aged prime rib with sides that make anything at Lawry's, well, unworthy of such an upper class palate that belongs to the family of HOPR.

Their service feels old here... as in outdated.  Whereas HOPR is classic and retains class.  At Lawry's, the female servers look like they jumped right out of our old history textbooks dressed like women from days of the 13 colonies looking like the pilgrim women or even nurses from the 60's.  Do you need a flu shot?  They probably have some in their apron as an add option to your meal.  Service was friendly but rather inefficient.  It's hard to explain.  You just have to try both Lawry's and HOPR to understand.

When I hear "Lawry's THE PRIME RIB", I'm literally thinking OMG we need to bow down... it's Lawry's THE PRIME RIB god.  Calling yourself "THE" Prime Rib kind of gives the sense that there was no one before you, no one after you, and no one will ever even come close to you.  But then again, the loudest one is usually the weakest one, and this was surely the case here.

My prime rib was ordered medium rare.  My cousin to my right and my best friend to my left also ordered the same.  It came out more like medium maybe medium well.  What didn't help was that they gave us butter knives to cut into this steak.  Oh wait... I think that was subliminally suppose to tell us that you can cut into this beef like butter.  Good one guys... almost fell for it there, but I'm from the family tree of HOPR... can't fool me that easily.  There must be something wrong with the aging process of the prime rib here because it was tough and fibrous to the chew.  I thought maybe if I ate the outer parts of the rib cut where the fats and tendon are then it'd be more tender but no it was rather dry.  My friend and I went straight to the bone and even that was on the medium side.  Medium wouldn't be that bad if the beef was aged better for a tastier and softer bite, but that not the case.  I took a couple of bites and left the rest of it there but I ate the mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, and creamed corn to help soak up the alcohol for the later part of the night.  With about 3/4 of the steak still sitting on my plate, the bussers and server never asked why I barely touched it as they took it away.  I didn't want to say anything either to be respectful because Lawry's was the bachelor's favorite prime rib spot to grub at.  One thing is for sure though... my cousin, my best friend, and I are taking him to our silver spoon, HOPR, next week to show him what a great well aged prime rib is supposed to be like.  We'll even throw in an actual steak knife and let him use the butter knife to spread his butter.  It wouldn't even take the steak for the bachelor to change his allegiance to HOPR... Just the warm soft fluffy bread to start would be enough.

If Harry Chapin got to eat at HOPR and Lawry's while he was editing his lyrics, us 70's and 80's babies would probably know the song to go like:

And the cat's in the cradle and HOPR too.
Little boy blue and the man on the moon.
When you coming home dad? I don't know when.
We'll go to House of Prime Rib then, son...
You know we'll have a good rib then.

Excellent prime rib, Yorkshire pudding, mushrooms, and salad. The service was phenomenal, so much so that we are still talking about Mr. Munoz, our waiter, days later. Great experience and I will be back each time I'm in town.

A short six minute drive off the tank-top & shorts loudness of the Strip--111 degree heat wave today. In slacks and white long sleeves I experienced a leisurely, pleasant, nearly 2hr lunch in nice quiet surroundings. Expertly served by Mrs. Leavitt, who should be THE prime example of perfect Lawry's waitstaff.  The food--crispy artichoke hearts and mangoes for starters...then the luncheon cut Prime Rib from the carver's cart, mashed potatoes and yummy creamed corn, the sides.  Mixed the mild and zingy horseradish together by Mrs. Leavitt's suggestion. Good suggestion.

My wife had two good cocktails.  I was happy with S. Pelligrino sparkling water.

We split a piece of Coconut Banana Creme pie. Huge piece. Good suggestion, Mrs. L.       Coffee with dessert.  Good ending.
Wow, great beef. My daughter has been talking about the spinning salad for years. The creamed spinach is awesome. Great service. Not a bad thing about the place, other than the PRICE, of course.
Always awesome prime rib! Lobster and butter delicious!  Diego Islas our sever was awesome and on top of it! Thanks for a fine dining experience!

I love this place. Just finished a great dinner put with my boss. Lawrys has a consistency that you can depend on, yet also somehow manages to exeeed your expectations at the same time. I made a reservation, and even though we arrived a little early they were able to take us to our table right away. Our server was excellent. My only complaint is that I can't remember her last name. The last name thing makes it a little harder to remember, but she was absolutely fantastic as was the male server we had last time. This place really knows customer service.
I was trying to remember the kind of wine i wanted and she randomly suggested a malbec, which is exactly what I wanted. 
We both ordered the Lawry's cut prime rib and for those that aren't aware it comes with a salad and mashed potatoes. You can also order spinach and sweet corn when the carver comes to the table.
The salad is ok in my opinion. I like the beets and the croutons, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it or anything. However the prime rib is awesome. I ate every delicious, perfectly cooked medium rare bite. Mashed potatoes are great and I surprised myself this time and tried the Yorkshire bread pudding bread (pudding to me is not bread or cake, but whatever) and dipped in the au jus and it was so good... Kind of like a beef dip. 
Afterwards, the waitress recommended the Sticky Toffee pudding and the chocolate fantasy cake. I ordered the pudding and my boss tried the cake. I was a little disappointed when she set a cake in front of me, but i have to tell you that it was also delicious. I would definitely order it again. My boss was very happy with the cake. Neither one of us could finish our desserts though. We were stuffed! 

When we walked outside we had to wait just a few minutes but the valet brought my car very quickly. Excellent customer service by everyone. I can totally see why this place is still always busy.

As always, the service is right on. From the spinning salad to the dessert, pure perfection. I ordered the English Cut this time and found it to be the perfect amount of food, and even though it was 3 thin slices of prime rib, it stayed juicy through my whole meal. Thank you Lawry's for a great night of dining with my wife and sons.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and what a treat I'm not much of a steam fan but wow there meats are incredible. And the staff is so nice and patient on what you want to order. I was surprised with a red velvet with rose cake and wow! Never had anything like that before and was amazing! Can't wait to come back
Love this place! Great service all around. The prime rib was delicious! Would definitely recommend this place!

If you love prim rib you have to visit Lawry's.  Try their surf & turf with the freshwater slipper lobsters.  Incredible!  You don't have to wait until you are in Vegas.  Visit them in Beverly Hills CA.

Of course the food is amazing and delicious, it's Lawry's! But I wanted to post a review of the great service. Came for Thanksgiving dinner and the service was beyond awesome! Mr. Luis Williams, Freddy, and meat carver Noel were so attentive and concerned with our satisfaction we felt like we were family. We enjoyed the experience so much had to put the review on Yelp!  Thank you gentlemen for making our Thanksgiving dinner a memorable and fun experience!

From the moment you walk in you feel like you're in a different era. It's very well decorated and dimly lighted. There is a sign when you approach the driveway that says "appropriate dinner wear required". Basically, anything but a bathing suit is appropriate per their valet person. 

We were seated on time and the service was above excellent. From the moment we were seated until the moment we left, we were treated like royalty.

The calamari appetizer was tasty. Nothing spectacular. The mayonnaise based dipping sauce and tomato based sauce was just OK. 

I got the California cut prime rib and my husband got the Lawry's cut prime rib. They were excellent, tender, and juicy. The mashed potatoes, gravy, and creamed corn was also delicious!  We also had a side of creamed spinach which had a little bitterness to it. I think it was from the onions. 

Overall it was a very tasty dinner but very overpriced. You're really paying for the service which was superb. For the three of us our bill was at $240 not including tip. Wow! We probably won't eat there again because of the cost. In Vegas, you can get prime rib almost anywhere for much less. It was great to try and we have no regrets.

Recommend. We had a party of 10 we all had one drink and each of us had prime rib dinner and one appetizer. Our bill was just over $600. This restaurant is extremely clean, beautiful and well established. It was a very neat experience when the gentleman comes to the table and ask you what cut of prime rib you'd like to have. Look on the kids face was amazing.

First time trying Lawry's for a special birthday dinner.
Our first impression was we assumed the dress attire would be more dressy than casual.. But we enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. 
I was impressed with the quality of food and the amount we received. Prime Rib and the Lobster was perfectly prepared and tasty. The sides were also great. The Calamari we had as an appetizer was a good portion and done just right. The famous salad was also a delight. 
Our server was super attentive and very nice.

Definitely coming back when we are in town!

Went here for my bachelor party just to have a nice dinner with the guys.

First off, the ambiance and decor and soothing and welcoming.  Most steakhouse I know are usually dark, but this place was just a little bit brighter.  A very classy looking place for a classy meal.  Other than that, the meal will be very similar to House of Prime Rib on Van Ness in San Francisco.  But Lawry's opened it's restaurants first, so I will give him the credit for this type of steakhouse.

Now we get sat down with a reservation for 7 within a few minutes and the waitress kindly tells us the specials and has enough knowledge to educate us on the types of wine to order.  After enjoying the company, a server tosses and spins a salad for us.  I was hungry so it tastes great.  I think it's the Thousand Islands-type of dressing that makes it.  Next, we are greeted by a large steel cart and master carver.  I got the Lawry cut prime rib and shared some lobster.  Wow, so delicious.  Accompanied with mashed potatoes, cream of corn, cream of spinach, asparagus, Yorkshire pudding, and fine wine made this prime rib even better.  The sides that we got we pretty small so be weary of that.  The lobster tails we got were actually superior to most high end places that I've been.  It tasted fresh and didn't really need the drawn butter.

This meal and sharing stories with my close friends really made for a good bachelor party meal.  Thanks guys.
Took 2 hours and 55 mins to have a typical dinner. Terribly slow service.  Also messed up the desert order.  Very sad :(  bill took 30 mins to get

Came in here for dinner craving a prime rib sandwich... It's only served at lunch! Boo!

So I got the Lawry's cut instead... it's big, juicy, and good. A little better than the $10 prime rib you find at after hours on the strip but $40 better? I  don't know about that.

They need to update their decor... I'm not sure what their theme is but it's definitely not timeless.
Mr Hernandez was great.  He was right on with his suggestions.  Had prime rib and rib eye.  I would do prime rib next time.  I love rib eye but it wasn't a True medium rare.   Food was phenomenal.

**Restaurant Week - Spring 2012**

Before I start, I should probably mention that I'm not actually a prime rib fan.  For whatever reason, prime rib has never really struck my fancy.  However, it is the hubster's favorite dinner, so when I saw Lawry's menu for RW, I thought we could give it a try.

I'm so glad that we did!  First of all, the decor and atmosphere are just fun.  It's vintage to the point of tacky, which is what makes it so fun.  The waitresses did look silly with the folded-napkin bonnet, but ours was wonderful and friendly.  I could tell she had a customary way of greeting tables and explaining the process since she kept calling us "ladies and gentlemen."

We started the meal with the spinning salad, which was delicious.  The dressing and croutons were sweet and garlicky, and the overall salad was a nice, fresh way to start the meal.

I decided to join the hubster in getting prime rib, and to my eternal delight it was absolutely delicious!  I decided to get mine medium rather than medium-rare (the way I normally enjoy my steaks), and it made a world of difference.  The meat was tender and juicy, and flavorful in the best possible way.  I didn't even use as much horseradish as I originally thought I'd need/want to, since there was no need to mask the flavor.  

The mashed potatoes were wonderful, with a delicious gravy (and I'm not even a brown gravy fan!  Hubster had the creamed corn (his favorite), and I ordered the creamed spinach.  Both were tasty, but a definite second fiddles to the main event.

We ended the night with coffee and dessert, hubster ordering the creme brûlée and me the chocolate mousse.  Both were incredibly delicious, but almost an overly rich end to an overwhelming meal. 

In all honesty the main complaint I had was that there was too much food!  The 10 oz. prime rib, although scrumptious, was much too large a portion for my taste.  I wish the 7 oz. portion would have been an option for RW since I felt wasteful after I was through (ironic considering the destination of the RW proceeds).

Simply irrestible!! The Prime Rib is outstanding. My taste buds were in seventh heaven. Excellent service and atmosphere. A really classy and satisfying experience overall. Treat yourself and your favorite person to Lawry's hospitality and flavor. It's a must!!!

food is great.  service is very attentive.  


why do they make the female servers dress like that?  

ridiculous.  

it detracted from my overall experience.

I love this place. I usually go to the one in Beverly Hills but this one is just as good. We had an amazing server that is a Las Vegas natiev. She was very attentive and by the book. The food was amazing!!! I love their wine selection. Cant beat that horseradish! It is the freshest I've had.

I ate here during "Restaurant Week" and am so glad I did! I enjoyed every bite of my meal and the service was fantastic. Hubby and I were seated at a roomy booth and our drinks were never empty. A basket of warm bread with butter came out quick and tasted great. The price for the RW menu was $50.14 per person and I enjoyed the following for that price before tax:

The Famous Original Spinning Bowl Salad - This is made right at your table. Our server, Ms. Huang had 2 metal bowls that spun as she added the dressing. The salad had lettuce, beets, hard boiled eggs, croutons and their signature vintage dressing. I haven't ever tasted a salad like this before. It was suggested that I add some of the Lawry's seasoning that was on the table, so I did. The salad tasted so fresh and delicious. Very good.

Mashed Potatoes - This was a nice addition to my plate. The mashed potatoes are whipped with butter and milk and tasted perfect. The brown gravy that came on it was good. 

Buttered Peas - Yum! Being on the same plate, the peas ended up with brown gravy and au jus on them which I like. Plus, I just like peas!

Yorkshire Pudding - This comes in a skillet by itself. It tasted great and was perfect for soaking up the last bits of gravy on my plate. it was soft and really good. 

Prime Rib - 8 ounces of pure heaven! A carver came to the table with a cart of prime rib and let me pick how I wanted it and then carved it right in front of me. I like mine a little more done and that's just what I got. The prime rib was so tender and literally fell apart. It had such great flavor. To say I didn't leave here stuffed would be absolutely wrong! Everything tasted good, but the prime rib was the true star.

Creme Brulee - This had fresh berries on top and It tasted so good, but I could only eat half because I was so full. 

Coffee - Tasted great and was a perfect way to end the meal. At this point I just needed a pillow for a nap!

I can't say enough about our server. She was fantastic and took great care of us. The manager on duty, Wendy came over and chit chatted with us for maybe 10 minutes and she was warm and friendly. She let us know a little about the lunch menu which sounds like a winner. This was a great RW experience and I will be back!

When we come out to Las Vegas, one of our stops is to Lawry's.  Old school service and ambiance with absolutely amazing food combine to make an unforgettable experience.  We've never had a bad experience here.  

We started out with Lawry's famous spinning bowl salad (I like the house vinaigrette while my wife likes the homemade ranch dressing) and sourdough bread.

My wife doesn't care for Prime Rib so she gets the lobster tail dinner.  I, on the other hand, had a meeting with the "Diamond Jim" cut of beef.  Mr. Wong, the master carver, sliced off an awesome piece of fork-tender prime rib and matched that with their classic mashed potatoes and the to-die-for cream corn.  Lawry's has completely ruined prime rib for me.  And I could only aspire to make my cream corn as good as theirs.

The wife's lobster tails (there are 3 of them) were incredibly sweet and perfectly prepared.

Also need to add that the Yorkshire Pudding is something you can't miss.

Our server, Mr. Boyle (Vic) was incredible.  He was very attentive and provided great humor and conversation.  

As we were celebrating our birthday's, we were treated to warmed pound cake for dessert.

It's not a cheap night out.  But if you want to splurge and celebrate something special, this is the place to go.  Can't wait to go back!

This place is amazing!!! Came here for my my one year anniversary with my bf and was fairly impressed. Although out waitress seemed fake and unenthusiastic while working, the rest of the service was great! They started us off with a spinning salad, which I was a big fan of because of the sour dough croutons. My boyfriend had the thick cut of prime rib that came with the bone (only because I wanted the bone portion) and I had a thin slice, medium rare with 1 lobster tail along with creamed corn and creamed spinach, (I was going all out). I personally don't really eat prime rib to begin with, but my first bite into my slice was amazing. It was just so juicy and delicious, I can't even describe it. The bone off of my bfs prime rib was probably the best part. I felt like a barbarian eating it with my hands getting all the meat off. What can I say, i have no shame! I loved the creamed corn, you just can't go wrong with creamed corn. The creamed spinach was okay to me, only because of the texture and realizing that I didn't like spinach to begin with, haha. 


For dessert, we couldn't decide on what to share so we just ordered creme brûlée and the sticky toffee. The sticky toffee was the amazing as well! It came with vanilla ice cream which paired perfectly with it. I didn't like the creme brûlée only because I was too obsessed with the sticky toffee and the fact that it was a level 7 sweet compared to the creme brûlée which was like a level 3 sweet. I obviously liked the sweeter dish. Overall, the price was actually pretty cheap. We really thought our dinner would be over 200$ but it was about 130 which was awesome. I will definitely be coming back here!!

I'm drooling. A bit salty but tasty. Prime rib. GOOD prime rib. The seasoning is simple but th3 cuts of meats are good that it doesn't need fancy seasoning.

"I thought it was good but I've had better for helluva cheaper too but it's Vegas," says the fiancé.

I thought it was just solidly good.

Went to old school Lawry's as I was in town on a business trip and I cannot say that it was better than 3 stars.  I actually think that's this is the perfect score for this establishment as it's just not keeping up with the competition.  It's literally stuck in time which some find endearing but I do not as I'm not about theme restaurants.
Their specialty is prime rib which my college ordered and I had the ribeye...guys, it was average at best.  All of the waitstaff were quite nice- but a massive update to the food and decor is required.

Expensive? A bit...

But Jesus Christ... Prime Rib has always been so mediocre to me... I usually prefer a Strip, or Ribeye... With Lawry's?

OM NOM NOM anything they put in front of me is good... This is the most amazing alto shaam meats, by far, that I've ever had... Fuck the strip, go have a really good prime rib.. This shit is amazing. I still have wet dreams about it.

I can't wrap my head around the bad reviews!! I was amazed at how wonderful our meal was.  The salad was so good, the prime rib (I had the English cut, Hubby had Lawry cut) was beyond wonderful especially with the Yorkshire pudding, potatoes and gravy went perfect with it!  Creamed corn was so good. We also sat at the bar while we waited and had wonderfully made drinks.  We will come every time we are in town!

Omg. I can't say enough about this place! From the food to the service! Everything was exceptional.  

Here's a hint: they have a "hidden menu" of advertised specials! Make sure to ask for it, I got prime rib, lobster, and all the fixings for $59. 

Service was excellent as well. HUGE PORTIONS!

My favorite restaurant. This place is so good from the salad to the prime rib and the desserts. Inside is beautiful and much different than any other restaurant you've been to. They carve the prime rib right by your table in a cart. Cream corn is my favorite side. For dessert you can't go wrong with the CC browns hot fudge sundae but my personal favorite is the trifle. It's the best salad I've ever had and if you agree, you can bring home the salad dressing, they sell that and cc browns hot fudge.

Excellent atmosphere and service. You can't go wrong with their prime rib. I had the pleasure of having Chad as my server and he was fantastic. Great meal and great service all around. Highly recommended.
Went there yet again in aug 09 but the Lawrys cut seemed a little smaller this time. Still just as tasty tho!

I've been to Lawry's twice before and it was great but this was not a good experience.    I asked the server for au gratin potatoes -- which I've had at Lawry's before and they are delicious -- but she refused to offer me any option to order them other than to say, "I'll check on that."
