When the carver came to the table I asked again and she said, "they charge an extra $10 for au gratin potatoes."  Duh!   I would have paid that if you would have just given me the option!  

The prime rib was tough.   The server rarely came back to check on us.

I came here last night (Saturday) for dinner with a group of 7.  The guys in the group said the specialty was their prime rib and so we all had that except for one person in our party.  That one person had steak and while it looked good, the prime rib tasted better according to another friend.  

Each prime rib dish includes some of their 'famous spinning salad', mashed potatoes, and bread.  The spinning salad in my opinion was less than great.  Salad drenched in thousand island dressing ... hmm.  It's cool how they toss the salad but as far as taste goes, it's 'ok'.  Next, the prime rib?  I was expecting something amazing ... and it was not.  For one, my sis ordered hers well done and I ordered mine medium well.  Yet my sisters was redder than mine... and I guess the waiter overheard our table surveying which looked more well done because he switched it up for something way darker.  The bread it comes with, yorkshire?  Or something like that, it's pretty good.  We added some lobster tails, they weren't bad but again we've had better.  

Based on other reviews, I was expecting the service to be superb, something along the lines of a Ruth's Chris.  However, I felt the service was lacking.  A bit slow and the waiter kept bringing me diet coke instead of regular, after I asked him specifically for a refill of regular coke, since it seemed he was overwhelmed and didn't take notice of things like refills.  It actually wasn't even busy.  

We had stopped at the bar before being seated and the drinks were pretty good.  We tried a raspberry mojito, yum!  

Overall, an 'okay' experience.  I wouldn't return.  Also, if you call ahead for reservations, be prepared to give them your name and credit card number.  I thought it was weird but that's their policy.  The only good thing is that they advise you of the suggested 18% gratuity and you can let them know at that time you prefer they not include that and they won't.

Read numerous Yelp reviews singing praises for Lawry's lunch special and their salad bar. 

First impression: the place was a ghost town. Totally empty. Not a good sign.

The "salad bar" was, no joke, 2' x 3'. If you're making a movie and you need a miniature version of a real salad bar, come here. I told my wife I thought I was being punk'd. 

The "lunch special" was a BBQ sandwich for $10. It was God horrible. Couldn't eat it. The meat was very dry and rubbery and black on the outside. The BBQ sauce helped lube it up but didn't change the fact that it was inedible.

I returned that for the Prime Rib Sandwich for $16. MUCH better. The meat was perfectly cooked, tender and tasty. The au jus was also excellent. But - $16? For a sandwich? Off a lunch menu? 

So, three sandwiches, a salad (which my wife enjoyed), and some iced teas - including tip = $72! 

Yep. Punk'd.

Was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was here.  It's just like House of Prime Rib in SF.  Everyone in the restaurant is so nice and the service is wonderful.  You first start out with their special salad that's just delicious.  The Lawrys Prime Rib Cut was generous.  I ordered a medium rare and it was perfect.  The chef comes up to the table with the cart and cuts the beef right in front of you.  You also get mashed potatoes and yorkshire pudding with your meal, and you can order a side of mushrooms or creamed spinach if you like but be cautioned that it might be too much food. We came away happy campers.  Will definitely return!

WHAT A LOVELY EXPERIENCE! I came here with coworkers after a long day at the convention center during CES. The staff was friendly and the food was so delicious. I couldn't finish it all. 

Had a really great time here, will def return when I go back.

The prime rib is sliced to order, table-side. The creamed spinach was delicious. It's normally too expensive for me, but I'm on vacation, and Lawry's gives you what you pay for. I'd definitely come back here next time I'm in town!

The prime rib was luke warm...the service was TERRIBLE (waited 20-30 min between appetizer and salad) and the waitress (Mrs. Morrison) didn't explain ANYTHING on the menu. She basically expected us to eat the meal however it came out...and I have food allergies! Overall....totally not impressed.

Lawry's should be 4-5 stars, but obviously something happened....

My favorite Lawry's is the Los Angeles location, but it was my birthday, I was in Vegas, and I usually am doin' big thangs.... SO in comes Lawry's.

The food was awesome, same great quality as ever, but the service was not as good as I remember. I didn't feel that umph that I should in a fine dining establishment, I didn't feel the difference between a prime spot and just another steakhouse!  

I give you 3 stars today Lawry's cause the class was there, but I just didn't feel it during my personal experience.... maybe the waitress was having a bad day, but I didn't really even hear a peep out of her.

I'll never stop my Lawry's prime rib visits, but quality of service needs a jumpstart!

Omg is is the best place I have ever eaten. I am a foodie and the prime rib here is the best thing you will eat. You could use a spoon to cut the meat. Great service! Lobster roll, salad, sides were so scrumptious !
We enjoyed the signature ribeye, BBQ prime rib and prime rib sandwich very much!!!  Great ambiance and nice self order sandwich and salad bar!  Strongly recommended!

Pro's: 
Great Prime Rib
Incredible hospitality and service
Beautiful Decor

Con's:
Expensive
Side Dishes not my favorite

I had a wedding reception dinner here with an open bar tab.  Just about everyone ordered the Prime Rib and it was great.  The carts that they server off of are very fancy.  The side dishes of creamed corn and Yorkshire puddings were sub-par.

The place took care of all of the arrangements and from the meal to getting people cabs back to the strip hotels, it was all top notch.  

I have been to the Lawry's in Los Angeles and it is a bit better, but our meal was very good.  

With the open bar tab the meal with tip cost about an average of 80-100 bucks a person so it isn't cheap, but well worth it.  

If you have a function and need a place to book, try this place.  

Thanks

Lawry's is so worth it here. 
I have found the Rib-Eye Steak to be the best thing on the menu.. Prime Rib great but the Rib-Eye Steak is beyond great!! 

Don't waste your money on theme restaurants on the Strip, this is the place to be.

The ONLY place to go in Vegas for prime rib. We love the spinning salad and the Yorkshire puddings too. The meat is incredible and the service is consistently great. Lawry's is a great place for special occasions too- I've celebrated festive Christmas dinner and a romantic Valentine's dinner here as well. Can't wait to come back!

I'm not giving Lawry's four stars, because honestly, I'm not much of a prime rib fan. But if I was, I would go there, yes, I would. 

I ordered the California Cut, which was just the right size for me. I enjoyed the Yorkshire Pudding, as I'd never had it before! And the potatoes were creamy and delicious. The spinach was just okay, I wasn't a big fan. 

The staff are really helpful and very courteous. I was the only girl at the table, and the waiter just HAD to serve me first (But I guess that's customary of all fancy schmancy restaurants -- and all good restaurants, eh? I'm learning, slowly, slowly...). 

I would go back I suppose, but there are way more restaurants I'd want to try in Vegas first. But that's just me...antsy to get up and go...and remember, I'm not a big steak and potatoes girl...

But if you are, by all means...head on down!

Took the family here to celebrate life.  We were seated even though we were in flip flops.  My family was happy with their prime rib.  I mixed it up and ordered the rib eye. Yeah, I know...don't order ribeye at a prime rib place.  The steak was just alright.  When steak is not amazing, it's cumbersome trying to get through the meat.  It was a good dining experience, but the venue isn't as glamorous as the Beverly Hills location.  The missed-matched chairs are an eyesore as well.

This is the best meal I have had in recent memory. 

I love the ambiance. The uniforms could go for a little bit of a revamp, but our waiter, Mr.Ayers was very attentive and really nice. 

It was just 2 of us, we started with Shrimp Cocktail (AMAZING) and Orange Cranberry mojitos.

All of the food was really amazing. I can't believe that I've never tried the creamed spinach before, how is that possible? It was SOOOOO good. I couldnt finish all my food, focus on the meat first, thats why your there, right?

This was a really nice treat. I shouldnt wait so long before going again.

Outstanding Prime Rib!  Have always seen this place for years in Las Vegas and SOCAL....never once did I think about eating here.  I SHOULDA ATE HERE a long, long time ago.  Lawreys cut of Prime Rib medium rare was GREAT!  Highly recommend this fare of food to all.

It's Lawry's - just what you'd expect from all the other locations.

Only downfall here is that they don't give you the meatball and potato chips in the bar =(

But everything else was good!!

Haven't been here for quite sometime; got a chance to dine again this past weekend. Still feature the best prime rib I could ever have. A great casual dining for anyone looking for great food, ambiance without needing to dress up. You guys should try it!! Luv their spinach & corn specially the Yorkshire pudding.
Nice place but smaller and more intimate than Los Angeles location. Our server Rickey was Great!

Been here many times and this last time seemed to just go to another level. Ordered the Diamond cut with potato's and two lobster tails. Honestly - the best meal I have ever had. The prime rib was perfect the lobster was flawless and the potatoes were legit. The server was on point. Took care of us but wasn't intrusive. It was seriously an experience I will brag about forever and this was probably my 10th time there. Outstanding guys and I'll be back again this year for sure.

I have finally found the answer to the question, "Where's the beef?" It's here people. Trust me!

I had dinner here with some of my suppliers during a recent business trip to Vegas. When I heard we would be dining here, I was a little nervous, for two reasons. I am always trying to watch what I eat and I knew it would be a belly buster type of meal, and also - I've never really actually ordered Prime Rib as my own entrée. Sure, my husband has ordered it on numerous occasions but I have never ordered it on my own. I just can't commit myself to such a big hunky chunk of fine looking and tasting meat. 

The decor of the restaurant is lovely. Very art deco, which does not mesh well with the amish like outfits that they make the servers wear. I didn't get it. But the service was pretty good. There were about 11 of us, and we had a great server and received some attention from the manager as well. We started with appetizers - a couple orders of shrimp cocktail and calamari. I am allergic to shrimp, but I must say they looked HUGE. The calamari was nothing unique, actually extremely breaded and fried, but still tasty (plus I was pretty hungry). For my main course I ordered the fish which was sturgeon. It was only OK. I felt it was overcooked. But what is saving this review from the abyss of 3-star ratings is that everything else was wonderful. I did get to get a little nibble of the prime rib which was fabulous. The horseradish is the real deal - I've had real horseradish before but this stuff was MEAN. They have creamed spinach which is like my absolute favorite side dish - and it was sooooo creamy and perfectly seasoned. 

If you are in Vegas and want to experience a special night out that wont require you to hire an event planner or pay someone for reservations - this place was pretty good. I would return but I'm just going to commit and order the prime rib myself next time.

This place has the best prime rib!!! Juicy soft and the side dishes are yummy too. 
It's an old style set up with the waitresses dressed up in a diner looking outfit. Very cute. 
I would have given this place a 5 however our server wasn't as friendly or informational about the establishment. He never explained the history or business of this place. We had a party of 7 and this was my families first time here which we stated. At the Chicago location we had the whole spew of this wonderful restaurant but in Vegas - nada. 
He did offer sides of cream corn and spinach but forgot to mention there was an additional charge for those. We were thinking it came with the meal. 
The desserts were just okay 
Free valet parking

my friends were craving meat, prime rib to be specific, and what better place to go than lawry's? 

what i ate:
- spinning salad: fun to watch, and even better to eat. super classic salad, but a nice start. 
- california cut: thinner cut of meat, but perfect for me. gives me enough room to eat all the yummy sides
- creamed corn side: sweet and creamy
- mushroom side: very earthy and well cooked. i liked that it was a variety of mushrooms
- banana coconut pie: seriously one of the best i've had in a really long time. the crust was nice and coconuty, like a coconut cookie. perfect dessert. BUT this slice was huge! perfect to share with two other people. or just the right size for you when you need some sweets

pros:
- service: perfection, as always
- food was awesome! everyone loves it when the cart comes around, cause it's eatin time!
- able to make a rez right before we walked in
- didn't rush us. we had a very late dinner, and were probably the last patrons there, but no one rushed our meal and let use enjoy every bite
- huge dining room! plenty of seats for small or large parties

cons:
- it's a bit stuffy. when i go to the beverly hills location, it's the type of place older rich people go. but, regardless, it's nice to treat yourself, especially after winning some money at the roulette table!
- no meatballs! maybe we came too late, maybe they don't do it at this location, but i really missed the mini meatballs the beverly hills location usually has in their bar as an appetizer for people who are waiting. oh well

would i come again? um... i duno, maybe if i were in town and in the mood for prime rib, minus the buffet. 

corkage fee was $25 (i think???)

Yes, the prime rib kicks ass here. Probably the best that Ive ever had. Whenever Im in Vegas I always try to get my friends away from the casinos and venture out of the buffets and into Lawrys.

Its that good here, service is excellent and its always a packed house here. Your dinner doesnt come on a plate via a server, its rolled out to you on a carving station ! They're proud of their meat here.

My wife and I went here after reading all of the Yelp reviews. We were not that impressed. The dinning room was too bright and had a banquet hall feel. The prime rib was good but not awesome. I had a better prime rib and enjoyed the atmosphere more at the Palm in the Forum Shops.

Yum! Had Easter dinner here a few nights ago and it did not disappoint. Had the prime rib with mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, and spinning salad. All of it was amazing. I took home half my dinner, it was an incredibly large serving. We ordered mushrooms as an appetizer, they were garlicly, buttery and delicious. Service was outstanding.

Definitely worth every bite... Yes I'm one of those annoying reviewers that has frequented House of Prime rib so it's hard not to compare.  I like that Lawrys actually offers other options like steaks and lobster.  The salad is great, the bread basket with whipped butter is too.  We started with a shrimp cocktail, large meaty prawns in a nice spicy cocktail sauce.  We both went with prime rib too, I really enjoyed the thin cut, juicy and flavorful.  The creamed corn was much better than the creamed spinach ( HOPR is better).  Portions are huge, we could not finish.  We also tried the sticky toffee pudding but that was lackluster, not sticky or much toffee flavor.  This restaurant has many unique qualities, the waitress outfits for one and the old school decor.  If in the mood for a yummy piece of meat give this place a whirl you won't be disappointed.  Free valet parking too.

Met a colleague for lunch here the other day.  It's been a while since I've been to Lawry's and I was excited to see if it was still as good as I remember.  It's near the Howard Hughes business area so there's always a ton of businessmen and women having lunch here on weekdays.  With this in mind, we decided to meet at 11:30 am (opening time) to beat the lunch rush.

I went up to the chef and ordered a BBQ Beef Sandwich ($12), Cup of Chili ($5), and an Iced Tea ($3).  The BBQ Beef Sandwich was very good.  The Beef was juicy and the BBQ Sauce was slightly tangy and not too sweet....just the way I like it.  The one negative for me was the amount of Sauce, I would have preferred less Sauce.....you can't control the amount of Sauce though, it's served that way.

The Chili was amazing!  It is easily the best Chili I've ever had.  It's not for Vegetarians though.....there's Beef in the Chili.  The combination of ingredients was perfect....I wish I knew what was in it!  It also had a slight spicy kick to it too.

The atmosphere is upscale and professional, perfect for our lunch meeting.  Overall, it was a great experience.

Hint - If you want to try their amazing Prime Rib but don't want to pay the Dinner prices, come for lunch and get the Lunch Cut Prime Rib, which was $20 I believe.

Did I get Value for my money?  Yes.
Will I return?  Absolutely.

FANTASTIC! We both had the Prime Rib lunch cut with all 3 sides. Creamed corn was the best I've ever tasted. Creamed spinach was good. Mashed potatoes and gravy were good. Service was excellent (Amy was our waitress). We really liked the idea of the mobile carving station. Less work, less chaos.

Sad that men don't have enough manners to remove their hats, hence the sign telling you that your parents failed.

Only part we didn't like was the manager not appreciating that some folks don't give out their private information willy nilly. If we don't want to give you our full name and phone number, you should not be laughing. Have some respect for your customers preferences.

Every corner near the Strip is filled with luring opportunities to be pampered. Sensory overload and gluttony (and every other deadly sin) within an arm's distance--Welcome to Vegas they say! Lawry's provides an atmosphere that compliments that kind of fine-dining expectation but also a few more classy perks on the side. Overall Lawry's provides a 4 star experience and leaves your prime rib cravings quite satisfied. 

Food:
 - Lawry Cut ($44): Probably one of the better Prime Rib options for the buck. 10oz is a substantial amount and it doesn't disappoint. Since they cut it right in front of you, you'll probably be getting varying degrees of "well-done"-ness. My medium rare was closer to the rarer side, and my dad's was closer to the medium side. Lovely juicy and tender portion of prime rib, gently seasoned but marvelously welcoming of any added flavoring if you so wish. The meat sauce that is gently splashed on the side is a welcomed hint of flavor that complements the prime rib without taking the spotlight away from it. Adding some horseradish gives it a slight heat that still highlights the rib; I personally mixed the mild and strong one to get both worlds without overwhelming the palette--just a hint!. As expected, the meat closer to the bone was juicier and had more flavor, but my whole portion was beautiful and very satisfying. Lawry's prime rib really seals in their flavors!
 - Spinning Bowl Salad: It's no mistake that you're going to get a classic garden salad, their special dressing that tastes too close to Thousand Island, and some croutons. Spin that around and apparently the salad is supposed to seem a little more gourmet? Sorry, it really wasn't special no matter how many times you spin it. I expected a lot more from a salad--how about a lot more baby greens and maybe less iceberg? The cold plate the salad rested on was a nice touch though, nevertheless.

Pros:
 - Excellent flavors and commendable menu options.
 - Prime Rib options are worth looking into.
 - Luxury night of fancy food? Yes, this is where you wear your suit and tie and dress if you so wish!
 - Helpful and attentive wait staff. We were asked about our food by like 5 different employees.
 - Complimentary valet parking. Yes!

Cons:
 - That spinning salad just didnt cut it--it felt so underwhelming compared to the other food items! The "cheap"-ness stood out more than anything else.
 - Maybe it was just our table but it was kind of foamy/spongey under the table cloth. This thus made it hard to aerate my wine. Also seemed kind of cheap since normal tables never have this odd layer?
 - I tried some of my father's "medium-rare" steak and it really had a large portion of medium-well pieces. Meanwhile, mine was more rarer than medium-rare. I understand why it's difficult to get perfect searing and cook levels when you're carving it from a station--but I would have been a bit angrier if I was paying for a medium-rare and got something less than stellar! 

Horseradish hints:
 - They come in creamed (mild) and grated (much stronger) horseradish options. I ventured off and mixed both of them so I can get an in-between option since both were too polarized. It turned out perfect, just like I wanted it with just enough heat and mildness! Try it yourself on a separate plate and lather away!

In the end I have a hard time reconciling great flavors and options with the price paid. There is no doubt that Lawry's has quality and note-worthy prime rib options, so take no fear that those who love this cut of meat...will be granted satisfaction to their heart's desire. Cheers!

first time ever to try lawry's. too excited to try it, too eager to try it, too much expectations from them, and so impressed that everything turned out excellent! 

i had two days of prime rib from wynn and bellagio buffet before going to lawry's. it was kinda..too much..like beef overload. but that didn't stop me from going to lawry's for a third day of prime rib. wat a great decision, i would probably be crying and regretting it if i didn't. they do have the best prime rib ever! well..so far. 

service is also something to mention about, it's nearly all middle age women from hostess to servers. they make you feel special and taken care of. i rmbr our server was Miss Wilson, she was unbelievably friendly, and very talkative. at first we thought all those ladies were kinda scary because they are very dramatic/cartoon-like..or if you wanna call it "fake," that's fine. they reminded me of that fairy godmother of cinderella's, dunno why, they kinda look like her. but anyways, service was really good.

food wise, of cox the prime rib was super delicious. i think we got the lawry's cut and did a split plate (which they charge for an extra $15), but the portions are pretty big...then they split everything for you, the mash potato, salad, the two lobster tails that we ordered. i would say that everything was great, besides the mashed potato. i don't know why, it just had more than just butter and cream in it, it has another taste in it that i didn't like much. we also got the mushroom on sizzling plate as a side. it was good, but oily, fattening, high in cholesterol. o well, the meal was superb. kinda craving it now.

oh..n did i tell u, they also make the salad in front of you, it's called "spinning the salad in a ice-filled bowl," and they pour the dressing from sky high. kinda cute. dunno wat dressing it was but the salad was goood!

Such an amazing experience!! Ms. Asselta was so helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. She helped choose the best wine to complement my meal. And Michael the manager was terrific! I can't wait to return for date night! :)

My first Lawry's  experience and It totally impressed me. It is the best prime rib I've had yet. Perfectly seasoned and very juicy. My problem with prime rib, at most restaurants, is salty. If the meat is good on its own, you would not need much salt because it will overwhelm the real flavor of the meat. The meat here is flavorful on its own. Definitely the best cut and worth the money. The whole prime rib meal is around$50-$60. That includes the delicious salad and 2 sides. The corn is truly delicious. 
This place got my praise for service. I came around Christmas and they have caroling. They even came to our table and sang for us. From our waitress to the meat carver. All were very polite. 
My top prime rib destination!

Fantastic experience. Better than I remember the place. The prime rib was a perfect medium rare with amazing marbling. Sides and dessert were meh, but that's not why we go there. Service was good: a bit mechanical. I think they ought to re-consider the uniform for the waitresses.

Do you love steak without all the extravagance these days? 28 day dry-aged steak for $80+ and no sides included? You won't find that here. Forget the other fancy steakhouses in Vegas with a la carte $10 sides. Lawry's has an old-fashioned feel from the all-inclusive meal to the tableside prime rib carving. 

The menu is kept simple with different types of prime rib cuts, a ribeye steak (boneless and bone-in), and some seafood options as well as a beef Wellington. All the dinners include the famous original spinning bowl salad, which is also prepared tableside. The croutons are amazing. 

Since I've tried the different cuts of steak, I went with the beef Wellington. It was marvelously cooked - the tenderloin was juicy and tender. The shallot Beaujolais sauce was divine. If that wasn't enough, the scalloped potatoes and herb crusted tomato was sure to fill me up. I tried a bite of the Lawry cut prime rib, which was tender, but nowhere as good as the 24 oz. bone-in ribeye steak. The ribeye had so much more flavor and that wonderful sear. Don't forget the Yorkshire pudding, which adds on to the excessive amount of food. 

Lawry's has great service and is a classic institution for prime rib and steak!

We ran late to dinner, gave them a ring to let them know.  We got seated right away when we arrived!  Amazing service!  The prime rib was very good along with the creamed corn.  Great selection of wine and not overly priced.  Beware of the 'secret entrance' trying to get into the parking lot.

I can't say enough about the incredible service and simply amazing food!!!   What a treat to go to Lawry's.  The table side "show" of serving your food was great. Diego (our server) was the best we have ever had.  Thanks so much!!!!

We had our wedding dinner here at it was AMAZING!!!! The staff were incredible. The Chef came and introduced himself to the party. The party planner helped me for months. It was the best experience that I have ever had!!! Thank you all!!!!
Nice atmosphere, good appetizers and sides. Prime rib was ok. Gravy was salty. But the staff was fantastic and the desserts was on point t..

Juicy.  Meaty.  Like butta.

This place never disappoints.  From the formality, to the service, to the main event, everything just clicks.  The consistency is surprising for a Vegas joint.  

If you haven't been here, go.  Now.  It beats anything on the strip (including any and all buffets, which IMHO don't even come close).  And when you go to Lawry's, don't ask for chicken, don't ask for fish.  You're here for a reason: prime rib.  

The meat is just so succulent, tender and juicy that it's a straight up crime if you haven't experienced prime rib this good (or better...I do agree that the pomp and circumstance at House of Prime Rib raises the bar a notch).  I love that you can cut through your meat with a fork.  Like butta, baby.  

I am, however, anal retentive/obsessive compulsive and hate food mixing on my plate, so my only wish for Lawry's is to have all the sides served on a separate plate or bowl.  When you're eating food this well prepared, that's a trivial gripe.

Lawry's is my #1 favorite prime rib restaurant. I've been to Calvary's in Newport Beach, CA, The Summit in Fullerton, CA, and House of Prime Rib in SF and it's all very similar to Lawry's, but still not the same. Lawry's is hands down THE BEST! 

5 STARS FOR EVERYTHING: food, service, ambience, price, free valet, VIP system. Let's break it down, shall we? 

Food - I love their prime rib! It's so tender, juicy, and perfectly cooked every time. The portions are good and match with the affordable pricing. You always get the spinning bowl salad which is delicious, along with their Yorkshire pudding, and mashed potatoes & gravy. (Did you know they have garlic mashed potatoes now too? So good!!) This makes for a wonderfully complete meal and I always leave here feeling full and satisfied! Other favorites: 

* Sizzling Mushroom Appetizer - I don't even like mushrooms, but I grew to love them because of their sizzling mushroom appetizer. The first thing you smell is the yummcious buttery aroma, and the sizzling platter keeps your mushrooms hot & tasty! A must try, especially if you love mushrooms.

 * Lobster - No matter how full you'll think you'll be, you should definitely try/add a side of lobster tail (even to share between a few of you if you have to). Their lobster is so juicy and moist, and perfectly cooked. Served with lemon and drawn butter, I'm often amazed at how delicious it tastes! It's even better than most seafood restaurants I go to. 

* Creamed Corn - A side to your meal that can be added. It's my daughter's favorite!! I always ask for it to be served in a separate plate, so it's not soggy in my prime rib plate and is easier to share with others. 

* Prime Rib - There's no doubt the prime rib is amazing! I usually get the California cut, which is a perfect portion for me. But on days I'm feeling super hungry and ambitious, I'll get the Lawry's bone-in signature cut! Don't forget to try the Lawry's seasoned salt on your prime rib, a little sprinkle goes a long ways, but adds that nice flavor for those who like to eat more on the salty side like me! Also, on the salad, try sprinkling some "seasoned pepper" on there, it's delish! 

Service - Impeccable service every time! They are so consistent here...always polite, nice, and attentive. I love that all their servers know what they're doing and the hostess & staff always treat you like you're VIP. 

Ambience, Price, Valet, & VIP member - This is such a pretty and elegant restaurant! It looks like a restaurant you'd spend hundreds of $$$ in, but surprisingly, the food and prices are super affordable and reasonable. Plus, they offer free valet. If you are a VIP member like me, you can get points for every visit/dollar you spend. After a certain amount (250 pts?), you get a free $25 Gift Certificate towards your next meal which expires a year later. Eat good food and get free meals, how awesome is that? 

They sure know how to do it right here! Everything about this restaurant is classy from the look, feel, and quality of food & service. It's always a great dining experience!

As a Chicagoan who grew up eating at Lawry's the Vegas location does not disappoint! The service is 1st class, the food is absolutely delicious! The room has an old supper club elegance. The organization that I enjoy hosts their regular luncheons at Lawry's and I couldn't be happier!

Review is for Spring Restaurant Week 2012 menu:

*** 4.5 stars ***

This is truly a throwback to a bygone era.  Classy, old school, soft lighting, nice music quietly playing so you can have a conversation--you know--like the good old days.

Course 1:  The Original Spinning Bowl Salad--Crisp romaine and iceberg lettuce, baby spinach, shredded beets, chopped eggs and croutons, tossed with our exclusive Vintage Dressing (from the Lawry's menu.  The server wheels a cart with a stainless bowl of greens.  This bowl is in a second bowl that has ice to keep the greens chilled.  The server spins the bowl in the ice and lifts the Lawry's salad dressing high and pours it over the spinning bowl.  It's plated and served.  Very old school way of doing things but it's lots of fun.  

Course 2:  I chose the Lawry cut of prime rib--a 10 ounce slice of prime rib.  The other option was salmon but why the hell would I come to this restaurant to eat salmon?  The ribs are wheeled in a large covered cart to your table where the server asks you how you want the prime rib done and what sides you want.  I went with the standard mashed potatoes and creamed spinach.  While the chef was cutting the meat and putting the sides together, my server, Mrs. Bender (sort of like Charlotte Rae from "The Facts of Life" TV show) went off to the kitchen to get my Yorkshire pudding, something I haven't had in years.  The chef placed the meat on my table, and she used two forks to cut the pudding into four roughly equal pieces/.  She had already brought a mild and strong horseradish, so I was ready to dig in.  The meat was tender.  No steak knife is needed here and the potatoes and creamed spinach were top notch!

Course 3:  How can you get to dessert and not choose a chocolate bag.  Too bad it wasn't the size of a Macy's shopping bag but you can't have everything!  The menu describes the bag this way:  Filled with a double rich Belgium mousse, fresh assorted berries with a raspberry Chambord sauce, topped with mint and shaved chocolate.  The bag is a rectangular shaped piece of chocolate filled with the goodies described.  It was superb!

The whole experience was pleasant from being greeted at the door and the woman who verified my reservation.  I especially liked the sign telling men to take the damn hats off before entering the dining room.  It's a shame the sign has to be there, but I liked it!  Mrs. Bender was a gem.  She was like a little house mother with her cart, her spinning bowl, her orchestrating the various aspects so the cart got to me and the meat was what I wanted before she dashed to get the Yorkshire pudding.  Service was impeccable.  

Note:  The good old days weren't as good as we think they were.  We're just getting older and the past seems a gentler time.

Mmm, love me some prime rib. I was ecstatic when a friend suggested this place. Though it was off the strip and pricey, I was excited to try some of the world's famous prime rib ever. They also have a location in LA where I'm from but I've never had a chance to make it there. Anyways we arrived on time for our reservation but still had to wait like 20 minutes to be seated. Then when we arrived in the dining room, the place didn't look that full at all. What's up with that? Shouldn't they have prepared our table ahead of time? Anyways as far as prime rib, they have only 4 or 5 choices. And I already looked on the online menu and I know I wanted the Lawry's cut which is their most popular. It's 16 oz, I believe, and only like $4 more than the smaller 10 oz cut. Even if I didn't like prime rib or wasn't that hungry, the Asian in me would be like get the bigger cut because it's only $4 more and you get more bang for your buck. And each of the prime ribs entrees came with the spinning salad, mashed potatoes and Yorkshire pudding. Everything is served tableside. The spinning salad performance is cool. And I liked the dressing on the salad - it was a little bit tangy. But the salad itself is a bit overdressed - all the leaves were drenched in the dressing. Finally came the main event - the prime rib. The carver came over to our table to cut our meat right there. Oh and waitress serves all the ladies at the table first so guys don't get offended if they pass/ignore you at first.

I got my Lawry's cut medium rare and it was perfect. So pink with the tiniest bit of red/blood and with the bone still connected to it. When I bit into it - heaven, so tender it just melts in your mouth. The put the mashed potatoes on the plate and will ask you if you want any additional sides. Sneaky because on the menu, it says they are extra but they don't mention it when offering it to you so you may get tricked like the person next to me did. She ended up getting the creamed spinach, which was an extra $6. Then after everyone is served, our waitress cut up pieces of the Yorkshire pudding to put on our plates. For anyone who's never had the pudding, it's really like a piece of a roll. Not sure how else to describe it. I was kinda dumb in that I tried to eat the meat off the bone first in an attempt to save the more delicious part for last. But I was so full by the end of the meal that it hurt to try to finish the last few pieces. I ended up leaving a small piece on my plate at the end of the meal and I despise wasting food. But I really couldn't eat anymore. I wish I had enjoyed the piece of meat rather than what was on the bone. Oh well, I know for next time. Our waitress was cool, so happy, cheerful, polite and attentive. We also ended our meal with two birthday desserts. The brought out two mini strawberry shortcakes with candles. I love dessert and strawberries but only had like 2 bites. We all shared but I think we were so stuffed, that all 11 of us couldn't even finish two small desserts. So sad. Overall, it's a really nice place to celebrate special occasions, every once in awhile.

i like it b/c the guy comes around w/a cart and he asks you what cut you'd like!  prime rib.....creamed corn....creamed spinach...the bread of course!  that's the life!  this place is so grubbin...we went here w/our homies it was so good....got a little crazy...drank wine.....go wing drakonians!

We came about a month ago and the prime rib was melt in your mouth good. The everything had lots of flavor. But the second time I came it was like a different experience, the prime rib was tough and chewy. Nothing really tasted that great. Maybe they have a different chef. But not worth the gamble for the price.

The food and service, in my opinion, is 5 stars! I got the California cut prime rib medium rare with creamed spinach and mushrooms. The prime rib was incredible, most steak restaurants make me think I'd be happier eating at home but this was definitely an exception! The prime rib was perfect! I also had the Chopin dirty martini with prime rib, horseradish and blue cheese (b.c. On request) stuffed olives, $16 but worth it! It was strong but soooo smooth. 

I'm giving it 4 stars because I personally think the uniforms and ambiance make me feel like I'm in a geriatric ward nightmare but I guess some people like that. Oddly enough although the food and service was SO good... The ambiance is almost enough to question coming back. I will say it is place everyone should try at least once!

The name pretty much says it all.
Lawry's, THE Prime Rib.  

They say that when you're in Vegas you should do it big or don't do it at all.  With that in mind, some friends and I took birthday boy out for a little finer dining before hitting up the clubs.  And what is finer to a 6 foot something, 200 lb. guy than a rolling kitchen serving up large slabs of delicious meat?  With my handy yelp app I easily and efficiently looked up the restaurant, read some reviews, and booked our reservation in a matter of 3 minutes.  Woot to technology!  

When we got there, the valet and door person greeted us warmly.  The staff were all polite and our waiter was very personable.  He helped us pick out a bottle of wine and explained our menu options with smooth expertise.  I opted for the 6 oz. California cut Prime Rib, as I intended to save room for dessert and drinks later on in the evening. Birthday boy ordered the Diamond Jim Bradly cut.  A hefty 16 oz. and 2 inches thick!

The spinning bowl salad that comes with the entrees was a cute touch, although I think the dressing wasn't really my cup of tea.  The mashed potatoes and yorkshire pudding on the side were nice complements.  The pudding reminded me of a popover, airy and crispy on the outside.  We also had creamed spinach, asparagus, and the sizzling mushroom skillet, which was my favorite side.  All went well with the steak.  The steak...oh mylanta!  My prime rib was juicy and tender, melt in my mouth drool all over the table good.  I had the smallest cut out of everyone, but ate so slowly savoring every bite, that I finished last!  

We had mentioned that it was our friend's birthday earlier.  At the end of our meal the waiter brought out a slice of some kind of strawberry shortcake and we sang to him while he blew out his candle.  Having stuffed ourselves silly with meat, we opted to share the strawberry cake and save room for drinks.  Hey, what can I say...drinks trump dessert in Vegas!

Do it big!  ;)
Awesome dinner! Ive never been diappointed here. From our prime rib cooked to perfection to our delightful servers assistant Luis. It was a great way to celebrate our anniversary.

i kinda remember going to this place.

i kinda remember a bar off to the left or maybe right?

i kinda remember stumbling into a booth. 

i kinda remember some ladies in cute, old diner waitress outfit type dealio. 

i kinda remember the manager coming by asking us to tone it down and me saying fuck off before i gut you with this (prime rib knife in hand) and my dining companions having to apologize for me and saying hes just kidding hahaha funny guy. 

i kinda remember stealing the seasoned pepper, saying holy crap, this shit is good. they dont sell this shit in stores do they?

i kinda remember sprinkling that season pepper on a stripper later that night. 

this is vegas. im euge.  

god, when am i gonna grow up?

of the ten or so times ive been here, this specific time was probably the worst. was working on no sleep, and probably close to a bottle of grey when i arrived. i was not in good shape. 

ive actually been here sober once. no really. seriously. the food is pretty consistent. i cant really say i would personally make the resvy to come here, its always buddies that want to go. i dont mind the food, but its nothing to get all hot and bothered over. im a huge prime rib fan, but hopr in sf? bleh. broadway prime in burlingame... even more bleh..... lawrys in vegas is probably the best of the three. 

and yeah, dont bother asking, they wont sell you the outfit to give to you gf, ive asked, many times.... i did manage to get a singapore airlines flight attendant outfit... but thats a whole different story.

It was an okay experience. I think I just had my hopes up for a fancy holiday dinner.
The food is delicious, and so are the drinks.
Made reservations, and still had to wait a while to be seated.
We had a double date dinner for New Year's Eve.
My husband and I got our dinners first (it was the prime rib from the cart), and the other couples food came out so much later because they got grilled steak... we felt rude to eat without them. We waited for a while until they told us to just eat so our food was still hot. Wished the servers waited to give us our food until theirs was done, since it can be wheeled to our table.
My friend ordered a beer to go with his dinner, and he didn't receive it until he was done eating.
One of the best prime rib I've had. All 5 of us went there after a long day at the convention and we were all happy with our ca cut

First time here, tasty prime rib!
They served salad first, which was pretty bomb.
Then the carver came around with his cart, and asked what kinda cut (depends how many ounces you want) and how you wanted it cooked.
Some might think that it's pretty cool that you can see your own meat being cut. 
But for me, personally, I'd much rather not see my meat being cut in front of me. I'd rather see it brought out on a plate from the kitchen, and I'd like to be made to think that my piece of meat was thrown in to be cooked after my order was set in place. Maybe it's because the first thought that crossed my mind were the old days when I went to Hometown Buffet or something, where they sliced the roast beef/turkey for you. I don't know. The whole idea of having the carver going around with his cart full of meat cutting it for people kinda cheapened the experience for me. Call me snobby.
I got the Lawry cut at medium rare with corn and mashed potatoes&gravy. 
As soon as I took my first bite, my petty grievances went out the window. At steak houses I normally don't opt for the prime rib. But they do it right here; it's their thing!
I felt that our server wasn't too friendly at all. There was also a little mix up among the servers. Supposedly they wait til everyone finishes their salad before bringing the meat carver around. We wanted to keep our salads to eat with our steak and we told a server that 2 different times, but I guess that memo didn't get to our main server, so we kinda had to wait a little longer for the meat to come around to us. No biggy.
They also sang happy bday for me & provided a free cake which was yummy.
I'd love to come back here, but probably the one closer to home for me in LA.

If you enjoy prime rib, this is the place for you. I really didn't know what to expect but we wanted to eat somewhere nice away from the strip. 

We all know the name Lawry from spices and powder gravy. Lawry's have a long family history. It's interesting to read about them. 

I reserved through open table on their website which was painless. You can self park or do the complimentary valet. 

The restaurant is huge. You can have real big parties here. We were lucky and sat at big shell like booth where they pull the table out to sit. 

The servers here use their last name which I thought was formal and proper. This place is very classy and traditional in good way. 

If you order prime rib, the cutter and your server will come to you with the big silver wagon which by the way costs as much as your vehicle. 
The prime rib comes with mash potatoes, creamed corn and creamed spinach. You also get house salad made at your table. They bring you real hot horseradish and whipped horseradish. 

The neatest thing was four carol singers visited each table and sung holiday songs. What an experience!!! They sang so pretty. I will remember this night forever. The whole experience of good food and service was so nice!
Lawry's is one of my favorite places for either lunch or dinner. It's one of my go-to's for special occasions, or just to get a great prime rib dinner.

I am a little shocked at some of these reviews I am reading!!! I've heard about the famed Lawry's before but tonight I had my first pleasure of dining there! WOW!!!
Unreal, this place hits in all cylinders. The atmosphere, amazing! Real old school look with the wood and comfy couches. If you close your eyes. You could envision gentlemen walking in with their overcoats and fedora... 
The service, impeccable! Not a thing out of place not a step of service missed. Our waiter was friendly and most of all knowledgeable. He gave us a run down of everything we needed to know!
The food... the food, the food, the food!!! Now this is prime beef at its best! Prepared right and served, perfectly! Table side and cut to order! The spinning salad was made table side, the food was team served... everything was phenomenal!
I for one can not wait for my next trip to Vegas! Lawry's will definitely be on my go to list!

So, so, so good! Wow.. I didn't really know what to expect when I visited on 3/17/16 for dinner. Well, I read reviews but I just didn't expect to walk away so satisfied.

It is true that walking into this place is like stepping back in time. The staff wears outdated uniforms and the decor is old fashioned. It sounds tacky, but it's actually a really nice experience. Our waitress was super sweet and attentive.

They start you out with sourdough - warm and delicious, served with butter. We then had the prime rib dinner; I had the English Cut (three thinner slices - $42) and my boyfriend had the Lawry Cut (one large slice - $44). The prime rib comes with mashed potatoes and gravy, Yorkshire Pudding (an eggy bread), horseradish prepared 2 ways (regular and whipped), and a salad prepared table side by your server. The salad comes first and I thought it was okay. Their "Vintage Dressing" tastes like Thousand Island and it was my least liked part of the meal but I still thought it was a unique addition to the dinner experience. When you're done with your salad, the cart carrying the prime rib heads to your table. You tell the carver who is assisted by your server which cut you want and the doneness you prefer. I asked for medium-well and my boyfriend asked for medium rare. What I got was well done and what my boyfriend got was pretty close to what he wanted, though a little more on the rare side. But please note, still no complaints from us. It was DELICIOUS!!! We ate every last bite of prime rib and mashed potatoes on our plates. We weren't huge fans of the Yorkshire Pudding, which you are supposed to use to sop up all the juice on your plate. That's okay because I had no room for more bread after the prime rib. Oh - the best part of the meal for me - was the bearnaise! I know it's not traditional to order bearnaise with prime rib but I try this sauce everywhere I go. It's because no one knows how to make the perfect bearnaise. But Lawry's does! It has the bite that is missing in most bearnaises I've had. I ate it along with my prime rib and I recommend this combo :)

I also had a martini with olives that were stuffed with steak and potatoes. This was okay.. but I forgot to order it dirty, so I didn't enjoy it as much as I usually would. The stuffed olives weren't my favorite. My boyfriend had a regular Jack & Coke which he enjoyed.

One thing I didn't like is when the cart comes around, the server asks you "would you like creamed corn or creamed spinach?" not indicating that it isn't included in the price of the meal. They phrase this question in a way that makes it sound like you have a choice between those two sides. I find this deceiving way of upselling prevalent at fancy restaurants and I'm not a fan. I knew better because I had studied the menu beforehand. And thank goodness we didn't add a side, there is PLENTY of food included with the prime rib dinner.

All in all, what a great experience. It was expensive - $120 before tip - but I really enjoyed dinner as did my boyfriend. It's the best prime rib I've had anywhere. There's a 5th generation cattleman (or something like that) on here giving them a one star review. That is just terrible, this place does not deserve such a bad review. I'd like to know what place in town he goes to for prime rib because it must be amazing.

Give this place a try, we will definitely be back!

Ms Arias was amazing - our server.; amazing!

Prime Rib was amazing.

Spinach - surprisingly good.


Absolutely loved our time at Lawry's!

So, I guess if you eat at any place often enough, one of your visits will be the worst. This visit was that.

I'll preface it with this...the food was fine (as usual). My/our problem was primarily our server...Mr. Berber. Quite possibly one of the worst services I had in recent memory. A server can make or break a meal. Although Mr. Berber had good knowledge of the menu, his execution AS a waiter was the issue. Whilst taking order, he did the very least he could. I guess that fulfills the bare minimum to qualify as a waiter. I often find exceptional wait staff can make a meal amazing and tend to seek them out when I find them (looking at you Mrs. Seargent/Beverly Hills). 

So, probably my biggest pet peeve, is beverage service. Especially when you have an assistant, your drinks shouldn't ever hit the bottom of the glass. I only drink soda so I'll go through several in a meal. I had to ask each and every time for a refill and it felt like I was imposing on him for special treatment. To compound this, Mr. Berber DISAPPEARED FOR FIFTEEN MINUTES AT A TIME! (which probably explains why our dinner, that started at 7pm, ended at 10:30) Really!!! I observed that Mr. Berber had three tables, our table with nine people and two small tables with two people each. All within close proximity. How hard can this be. 

Other things I noticed...initially, Didn't clear the extra table setting, Nine people, one basket of bread. five minutes for water. Salad seemed...just OK. Dinner plate appeared sloppy. I dined at Lawry's five days prior and the plate looked magnificent and tonight's looked like a child plated it. Just seems like the attention to detail has declined at this location.

This is an annual tradition to attend this location this time of year for this group of people and most of them would just let this slide, but I feel if Lawry's cares about it's experience and how their customers perceive their service, then they should start to scrutinize their staff and their practices. Beverly Hills IS the standard and I expect to have that experience at EVERY Lawry's. I'm a platinum member and enjoy the Lawry's experience...just bummed about this one.

It's like you're stepping back in time, for better or worse.  The plus side is that the prime rib is very, very good and a throwback - not too many places serve it anymore with any level of success.  Lawry's hits a solid triple, though not in the home run status that is SF's House of Prime Rib.  Also scoring highly on the wayback meter is the Yorkshire pudding - I can't remember the last time I had a popover, but I will make sure I don't wait as long in the future for my next one!

Unfortunately, much else of what we ordered missed the mark.  In particular, the service.  Our waitress was a complete space shot, going off on random tangents about how she ended up in Vegas (unprompted), how she was spacy because she had allergies (one would think allergies would be low in a desert city...) and completely forgetting orders altogether.  She also failed to mention the size of the side orders - we had 12 people in our party and we ordered probably 8 sides, which was about 4 too many!  They are HUGE!  Not to mention your prime rib comes with plenty of mashed potatoes, corn, creamed spinach and peas, which, to my own fault, I did not notice when reading the menu.

For a place off the Strip, I feel like you need to really stand out to survive, and Lawry's was pretty forgettable.  Well, not quite - with the right service and perhaps some modernization of classic dishes, it could be a real destination.  Until that happens though, I'll stick to the slightly pricier but much more exciting cuisine on the Strip.

I have loved Lawry's ever since my first time in Beverly Hills. Luckily the one in Las Vegas is equally good.

I always order the California cut with a side of creamed corn. It comes with the spinning bowl salad, yorkshire pudding, and mashed potatoes with gravy. I wish I had enough stomach space to eat an appetizer. I love their salad and I normally don't think salad is that great. Both their creamed corn and their mushroom side dishes are delicious. 

Their service was very good and our waitress was very nice and attentive. She very patiently explained all the steps of our meal and what each item on the table was used for. She was very nice and helped us pick a wine to go with our meal. Their wine line is also very reasonably priced. 

The only reason why Lawry's gets four stars instead of five is because I wish they served their food on hot plates. My prime rib got cold after the first few bites because I was busy eating everything that came with my meal.

I've been wanting to come here for a while.  The Prime Rib is amazing. The service and ambience is meh.  Took forever to get drinks. Seems like it caters to foreigners or couponers .  For $50 a person I'd recommend many other places.

I have enjoyed Lawry's on several occasions and one thing people need to remember is they ain't changed anything since the 60's. It is what it is 
and it aint gonna change. You had better be ready for Prime Rib cause that's all it is. Damn it I like it.

This is our first visit. Great service from the manager, to our many servers, to our wine steward. It is this level of service that makes you feel special.
The meat was even better than reported by others. The veggies are sooo good.
Ms Pleasant made our meal even more special and enjoyable.
We will definitely be back on our next visit to Las Vegas.
PS,At the end of our meal the manager , Wendy  came by and introduced us to the best cheese cake on the west coast. Bammmm

The Prime Rib at Lawrys is to die for i suggest getting it medium well, the ambiance is peaceful and classy.  Go in with a big appetite, semi formal clothes, and at least 60$.  This Environment is upscale so you pay for the amazing food and atmosphere! I wish i had taken a picture to show my beautiful steak but it was appetizing.

We found this place on Yelp and had to try it.  We are visiting from Ohio and they don't have one there. They seated the 5 of us in a circular booth and pulled out the table so we could walk in and sit, so much easier than scooting in.  We were hoping they had a special going on where it included 2 prime ribs, a side and dessert but it wasn't available, everything was ala carte.  The server was very friendly. They came by with the prime rib cart and served it exactly to the temperature we wanted it. The prime rib was actually too big for the plate and then there was a side of mashed potatoes included. There was no room on the plate for the Yorkshire pudding. The prime rib was so tender. We were wondering why they didn't bring out steak knives but the butter knife was all that was needed.  We were celebrating a birthday and they brought out a berry bundt cake with a candle. It was a very nice dinner. The bill was a little pricey but well worth it. We even had a few bones to take home to the dog.

My husband ordered the prime rib it was flavorless and chewy, mashed potatoes tasted like instant or cafeteria style with a disgusting brown gravy. Have had better frozen creamed spinach. Bread was ok... 
Drink was light in the alcohol content. I had a ribeye that was also flavorless and chewy with a salad that was average (hard to mess up salad). You can find better instant augraten potatoes... Our bill was 150.00 not close to worth that price!! Save your money go to Outback! Or you will get your money's worth at Ruth's Chris.
Great food, but ambiance is like its stuck in a time warp.

Great food from a great name! I recommend it greatly! I LOVED the outfits that the wait staff used. It was very nice to see a steakhouse that doesn't have their women flaunting all their goods. It was family friendly and very tasty. I wish I lived in Vegas so that I could go back often!

So I made dinner reservations for 4 people at 7 P.M. for my dad's birthday. I kept seeing people come in and seated before us. It was already 7:20 and there was a big group and I told myself that if this group goes in before us, there is something wrong...and what do you know! The hostess called the big group before us! So I went to the receptionist that I talked to when I came in and she said that "someone" erased our dinner reservations and that she'll call the manger to fix it. So I told my dad and he was very upset. The manager came after a few minutes and showed us to our seat. He apologized and was very accommodating. Since we don't drink, he started us off with some appetizers. He comped two appetizers, the lobster bruschetta and the calamari. I would order the bruschetta again, it was delish! I would get the calamari also, but I don't like octopus that much. The food was amazing, which I already knew it would be; even the desserts! We were stuffed! It was not my first time to Lawry's; I've been to the one in Beverly Hills.
I was really impressed with the manager, Bruce! He was very nice and kind; though, I think the receptionist smile a lot more and more friendly to the costumers and admit your mistake. Because of Bruce, we had a pleasant AND delicious dinner!!

A Beverly Hills classic is also a Las Vegas classic.  

We were early for our reservation, unfortunately they were delayed and behind on the night.  It didn't look overly busy, so maybe they were done a server or two.  They quoted a 15 minute delay.  They welcomed us to the bar where the bartender was super friendly, casual, and gave us a bunch of complimentary house made chips.  The chips were good, light, cripsy, slighly oily, just the way I like um.  He asked to be a part of the picture while I was about to snap it and I obliged.

The 15 minute delay turned out to only be 10 minutes.  Once you enter, its as you expect of an old fashioned american steakhouse.  Slightly dim lights, staff welcoming, and stomach anticipation growling for the soon to be consumation of fine prime rib.

The waitresses are all dressed in old fashioned attire, keeping with the original tradition.  Our server Mrs. Amir was very knowledgeable, professional, and always asking if we were doing ok.  She asked if anyone was ordering anything other then Prime Rib and none of us raised our hands.  This mean she only needed to take drink/appetizer orders as the carving cart will come around with a live cow (ok maybe not live, but close to it) along with choice of sides when we were ready for our main entree.  

Prime Rib:  Diamond Jim Brady Cut was huge.  This was the bone in choice and I never had Bone-In Prime Rib before.  It was the "Best I Ever Had," like Drake says.  Too big though for even a caveman like me.  If you want the bone in, you will have to order this cut.  I recommend NOT eating anything for 5 days prior.  

Fried Artichoke:  Delicious.  Plump, thinly fried, and plentiful.  This was not on the normal menu and was a special. 

Spinning Salad:  Included.  The lettuce is meh, the quality does not match what I expect from this establishment, but all the goodies inside it including "Vintage" dressing made it good.

Creamed Spinach:  Another "Best I Ever Had" moment.  Not too creamy or pasty, nor too thick or dry.  Just a perfect consistency and a great surprise to the meal.

Sizzling Skillet of Mushrooms:  I think we got a lesser end on this one.  It did not come out sizzling as I swear I saw it come sizzling to another table.  It was still good, maybe a big gamey the more you ate it.  I wonder if it really is supposed to come out sizzling?


In summary, the whole package delivers as 4 Stars.  The price to value ratio is excellent.  Service, Quality of food, Atmosphere well done.

At Christmas, my boss took myself and coworkers for a christmas lunch at  Lawry's in Las Vegas. It was, without a doubt, the best prime rib I have ever enjoyed. The bad news is, I will never be satisfied with anything less. Since it was Christmas they had a group of carolers going from table to table taking requests!  it was awesome we had them sing the hippopotamus song and Dreidel Dreidel.   The establishment is decorated in classic Art Deco style, and the service is something straight out of the Gilded Age. We ordered appetizers; mine was the giant shrimp cocktail. Our waitress mixed the salad with a theatrical flourish right at the table. Then a waiter came to the table with a cart resembling a miniature 1930s Airstream trailer, which opened to reveal a huge roast, from which he carved servings of the requested degree of doneness. This was served with an exquisite Yorkshire pudding and, in my case, creamed spinach. Unfortunately, I didn't have room for dessert but I got some anyways...the Creme Brûlée, which was sublime.
The best prime rib I've ever had...

We came here for the Thanksgiving dinner... The customer service and food was delicious! I had the salmon with couscous and yams while my date had the turkey. The yams were SO good!! I was definitely pleased with Lawry and will hopefully be back.

Phenomenal! 

We had our wedding here, and the customer service is great. The Customer service relation, Michelle, She was very flexible. It was a dream wedding come true! And it was an affordable one as well. 

In terms of the food, we actually went back to dine for a second time. The rib eye steak is AWESOME and its lobster is OFF THE CHART!! Of course, i have heard so much about the prime rib during our wedding day from other guests. 

If you are looking for a special occasion in Vegas, don't forget about Lawry's!

Lawry's is an old school restaurant.  Proper attire and etiquette are still observed here.  This is all good and well, except that they also seem to hold onto the addage that kids should not be at the table.

I have come here before a couple of times, and have always enjoyed my food and the pomp and circumstance.  I had however, never brought a child with me.  Now that I have a grandson, we do take him everywhere and expose him to as much as we can.  (it's what I did with my kids too).  I really didn't think it was going to be an issue.  We made reservations early, we were there at opening.  The hostess was happy and very accommodating.  She asked if he was allowed to color, and I said yes, but he doesn't understand the concept of paper and would draw on your tablecloth.  She responded with that is quite alright.  We don't do the laundry ourselves, anyways.  I thought WOW, they are really accommodating.  

She brought my grandson, the crayons and the paper.  We had been introduced to our server, I believe a Mrs. Bender.  She was all business and IMMEDIATELY corrected my grandson for drawing on the tablecloth and took away his crayons.  With a tisk tisk.  Between her and another server, there was a lot of eye rolling going on.  They were not happy that a child was at THEIR table.  I was very offended by all this, but because we were someone else's guest and I didn't want to upset her, I stayed quiet.

Lawry's you get a ZERO for service this night.  You have no patience for your younger guests.  Your food was good, but with the competition you have in Vegas now, I won't be rushing to your doorstep anytime soon.

Food:
I had the prime rib here so I can't really speak for the other meats.  Personally, I am not a fan of prime rib but Lawry's may be the exception.  I really enjoyed the wine and my creamed corn was very good.  My favorite part of dinner was the yorkshire pudding though.  I don't know where else you can go to find yorkshire pudding so I might go back just for their yorkshire pudding lol (it was that good).  
Service:
I was very very amused that waitress communicated to the meat slicer for us even though he could obviously hear our orders.  The service is amazing though. Not one complaint.
Setting:
I loved how comfortable the booths were.  The bar is separated from the diners which I enjoyed as well.  The lighting was dim, so it was definitely could be a romantic setting.

Lawry's was good we had the lawrys cut prime rib it was delicious. I didn't care for the salad but I loved the Yorkshire pudding. The email came with mashed potatoes and sides were extra we had the calamari it was amazing totally recommend this for an appetizer. The servers were excellent our server was amazing and she dressed in an old fashioned serving uniform. Everyone was amazing. Great experience. I loved the 20s style of architecture it was so cool. Everything flowed. I do wish my hubby would have ordered from the Valentine menu you got a special gift but that's okay I loved spending time with my best friend.

Thought of taking a picture a little late so I've already dug in but wanted to get this pic posted as I didn't see any other pics of the Beef Wellington.  

It was delicious, appears a bit rare in the photo tho it's med rare, and was very filling.  I've been the Lawry's many many times but never tried this before. A nice change if your not feeling the prime rib...

It had been a while since I  dined at Lawry's Las Vegas, but I craved a spinning salad and a bone in piece of prime rib. I made reservations on open table literally 20 minutes prior to my reservation and had no problem getting in. 

Once greeted by the friendly staff we were escorted to a nice roomy corner booth with a view of the entire main dinning area. Our waitress has worked here for 11 years was friendly and funny. She took my drink order while we enjoyed the complimentary warm yummy bread. I placed an order of wild mushroom medley so the timing would coincide while Arturo carved  my request of the Lawry's bone in prime rib cut and plated my mixed cream corn &  spinach, mashed potatoes and Yorkshire pudding. The prime rib was delish, tender and flavorful - it was that moment I realized why I unconsciously wanted to dine here!  All the sides were perfect and the wild mushrooms were incredible. Unfortunately I was so full I  had to pass on dessert, so decided to walk over to Starbucks and had a nightcap Frappuccino.

I'll definitely return to Lawry's again for the traditional food, service and convenience.

We had dinner at Lawrys yesterday, for my birthday. It was just awesome. The presentation was wonderful, the ambiance and the decor was great. It was like going back in time.
They bring the prime rib in a cart to your table and slice it in front of you. It was great, very tender. All the food was good. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone. 
On a side note, I read some reviews about the waitresses uniforms.  They are part of the experience.  It's suppose to be retro.
Very happy customer. Service was great too!

Let's be clear from the get go, if you don't like or don't want Prime Rib, don't come here. If you do, this is the best in town. I love that Lawry's specializes in one thing and does it well.

The servers have an old school look and vibe but are friendly and offer a consistent experience.

I am a big eater and always load up on a beef bowl cut with creamed spinach and mashed. Of course there is always the spinning bowl salad and chilled fork, nice touch! Love the sourdough bread and Yorkshire pudding as well. The Prime Rib is excellent and the experience is fun to repeat over and over. 

Don't forget to join the loyalty program and get 10 or 20% back depending on dining day/time.

I know I rant and rave about this place but it is just so good. If you are with a group or a party if one, doesn't matter. You receive the great service either way. These are professional wait staff from the bar tenders to the table waiters. The food, obviously, is top notch! Somewhat off the strip (though very close) and it shows for how wonderful it is. 

One a side note, the bar is a great place to watch the hot basketball game or whatever you wish. I love it. The bar is killer. TVs  available for the loner sports fanatics. All food is available at the bar. Bruce and Cassandra are killer bartenders!

After a horrible last experience, the manager invited us back. My husband and i go there a lot and I'm glad to say they're back. Food was great and service was great!! And of course we're gonna go back yet again and again. We cannot resist their prime rib :)

It has been 35 plus years since my last experience at Lawry's. The service was as incredible as I remembered. We both got the signature Prime Rib. The California cut was perfect for me but my son got the  Diamond Jim Brady cut. Both roasted to perfection, medium rare. Salad as expected, mashed potatoes exceptional and what more can I say about the Yorkshire pudding except when can we return? Oh the calamari was perfectly done with two sauces. Do try the Cool as a Cucumber Martini made with Hendrix Gin. Without a doubt the best "flavored" martini I have ever had. We will be back for more incredible food and exceptional service.

Ok I have been here before and food was great, my review is based on today's visit! I honestly dont know where they went wrong, prime rib and all the accompaniments were only mediocre at best! And for the price 39$ for 10oz I felt ripped off! I wanted to steal the salt and pepper blends to at least make up for a rather lackluster meal, I really was looking forward to my trip there and was very disappointed, prime rib was tough and no flavor, creamed spinach was flavorless, and mashed potato was almost soup consistency ! For a place that specializes in spices everything left a lot to be desired! Service was prompt and friendly, but waitress got bogged down with a big party and left us wanting refills on drinks. I heard her ask for help , but her co-workers were too "busy" to provide any ( they actually were on the other side talking, c'mon teamwork people!!) we would have gotten at least another glass of wine, but dinner was almost done and at that point it wasn't really worth the effort, of tracking the server down, ( she was busy making salads for her party) she was very apologetic on her absence , but it made us feel bad for her, not really the atmosphere you want to have when dining out! Only good thing was salad and bread, 5 stars for those and about 2 1/2 for everything else!!

The Prime Rib is incredible and you will not regret anything you eat here.  

Do Not get the two boned steak.  HOLY CRAP.  I couldn't finish it and it wasn't even close.  That thing kicked my ass.

Stick with their specialty.  The Prime Rib

This is how a restaurant should be run. We had an amazing experience. Everyone was friendly and welcoming. When we sat down our waitress was Ms. Yost who we could tell was a little new but she spoke with confidence and seemed to enjoy her job because she smiled with every word. We ordered the Lawry cut which was an amazing piece of prime rib. Along with that we had creamed spinach, mashed potatoes (Which I'm glad they didn't try to reinvent), and creamed corn which was given to us complimentary after a slight mix-up with what we ordered. I usually don't order dessert but we did and were pleasantly with the bread pudding which was served with Vanilla ice cream while swimming in just enough butterscotch topping. We spoke with the manager of the restaurant and could tell why her employees seemed happy. She was down to Earth and seemed extremely proud of her restaurant which she should be. She mentioned a code of ethics that the restaurant lives by which I took a picture of. Amazing restaurant.  I wish Yelp allowed me to give 10 stars.

TL;DR The food is decent, but nothing outstanding compared to what's close by

First off, I have to remove my hat before entering the dining room? Sure, forgot it was 1956. Oh, look at how the wait staff is dressed... like they are in 1956 working on a plantation in the south. Next the hostess pulled the table out of the booth so we could get in.... pulled it ALL the way out. I guess if I was in my 70s with bad hips, that would be a blessing (though, they didn't pull it when I was leaving). There was a lot of dishes dropping during our dinner. At least 3 separate things within the first 15 minutes.

I had the prime rib lawreys cut. It was good, but nothing that stood out compared to prime rib at any other restaurant. The salad was pretty good. I think they deep fry their croutons.

The ambiance is pretty outdated. The service was decent. The food was good. Overall I probably wouldn't come back unless I was bringing my grandma for dinner.
The dinners was "okay" at best.   Go just for the dessert - Banana Cream Pie...yummy!

My dining experience with Lawry's The Prime Rib is part of a party hosted by my cousin. Our menu was a 6-course event with endless wine that flowed like water (crab cake and shrimp appetizers, salad, sorbet, cheese tray and truffle dessert) with the option to choose prime rib, salmon or lobster--my choice of course was prime rib! The dinner entree was served with Yorkshire pudding (which the server forgot to include but thankfully my niece gave me hers), mashed potatoes with gravy and choice of buttered peas, creamed spinach or creamed corn.

The appetizers, IMHO, was the highlight of the meal: the crab cake is perfectly made, lumpy with chunks of crab, flavorful and so delicious that I wished there were more. The shrimp cocktail, comprised of two oversized plump shrimps, was also excellent.

The prime rib was carved to order (directly from a rolling cart roaster), it is thick cut, juicy and heftily portioned at 16 oz. ('gads!). The steak was perfectly cooked, medium was my preferred choice, with just enough marbling. My only wish was that the meat should have been seasoned more (although Lawry's seasoned salt wasn't too far away to fix this), otherwise it was a good steak and ranks up there with the best.

The service is one of the best, only matched by the elegant art deco theme of the location. Overall, I would say Lawry's provided one of the best dining experiences, and being a local in Vegas, that says a lot.

Best. Prime. Rib. Ever! Period, hands down, no competition! Have been coming to Lawry's 30+ years ever since I was a little kid and it has always been an outstanding meal each and every time. There is literally no better place for prime rib, Lawry's wrote the book on this! The service is always spectacular, the atmosphere is nice, and the food (the most important part) is always exceptional. From the spinning salad to their amazing beef to all the wonderful sides, everything at Lawry's is always spectacular. I look forward to going there whenever I am in the area and I recommend it whole hardheartedly to everyone I know who is a fan of prime rib! It has been around this long for a reason, and they are the best when it comes to prime rib! Even the Las Vegas location is as good as the original location that started long ago in Los Angeles. Always nice to know it is an option when I'm in Vegas!

This place has the world's best Prime Rib! I've eaten there a few times, and it always gets better and better! It's pricey, but it's a place that everyone needs to eat at least once in their lifetime! Prime Rib, delicious!

Delicious and great service! 
Came here from a recommendation for a client dinner - everyone was impressed. Really fast service too!

I like eating affordable prime rib while being wine and dined like I'm the most important person there. Every server I get here always goes above and beyond. You can tell that they enjoy their job here and they're not forced to put on this act to just get tips. My favorite server here is Ms. Pleasant, and she's such a pleasure to have. 

My most recent visit was to celebrate my 1 year engagement with my fiance. I wish we could have put it off because we were both recovering from being sick and my taste buds were not cooperating with me. However, being a part of the Lawry's VIP diners club, I did not want to waste my free $50 voucher as it would expire the following day. 

So in the end, I had to confess to Ms. Pleasant that I didn't stop eating because I was full, but because I couldn't taste anything. She went out of her way to comp a couple of side dishes to bring home as well as a little anniversary cake...that my fiance could eat -_-. The food is always exceptional and the service always exceeds any expectations I have. I always want to try other steakhouses but I always find myself back here, especially around when Three Square hosts restaurant week.

Fabulously old-school experience, so much so that it's almost kinda creepy, like having dinner at someone you don't really know's grandma's house! 

This place has a super-solidly comforting appeal. Everything is solid, heavy, plush, SAFE. The waitresses are sweetly matronly, and the food is solid old-style comfort food. Prime rib, mashed potatoes...none o' that pretentious molecular gastronomy shit here! This is OLD SCHOOL FOOD.
