The ambiance is nice, but has the typical Vegas feel when it comes to how dressy you need to be...some people were definitely dressed well, while others were in jeans and tank tops...

The meal starts with the signature spinning salad...given the fact I abhor salads...this one was actually pretty tasty! Next the prime rib cart with the sides comes over and you can select how you prefer your cut of prime rib and the sides offered are fatty heaven as well.  We selected the creamed corn and creamed spinach.  The creamed corn was a little too sweet for my liking, but the creamed spinach was delicious with little pieces of bacon mixed in.  The meal also comes with mashed potatoes and yorkshire pudding (an eggy/bread mixture).  Portions are more than generous and you leave anticipating the food coma to hit!

Although I paid the pre-fixed price, perusing the menu....the prices on the normal menu seemed quite reasonable considering their large portion sizes!  Will definitely recommend this place to any friends looking for some good prime rib!

The service here is phenomenal! Our waiter Mike was awesome! The food wow! My husband and I will be back!!! Thank you for everything! 

Can't forget the valet parking thank you for your promptness!

**This is a review for their lunch menu**

I brought my boyfriend here for lunch when we were in Vegas. We came here for lunch because we found out via the website that they have a much cheaper lunch menu!

We ordered the prime rib lunch special (he got the Lawry's cut, I ordered the luncheon cut). It comes with the prime rib, mashed potatoes, a side, bread, and their whipped horseradish. The prime rib was still flavorful and whatnot. The mashed potatoes weren't up to par with the Beverly Hills location, which is a huge bummer for me, because I LOVE my potatoes. We both ordered the creamed corn on the side and we split an extra side of the creamed spinach (with bacon!). They were good too in terms of flavor.

The way it works though, is that instead of them taking the order and bringing the food to you, you go to the mini carvery corner and get the food yourself. The problem with that is that the meat sits out longer because the carver cuts them for people in line and so by the time you get the table it cools down a lot. Also, the creamed corn just sits in the heated pots (like how they serve soups at buffets), so it starts to separate, bunching up on top. The server mixes it together before he serves it, but if I'm paying a lot for food, I don't want that kind of quality.

I'm sure the dinner is much better, of course, but I didn't want to come to Lawry's for dinner in Las Vegas, when we have one in LA anyways. I'd rather go somewhere I can't find near home!

Best prime rib in Vegas. Period. Hell, best prime rib I've ever had in my life. And I lived in Chicago for 5 years and NYC for 3.5 years.

Menu should only be used for deciding what size of prime rib you're ordering. Don't waste your appetite on anything else. Trust.

Ridiculous Prime Rib cut right at your table, with delicious sides, a great beer selection, and top-shelf service.  This was my first visit, a meeting with some vendor folks, and I was blown away.  I definitely did not expect to like it as much as I did.

I had Mirror Pond Pale Ale, the Lawry's cut, medium, mashed potatoes and creamed corn.  We started with calamari, which was great.  Apparently they had sent back the first calamari, but I didn't notice as I was completely engrossed in conversation, so I'm not dropping from 5 stars.  I ate calamari from the second plate and it was fine.

I'm not huge on red meat, and I probably eat a steak or prime rib a MAXIMUM of a couple times a month.  I'm pretty happy my April binge was spent at Lawry's.  I will be going back.

Lawry's is hands-down the best place to get prime rib. They have carved-to-order Prime Rib roast beef from a large custom metal cart that they wheel to your table. All the cuts are good size-right California is the smallest but still huge to Beef Bowl Cut that should feed 6 but you see a few people tackle it.   

We always try to get there a bit early and have a drink in the bar to relax before dinner. They have a fully stocked bar with great drink specials. There is a Prime Time (Happy Hour) in the bar Monday through Friday from 4-6pm with half off bites and specialty drinks. My husband had a glass of Cabernet and I had Freixenet Cava. They bring around freshly fried potato chips that are amazing. They also have the 'bites' from $3 to $18 with two different sandwiches at $10 (a prime rib and a turkey); selected oysters are $3 each and lobster bruschetta tops out at $18. The wine
and cava were just $5 each-with a generous pour. This price is only for the bar so order another before you go to the dining room. The bar is so pleasant and the deals at Prime Time so good, it would be fun just to have dinner in the bar on the Prime Time Menu. 

Prime Rib dinners (and most other dinners) come with their signature spinning salad bowl prepared tableside by a server who spins a large metal bowl of greens on a bed of ice. The salad dressing, a "Vintage classic dressing with sherry wine", tastes to me like a cross between 1000 Island and French dressing. This year, we had the Blue Cheese Salad dressing instead. I never thought about it before but asked this year if they had others and they said yes! 

The Prime Rib dinners also come with wonderfully creamy mashed potatoes & gravy and Yorkshire Pudding (amazing either savory dipped in gravy or when drizzled with honey).

They also have fish and a vegetarian option. This year, I had the 3 lobster tails. They were small but had good flavor although the orzo was over cooked and the seasoning was so strong that it interfered with the taste of the lobster-it actually tasted like cloves. And I don't care for cloves. There are also lots of sides from creamed corn or spinach, crispy fried onions to scalloped potatoes. All great. 

We go to Lawry's to celebrate special occasions. This time it was my husband's birthday. We often go for our wedding anniversary because the ambiance is so special. They brought out a bundt pumpkin spice cake with whipped cream-so tasty! 

Lawry's is not cheap but you get a huge amazing meal that is so special that you will enjoy the memories all year.

Great Prime Rib in an old-school setting.

The place wasn't very crowded on the Tuesday night we went, and service was quick and attentive.  Server was dressed in a period-type costume/uniform (perhaps circa the 40's or 50's), and introduced herself and Ms. (Last Name).  Cute touch, but for some reason made me feel a little uncomfortable.  No matter, she delivered great service the rest of the evening, even graciously changed out my lady's cocktail when it wasn't what she thought it would taste like.

Spinning salad was good, and the sides of creamed corn and spinach were okay, but the star of the evening was the prime rib.  I had the regular Lawry's cut, but our carver nicely gave me the bone attached (I guess it had to go anyway on that particular slice - I'm not complaining).  I'll tell you that prime rib was amongst the best I've ever had.  Coupled with some great mashed potatoes and a nice ladle of jus, that was one good meal.

Oh, and our server told us that we could ask for more Yorkshire pudding, which was a nice tip.  However, why fill up on what was originally designed to stretch the meat in a poor English meal?  There's plenty of meat to go around!
The prime rib is outstanding. The price is high for the portion. The staff are very friendly and welcoming.
The service was great, the food was over the top one of the best places to have a Prime Rib. Went here with my babe and had a total blast. The only thing i dislike was no real privacy.

Here we are again in the City of Sin.  Decided we wanted prime rib so of course had to go to Lawry's.  Am sure my parents had taken me in Los Angeles when I was a kid, but who cares.

Arrived and we decided to get a drink.  Cute little bar with sports on.  Love Vegas for that fact.  Ordered a Bloody Mary and WOW I must say it was the worst one I had ever had.  I was thinking oh no we have made a grave mistake.  BTW 3 drinks cost more than a reasonable house pymt.

Dinner on the other hand was fantastic.  Our server Leslie was a huge treat.  Funny cute and very engaging.  She helped make the evening awesome.  Prime Rib was out of this world. 

Place is old school but you have to go.  Great food great service shitty bloody marys.  Oh well guess we cant have it all.

One of my new favorites!

Knowing nothing about Lawry's, but hungry for steak, I decided to give this place a try.  I didn't know it is a chain and not only that, and it was only until I sat at the table I figured that it is the same Lawry's as the bottles of meat seasoning at any supermarket.

The restaurant is very nice and is a throwback to Hollywood of the 1950's.  The staff and service are excellent and exudes gracious and grand service of the past.  I especially like the waitresses with their retro outfits and the nametags that addresses them as Miss something.

I love a good piece of cow, but I am not a huge eater, so I was a bit horrified to see cooks and waitors moving giant slabs of beef across the room.

I shared a shrimp cocktail (which was good but not great as I thought it a tad over cooked) and a calamari plate (good, but also a bit overcooked) as an appetizer.  When the restaurant has Prime Rib in it's name, you got to order it and I am glad I did, though next time I would probably try the rib-eye steak as it also looked good.

The spinning salad was a bit gimmicky, but it made for a great chilled salad with the dressing perfectly coated lightly in every bite.  The shredded beets was much appreciated in the salad. 

Not prepared to eat an obscene amount of beef I ordered the English cut which is three large slices cut extra thin, it was one of the smaller portions on the menu.  I had it rare and it was soooo good, it almost melted in my mouth.  It would be crime to order your prime rib any more than medium, the rarer the better.
The two types of horseraddish sauce served at the table were a nice touch.  The regular horseraddish sauce was wasabi-like strong and the creamed horseraddish sauce was very mild, almost buttery. 

The potatoes and gravy on the side were perfect, however the Yorkshire pudding was a bit disappointing.  I am a lover of Yorkshire pudding and only had it in the U.K. so I was expecting a light flaky individual portion of pastry bowl filled with gravy, but this was more bread-like and doughy in the middle and the portion was cut from a large bowl piece.  This must me the American version of it.

The final tab was very reasonable considering the amount of food and the quality of service provided.  My share of the tab was about $75 and that included two killer martinis which I requested with their excellent hand stuffed blue cheese olives.

Forget Ruth Chris' Steakhouse and Morton's, this is my new favorite steak restaurant.

Very good steak! It tasted like a regular steak with little seasoning. I don't like how they don't show the prices on the menu. In a nutshell I was asked to add cream corn to my dish as a side dish and after I got the over $100 dollar bill I looked to see the cream corn was $17 of it.  In my opinion it's way over priced.

Took my husband here back in 2006 for his birthday and thought I'd write a review on it.  When we went it was a very nice restaurant and kind of like Mortons' they have a waiter show you (tangibly) what your choices are.  Very good food, very good drinks and we had a blast getting tipsy and giggly at everyone.  Spent about $200 but that is very common sometimes it goes up a bit higher depending on what you want.  I like it WAY better than the LA restaurant.

The exquisite Tyler G. took me under her wing once again and we landed smack dab in tasty town. We called head and made reservations.  

Lawry's Prime Rib is some prime eating.  They bring the prime rib out on specially made 600 pound carts right to your table.  I ordered the California cut of prime rib and it was the perfect portion for me. I devoured their Yorkshire Pudding.  The pudding was delicious with a little prime rib juice on it.
 I usually only eat ranch dressing, but I figured if Tyler G. (my personal travel guide) said to try the spinning salad with the Lawry's Classic Vintage Salad Dressing I should give it a whirl.  It made my head spin it was so tasty and fresh.
We finished off our meal with a chocolate bag.  You might think you wouldn't have room for dessert after such a feast. That's why you should go with the chocolate bag.  It's light and fluffy and filled with Belgium Mousse.  It was the perfect dessert after my heavy feast.  
I really liked the decor at Lawry's it made me feel like I was dining in some old fancy restaurant.  We had really good service.

i love eating here. 
granted i can't afford to eat here on my own. but i still enjoyed it when i was with my parents. 

it's a course meal. the salad is YUMMY. the prime rib: amazing and the yorkshire bread was the first time i ever had it was awesome. 

my family and i used to eat here so often they gave us birthday rewards. and everytime we brought in a ticket [for each of our birthdays] they would send us a special lawry's seasoning salt with our name on it for free!
i think that's pretty awesome. 
!
that atmosphere is great. the food is great. i would recommend eating here
Prime rib its their specialty and they do out right. I try to go at least twice a year, and get the Diamond Jim Brady cut. The spinner salad that they are so proud of is just ok.

I can't believe the ratings this place gets.  I went with a group of 15 and we were all, uh, underwhelmed.  The veggies were "old people style" soggy, over cooked and over spiced.  The salad spinner was gimmicky.  The prime rib average at best.   I had the rib-eye cut, "Rare" (as did several at our table).  Came back nearly medium, as did the others.  The meat lacked significant crust, spice or smoke that makes a great prime rib.  If it had potential, i would have sent it back, but this was as good as this cut of meat would get.  Very lean actually, which is a sign of lower grade prime rib.  Service was great, friendly.  But for the price?  Never again.   I'll leave you with this - there are so many fine-dining establishments in Las Vegas these days.  Don't waste your time here.

Honestly nice restaurant but food was mediocre. I was expecting excellent! My husband had the Lawrys cut medium and he felt the cut was  small. I had the lobster tails and it was good but the size was small too for the price we paid. Overall, not sure if I would go back.

I'm not that much of a prime rib person although I appreciate it now and then if it's high quality.  But this was an absolutely grossly overpriced and overrated piece of garbage.  I prefer a good steak, but I went with the flow of the friends I was with, two of whom came from out of state and wanted to go here and I figured I may as well try the prime rib anyway since this place is so famous for it.

I can only speak for myself, but I was disappointed.  For over forty dollars I got the California cut and ordered the end cut because I like the spicy crustiness you get more of with that cut.  They didn't bother asking how I wanted it cooked and It was a thinly-sliced, skimpy, not very tender piece of meat swimming in a thin, non-homemade tasting gravy.  Overall it had OK flavor, but nothing special.  I've had much better elsewhere for a lot less money nor did I get much of that flavorful crusty quality.  Ditto on the mashed potatoes, a small portion which was rather thin and diluted-tasting and lacked that rich creaminess you would expect to get at a fine dining restaurant.  I can make those better in my sleep.  The spinning salad was OK, but kind of soggy and I thought the house dressing was a little too sweet.  The Yorkshire pudding was an interesting addition, I don't think I had ever had it before.  It was pretty good, kind of like beef flavored French toast, but still nothing great.  

The service was friendly and attentive although I think they took too long bringing out the prime rib and made too much of a production out of it which I wasn't impressed with.  The surroundings were plush, but really didn't do anything for me at the time.  Overall, I just felt forty+ dollars was an obscene amount of money to pay for what I got.  Honestly, imho, take away the fancy service and surroundings and this was a ten dollar meal, twelve tops, on any given night at a typical diner.  And that's it.

It's been a while since either of us have been to Lawry's, so my fiancé chose this for an early Valentine's Day dinner. I'm not really a fan of prime rib so I went with the Lawry's Ribeye Steak dinner. It was cooked to a nice medium and more than enough for me; Mel had to finish it for me.  I ordered the 14 oz. boneless meal that comes with the Famous Original Spinning Bowl Salad, scalloped potatoes, and crispy fried onions.  Between the bread and butter, the salad, and my drink (Pimm's Cup), I was too full for dessert.  Our server, Andrea, was very attentive throughout the meal and, overall, it was a very delicious meal to celebrate another year of love together ---ewwww, mushy!  The end.

The type of food is here is very hearty, heavy, Americana type food.  A little tacky for my tastes, but I understand they are just trying to set an ambiance.  You can order off the menu, which features steaks and seafood.  Otherwise, what people usually get, is a cut of prime rib.  We started with a house salad that they coin as a spinning salad or something.  The just make it table side with a heavy hand with dressing.  It's okay but it's pretty salty and not "light".  But that comes with the meal anyways.  The prime rib also includes mashed potatoes and you can add other sides like creamed spinach, buttered peas, or creamed corn for extra.  I tried the potatoes, spinach, and the creamed corn off of someone else's plate.  The creamed corn was just a lot of corn in a lot of cream.  It was okay but nothing to write home about.  Cream of spinach was heavy so I could only have a couple of bites, but it tasted alright.  Potatoes were good, all the sides were just run of the mill and rich.  The Prime rib was really tender and the au jus was really yummy.  My friend and I split the Lawry's bowl cut (the really large piece) and that worked well, with left overs to take home even.  They let you choose how you want the piece to be cooked and carve it at the table for you.  They also include a little bit of yorkshire pudding that is pretty good.  Just save room for it because they served it to us after we already ate half the meal.  I wish I was hungrier.  

But I would definitely go back for the prime rib.  So tender and tasty.  Everything else was pretty okay.
Lawry's is the bomb for lunch too!! Just went for the first time and  sandwiches are delicious!

Went to Lawry's recently for restaurant week and boy was it an experience! This was my first time there and the entire dinner was pleasant from start to finish. 

SERVICE
- Complimentary valet parking (they force you to valet), the guys are quick and courteous
- Reservations desk and hosts were very quick, friendly, and accommodating. We made reservations via OpenTable and had no trouble getting seated right on time.
- Our waitress was friendly, almost jovial, and thoroughly explained everything that arrived at our table. I just find it odd that the server uniforms look very similar to housekeeping, which I'm sure is to maintain the classic vibe. However, the hosts wore crisp black suits and looked much more modern. The clash of styles was interesting to see.

FOOD
- For restaurant week, we got the set dinner for $50.15. It came with the spinning salad, 6 oz. California cut prime rib with broiled lobster, mashed potatoes, and Yorkshire pudding; creme brulee, and choice of coffee or tea. We ordered a side of creamed corn as well. 
- The spinning salad had a creamy sauce that had a strong kick of mustard. The beets and extra crispy croutons made it for me. Otherwise, it's a pretty simple and gimmicky starter salad.
- The prime rib was carved right in front of us. I got a rare and it seemed a little more medium rare. I also ran out of au jus before the meat was done.
- The broiled lobster tail came with half a lemon and melted butter. It was a tad dry but well-seasoned.
- The mash with gravy was standard. The Yorkshire pudding was fairly plain but added a nice change of texture to the dish.
- There were two choices of horseradish included with the prime rib. There is straight horseradish, which is incredibly strong and heads straight for your nasal passage. Then there is a horseradish cream mixture that was too mild. I mixed the two and found it to be the perfect balance.
- The creamed corn was sweet and delicious.
- The creme brulee was pretty basic, as was the included coffee. To be honest, the meal was so heavy that I couldn't even get through half of the creme brulee.
- I just love Lawry's seasoning salt (for the prime rib) and pepper (for the salad). They really enhanced both respective dishes!

AMBIENCE
Entering Lawry's transported me to another time and place, where people swing-danced instead of twerk and cell phones were an afterthought of science fiction novels. It has a very classy feel. Everything is plush and comfortable and makes you feel high-class despite the "resort casual" dress code. I am under the impression that many customers come here for special occasions (we were asked if our dinner was a special occasion just about 6 times). I would say this makes a classy and lowkey romantic date spot. Who doesn't like delicious prime rib? 

I would not go here often as the price is a bit steep. But if I'm ever ballin' and craving prime rib, Lawry's is where you'll find me!

WE LOVE LAWRY'S!! 

The famous Lawry's spinning salad, Lawry's Cut of Prime Rib, (end cut, please), creamed spinach, mashed potatoes, Yorkshire pudding, and a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon. I think I'm in heaven!! Everything was delicious!!

We had reservations for 6 PM, and arrived 15 minutes early. We were seated shortly after. We had great service, and our carver, Juan, was excellent! We were there on a Tuesday night, so it wasn't very crowded, although I imagine on the weekend it can get very busy.

Yes, it is pricey, but maybe not so much for Vegas. Enjoy your evening here!!

Excellent food.  Different atmosphere for Vegas- very old school (wood paneling, leather booths, waitresses in uniforms).  A throwback, for sure.   The beef tank being wheeled around the dining room is an absolute riot.  I've never had better prime rib in my life.  It certainly wasn't cheap.  But worth the trip

We had a delicious lunch here the other day! 

The luncheon cut with all three sides : mashed potatoes, half creamed corn and half creamed spinach is perfect! More than enough food! To accompany my lunch I ordered a belvedere and cranberry redbull. It was yummmmyyyy. 

Service is friendly and more than enough parking. Great, close lunch place after landing at Signature private airport terminal.

Dined here with about 30 friends & family for my cousins bachelor party.  Damn! was this place memorable.  Service, presentation, atmosphere...the list goes on.  In short, if  you want to remember good food, service and more good food, dine here.

Great classic prime rib dinner. Amazing for holiday dinner parties as well.  Christmas carolers all December long & Murder Mystery Theater Dinners throughout they year. Occasionally a special wine tasting or event thrown in.  Always a great night out.

Oh Lawry's, how I miss thee!

After hearing about Lawry's for years on TV food specials, my husband and I finally had the opportunity to eat there during a recent trip to Las Vegas.  Simply put, it was the best prime rib we have ever had, and also one of the best dining experiences we ever had.

Service was fabulous, with incredibly attentive, accommodating and friendly staff.  We were given a large comfortable booth that gave us a clear view of the classy dining room.  

From the spinning salad, to the perfectly medium rare prime rib, to the complimentary dessert (it was our anniversary), the meal was absolutely superb.  Even though I was utterly stuffed, I wanted more.  The meat was so juicy and tender, accompanied by a generous portion of mashed potatoes and gravy and yorkshire pudding.  It was everything we had hoped it would be and more.

Whether for an intimate dinner for two or a special dinner with friends and family, Lawry's is a guaranteed perfect meal from start to finish.

I only wish Lawry's had a presence on the east coast!

Went there for my anniversary dinner. The staff were all very nice and helpful. We only waited about five minutes to get our table. The one thing i didnt care for was that the restaurant was a little dim. The spinning salad was cool and also was pretty good. I had the Lawrys cut and my wife had the smaller cut and we ordered cream corn and asparagus. My prime rib was awesome nice and tender. The creamed corn was also good. The asparagus was just plain but they serve it with a hollandaise sauce on the side so that makes up for it. I was able to finish everything on the table and at te end of our dinner they gave  us a free desert which was pretty cool. Overall i liked the service and the food and the price was not bad either.

This is fine dining at its best.  Its old school, where your server is called Mr. or Miss (last name), and when you are seated at the booth, they literally pull out the booth so you don't have to slide in... that's classy!

The server greets you with a smile, and  starts you off with warm sourdough bread, then prepares the famous "spinning bowl" salad tableside.  You are given a cold fork to eat your salad.  The famous prime rib is carved right at your table, and you get precisely the type of wellness you want in your meat.  

All meals comes with the salad, and the meat comes with whipped potatoes, Yorkshire pudding, and horseradish sauces (creamed and grated).  Side vegetables are extra, but so yummy!

We took advantage of the Travelzoo offer which was
- Salad
- California cut of prime rib (6 oz) plus a petite lobster tail (2 oz)
- Dessert
- Coffee or tea
for $49 a person, but we added a side of creamed corn each, so the bill came to $240 with tax/ tip.

The best parf of this visit was the Christmas Carolers were going from table to table singing carols.  The carolers sang 2 German Christmas tunes, and 1 caroler sat down next to Stephen's mom and they sang a mini duet.

Lawry's isn't cheap, but its not meant to me. You pay for the experience of being served.  From the time you sit down, you don't have to move except to eat.

If you love steak then this place is a must in vegas. For app we shared tomato and mozzarella which was good but not fresh made mozzarella as I was hoping for. Shrimp cocktail was good, hard to mess that up. The lobster bruschetta was good as well, a copious amount of lobster but did not overpower the tomatoes. I ordered the Diamond Brady thick cut medium rare. My mouth is watering just thinking about it now. It was cooked to perfection and was packed with flavor. I had creamed spinach which was good. The spinning salad was stellar. Whatever that dressing they put on it is heavenly. All in all this place was a great experience and the food was impressive. I will definitely be coming back here in the future.

So upon arriving 2/25 5:45 pm first impression girls at host desk, didn't acknowledge us at all at first. (Say hello) Not too friendly looked down and checked us in. Maybe it was a bad day, not too sure. We were looking forward to dinner and i was hoping this wouldn't set the tone for our night out. Luckily our dinner and dessert were delicious! Prime Rib, Lawry's cut and coconut banana cream cake yummm! Service was great once seated. Overall we had a nice time. Would recommend.

the prime rib.. what can i say about you... you are so sexy and juicy i just wanna put you in my mouth and chew you slowly, you are so tender and loaded with flavors that everytime i close my eyes, i wouldfall into an out of body experience... to top it off, are your sides of sexy smashy potatoes and cream corn... i think i cream corned my pants. Ive been here once and ill come back for you again....
Always fantastic prime rib. The cream corn is delicious. Overall a very good restaurant. The drinks are ridiculously overpriced though.

I am not sure why some bad reviews. 1st of all, the guy complaining about having to remove his hat, that is because this place is 100% class, and apparently you do not belong here. 

2nd, someone complained they didn't pull the table out for you when you left a booth. News flash, no one does. 

On to the review: a group of 6 went here for dinner, and all 6 of us agree, best meal we had in Vegas, and since we all come from different areas (NJ/MI/SC) we all agreed this is one of the best restaurants we all ever been to.

1st, the service is impeccable. Top notch. Made you feel at home. Wether you at the bar or dinner table. And yes, if you have a booth, they do pull the table out for you to help you get in. We did not get a booth since we had a large group, but watched it get done to others. 

The waiter came out, introduced himself, and described the special appetizers. We got the shrimp cocktail, lobster brusetta, and seafood dish that had shrimp, oyster, and snow crab. All delicious. 

He helped us with the menu. So many cuts of prime rib, certain sides are included, but you can order some others, like lobster tail, sauces, mushrooms etc. 

We all got prime rib, with lobster tails, mushrooms. 

Next the "spinning salad" salad with egg, croutons, and sliced beets, that they spin in a bowl, and add their house dressing... delicious.

When. It came time for the main course, the master Carver rolled out a cart, with the meats on it. You tell him what cut you wanted, and he slices it right there for you. Then he adds the mashed potatoes, and a choice of spinach, or creamed corn.

The creamed corn is not your canned mush. This was whole kernal, creamed corn in a thick sauce. Best I ever had. 

The prime rib, absolutely perfect. Out of the 6 of us, we all had different cuts and all loved everything we had. The portions were huge. 

In all, I wish we had one of these near us. I would definitely come back here next time we visit.

What can I say...it is what you can expect from Lawry's.  Good service and Great Steaks.  As always...we ordered tooooo much food, our eyes are always bigger than our tummy.  The Prime Rib was cooked to perfection and always great on taste.

9/29 - Backed for another business dinner.  Very consistence prime ribs, great service, and no complaints...starved all day because I knew I was coming here.

Had the Lawry's cut with spinach, mashed potatoes, lobster tail, and wine on the side. It was delicious! Heard that the LA location was better but this place did not disappoint at all. Would definitely like to come back again in the future.

Lawry's is a must go place when in Las Vegas, great cocktails made with premium spirits their bartenders now how to make good cocktails. I had prime rib and rib eye steak and both were delicious, the sizzling mushrooms are so yummy. Thier shrimp cocktail is really good with lots of horseradish. Defently a great and happy dining experience.

I'm finding that it's more difficult to review Lawry's Prime Rib than I thought it would be. It is definitely a worthy experience to be enjoyed. Therein lies the problem. The experience is more enjoyable than the food. The restaurant and lounge are lovely. The Art Deco inspired dining room and the uniformed servers are like stepping back in time to 1930's Hollywood. There is an aura of elegance and sophistication in the main dining room that rivals any gourmet restaurant on the strip. Friends and I have made Lawry's an annual holiday tradition. During the month of December, Olde English Carolers in Victorian costume perform table side on the weekends. It's an evening we all look forward to. However, the food really doesn't leave much of an impression. I echo other reviews here in that the prime rib is decent, but flavorless. The sides may be traditional but really  don't add anything to impress on the star of the meal. Recently I had the chance to dine at one the upscale restaurants at Disney's California Adventures. I immediately thought of Lawry's. The experiences are very similar: memorable surroundings; forgettable food.

I had the chance to try out Lawrys and it was a super experience. The prime rib, mashed potatoes, cream spinach, and sauté mushrooms were wonderfully tasty. Service was great. The spinning salad did not disappoint and dessert was amazing. I'll definitely return.

If you are looking for prime rib, this is the place. Meat is cooked to perfection. Spinning salad and side dishes are a nice addition to any meal. Service is exceptional, and expected when you dine in restaurants of this caliber. I highly recommend reservations.

Man, I would give this  Lawry's and the HOPR in SF two thumbs up.  The dinner starts with a great spinning salad.  I ordered the diamond cut and the prime rib was soooooooooo good, along with the traditional side dishes!   The service was exceptional too, for this was my 2nd time here and will be back whenever I come to Vegas.

This old world establishment is perfect for a hearty, wholesome meal.  The portions are generous and the wait-staff, accommodating.  Unfortunately, we were seated 10 minutes later than our reservation time (minus 1 star).  However, the food more than made up for this loss.  Prime rib was delectable and the English trifle, even better!

This restaurant is classic old-school Vegas to me. Valet your car and allow them to kindly greet you and hold the door open for you to enter. Once inside, you'll find a charming bar is quietly tucked to the side, away from the main dining area. 

The wait staff (last names only) are professionally dressed to serve you. There's a dimly lit ambiance with high back fabric booths and each guest is treated as if they were someone important. 

The spinning salad is MUST! And you would be silly to not order the prime rib. A cart rolls out while they carve your style meat right in front if you. Some delicious sides could include cream corn, cream spinach, mashed potatoes, bread pudding, you really can't go wrong... unless you're on a diet. 

Bon-a-petit!

This pace is so worth going to! A friend of ours took me here for my Birthday. It was a wonderful dining experience and the food was amazing. We really enjoyed our dinner. The server we had was attentive to everyone. I really have to say if you want a really good tasting prime rib you have to come here. We highly recommend this restaurant. Not far off the strip if you are here on vacation you can even walk.

This place is pure excellence!!  From the hostess that seated us to the person who boxed up our leftovers it was top of the line service and food.  It's a very high end, posh, elegant dining establishment. They bring the prime rib carving station right to the table.  The prime rib was very flavorful. The Beef Wellington was superb.  Mashed potatoes and gravy that I just could not stop eating. Asparagus with hollandaise sauce. And a skillet of mushroom. Everything was delicious.   Very pricey though but in my opinion worth it. They even have valet parking.   Loved it!!

Prime rib very good. Myself along with the rest of of our party thought the mashed potatoes were instant, they were very runny and i have made mashed potatoes alot and they sure came out better then the ones served here.we gave ate at the Lawry's in Los Angeles and it was alot better then this,#1 the cream corn was more plentiful in Los Angeles then the 9.00 scoup we got on our plate,
We had 5:00 reservations and got right in but in the Los Angeles store the waitress and waiters and cooks all line up and greeted all the guest at 5:00 when they opened but not so in vegas just ho hum. Service was real good meal was good
pretty solid lunch deals. prices are much cheaper than dinner and the portions are still very large.  will definitely go back to try the other things on the menu

My husband and I went here since we didn't get to go to their Chicago location back in December.  We were served by Ms. Guevara and she was nothing but charismatic and nice to us throughout the whole dinner service. 

I ordered the California cut of the prime rib with creamed spinach and creamed corn.  Next time, I'll just stick with the spinach but at least I tried both since it was my first time there.  The prime rib was the perfect blend of tenderness and taste. I also tried their mild horseradish and it was good!  (I usually hate that stuff). 

My husband ordered the bone-in rib eye medium-rare and it came out medium-well.  We told our waitress and they made a new one but when the new one came out, it was SUPER cold on the inside. Being afraid of dealing with the kitchen staff, we didn't say anything. Our waitress was apologetic the first time and we know it wasn't her fault as she did write down the correct temperature my husband wanted his meat. 

We had the chocolate cake and it was very rich!

Overall, they're known for their prime rib so just order that. Don't order any other meat.

Went here for my birthday dinner last year.  The food was great the spinning salad is delicious. I love the 1940s feel of the restaurant.  All the waiters are so friend.  We had the bone in prime rib with lobster, for the sides I had the cream of corn.  Food was delicious lobster was not dry.  They pudding bread is out of this world, dipping it with the sauce is so good.

Well worth the price! I go now everytime I'm in vegas!

After reviewing several wedding chapels in Las Vegas, we decided with Lawry's Prime Rib. Our Wedding Ceremony & Reception was amazing at this venue!  Through my entire planning process Michelle made herself available to assist.  Michelle and the rest of the staff at Lawry's have a passion for making each event a success.  They have wonderful customer service and above all they are very flexible.  Unlike several Vegas venues, Lawry's allows you to bring in your own wedding vendors & decorations.  

All of my guests were amazed how a restaurant could transform their main dining room into a fabulous wedding ceremony location.  The food was absolutely delicious. We had Prime Rib, Salmon and Chicken as featured entrees. All 3 entrees were perfect in which all of our guests gave rave reviews.  If you have it in your budget, get the prime rib carvers, they added a really nice presentation to the reception.  Lawry's is definitely one of the elite wedding venues in Las Vegas.  Thank you so much Lawry's & Michelle for a fabulous wedding experience. You made planning a wedding from a distance easy!

Mrs. Eulina Davis
Wedding 7/28/2012
Destination Wedding in Las Vegas

We're regulars here and love it.
Once you taste their Prime Rib,,, you'll never want any other..

Always check out the up-sell and side dishes
It's usually a really good deal and worth considering.
All the veggies are amazing.

Outstanding place for a date.
Girls love the starch uniforms and old school tart makeup on the servers.
Dinner there last Friday. Second time. Excellent. Prime rib melts in your mouth. Service is great. Spinning salad, calamari, all very delicious. The experience was wonderful.

Whenever we are in Vegas, we always make time to have lunch at this institution.  We always get the same thing, turkey sandwich and the Lawrys cut.  The prime rib is perfectly cooked and consistent.  Cut fresh from the rack, Manuel, does not disappoint in his plating and service.  The turkey sandwich is real off the bone turkey, which is something that is hard to find.  If you can somehow save room for dessert, get the sticky toffee pudding.  A little tip, asked for it to be split and served on two plates.  That way, you get a scoop of ice cream for each plate!!!

I brought my girlfriend here on the recommendation of my parents. This place is magnificent. Everyone was very friendly and we were treated very well. The food was amazing! I had prime rib and my girlfriend had Lobster. The prices are a little high, but I feel that you get what you pay for with this restaurant. I will definitely be coming back and bringing my parents as a thank you.

It was our first time here and our waitress was Miss Fraley!  She made our experience so wonderful that every time we come back to Vegas, we are definitely making a stop here. She kindly explained everything to us and helped us pick an epic meal.

We had the Calarmari to start with a bottle of Pinot noir and a glass of the local Vegas stout to start.  I don't know what was in that calamari dip but it's my new favorite calamari dip!  Also, since it was our first time here, we had the spinning salad and loved it!  Thousand island is my least favorite dressing..but somehow this was super tasty?! Dinner seriously only got better from here.

We had the Lawry cut and added the 9oz lobster, scalloped potatoes, and creamed spinach.  Oh my gosh, ORDER THE LOBSTER. Don't get the two little ones, go for the big fatty.  It was SO GOOD.  Trust me, it's worth it! 

The chef comes by to slice your prime rib fresh from this prime rib station they bring around.  The chef was so sweet and was talking to my boyfriend about football.  This place really knows how to hire really cool people!

I definitely understand why everyone from Hawaii comes here.  Yeah it's a little cheesy, but they treat you like family and the food is fantastic.  I'm always making a stop here when I come to Vegas now, I'm just sad I didn't know about this place sooner

Taste: 2.5
Creativity/Authenticity: 3.5
Atmosphere: 3.5
Service: 4
Bang for your buck: 2.5

Where do i begin, when in vegas prime rib is a must and well researching around lawrys always came up first... why?! came here with my gf to try "the best prime rib" in vegas NO WAY!!!! got the calamari and caprise salad to start, the calamari well how should i put this, frozen in a bag dropped in the deep fryer SUPER CHEWY; the caprise salad was fine i mean you cant screw up sliced tomatoes Mozzarella cheese and basil. Now to the main course... we both ordered the lawry special cut and let me state we came early so the meat had just been prepared we were 2 of 5 people in the restaurant and if you've never been to lawrys they have roll carts with a carving station where the cook with literally carve your prime rib at your table and well my meat was overcooked and that made it very chewy and un edible and for $44 dollars not worth it at all! got mashed potatoes for a side dish might as well been straight powdered potatoes cause thats what it tasted like and the consistency was horrible! The only reason why this place even got 2 stars is the service, our waitress in training so we got 2 of them, I love the fact that they pride themselves in service but it gets bad sometimes where you cant even enjoy a meal without someone consistently coming to your table "hows you meal sir" uhh i have'nt even cut my prime rib yet jeeze but ill still give it to them because good service is better than bad service. Overall don't think ill be going back to lawrys anytime soon so back to my quest to finding the best prime rib in vegas!

Went here with friends in November.  The main reason for the three stars is the staff.  We had Ms. O'Reilly for a waitress and she was as professional and knowledgeable as she was beautiful and charming.  We all agreed, especially me, if we returned we would want her as our server again.
The lack of stars comes from a pet peeve of mine.  It is the lack of enforcement of any sort of dress codes in Vegas fine dining establishments.  Lawry's puts great emphasis that hats are not allowed in the dining room, but yet people are dressed in jeans and t-shirts.  Maybe I am a little old school, but I believe that there is a certain level dress that should be expected and enforced at some establishments.

What a fabulous restaurant. For such simple food, they make it amazingly well. Everything is succulent and bursting in flavor. It's by far the best prime rib I've ever had, with almost no fat, and even the side dishes were delicious. The service was top notch and the booth we sat in was very luxurious. I loved the dim ambiance and overall layout of the restaurant. I highly recommend eating here when you're in Vegas.

I am in awe at how delicious this place was! Came here for our 5 yr anniversary and it was phenomenal! Fernando the manager was super kind and accomadating, and the host miss Sammons was the best!!! We ordered some drinks wife got wine, I got be my honey since it's Jack Daniels Tennessee honey, and it was delicious! I mostly drunk beer and this is my first drink out of a martini glass, and I didn't care because of how delicious it was. We were brought bread before dinner, and miss Sammons  was extremely professional and amazing at explaining the process of everything. She made us spinning salads tableside, then came the prime rib! My wife got a lobster tail also that she was raving about. The prime rib is also cut table side with mashed potatoes and I added creamed corn and omg glad I did. My mouth was having organisms because of the amazing flavors of everything!!! Then they hit you with some bread for dipping into au jus. Lastly they brought us a amazing key lime bunt cake that was perfectly sweet and soft. I wanted to buy another to take home it was so good! There is not enough good things to say about this restaurant and it's staff!!! Thank you nandoand miss Sammons for making our 5 yr anniversary dinner so memorable.

Growing up in SoCal, I have always heard of Lawry's Prime Rib but never had the chance to try it out until restaurant week here in Vegas. During my undergrad years we toured the restaurant as part of one of my classes, so I had a good feel for what to expect when that time came I would actually partake and order some food. And let me tell you, the prime rib here is not only amazing, but huge! None of the meats are precut of course, and are not even cut in the kitcken in the back. The prime rib is cut right there in front of your eyes and onto a large plate where they also ask what kind of sides you want to accompany it as well. Man... is it good. 

Between the service, the food and the atmosphere, this is one of the few places in life that did not disappoint after all these years of waiting.
This is possible the best prime rib steak house in Las Vegas, I have never had a less than amazing dinner experience at Lawry's, from the quality of the food to their great service.

Lawry's is unique & delicious.  Known for their prime rib, we always try to seek them out when we are in one of the few locations they are.  Their meals are quite expensive but the service, the spinning salad bowl, bread & entrees are quite worth it.  Even without drinks you won't get out of there for under $100 for two but if you want to splurge, this is a delicious experience you won't want to miss.

Really disappointed! I'd been to Lawry's at their old location in Los Angeles, and loved it. Our friend crows about the BH's location. So, while in Vegas for a  trade show, I thought this might be the place to 'WOW' our customers and management team.

The service was decent but very robotic. The food was marginal to ok, but, was not very warm, and the cost didn't come close to the experience.

Not very impressed!
Honestly, probably the best steak I've ever eaten. I've been here three times and the food is always exceptional. Pricey but worth every penny.

I was invited to Lawry's The Prime Rib to celebrate a friend's birthday! This is a family tradition for him- and this was my first experience at Lawry's.... which I enjoyed!

The restaurant has an old school vibe- where the server is called Mr or Miss and their last name.... the server greets you with a smile and very friendly demeanor, and  starts you off with warm sourdough bread, then prepares the famous "spinning bowl" salad table-side. The server then returns with the carver who cuts the meat table side, and you can choose which sides to accompany your prime rib. I had the Lawry's cut with potatoes, and the creamed corn- I then had the creme brulee for dessert! I was pleased with my choices!  

The meal was very good and I enjoyed the experience!

Oh, man. Large hunks of meat served table-side. Is there anything more beautiful than that? Nah.

Came here in a party of 12 to kick off a bachelor party weekend. A bunch of dudes sitting around the table drinking whiskey and eating prime rib sounds like a pretty good way to start. We had two servers who were very good with their recommendations and explaining what all the options were. Earlier in the year, I had been to House of Prime Rib in SF, and I felt like Lawry's was incredibly similar in its degree of service and traditions. Gotta love it.

Pretty much all of us went for the prime rib dinner with Yorkshire pudding, creamed spinach and mashed potatoes, with the spinning bowl salad. I went with the Diamond Jim Brady cut, which was the largest, duh. There seems to be a lot of pomp and circumstance with all of the courses and how everything is served, but when it comes down to it, the food all just tastes really good, which is likely why it's so popular. The prime rib is cooked perfectly, the creamed spinach is delicious, and the Yorkshire pudding is unbelievably rich and comforting. We skipped dessert, but the desserts did look good, spying the neighboring tables.

Service was pretty attentive throughout the meal, and our servers managed to keep up with our copious drink order, which was very impressive. Prices were fairly reasonable for a steakhouse near the Strip, and it came out to about $75 a person, with a few drinks on each person's tab. Not too shabby.

An excellent choice for reasonably priced meats, especially amongst all the high-priced steakhouses on the Strip. Seems like I'll be in Vegas for a few bachelor parties in the future, so I'll be more than likely to recommend Lawry's.

Lawry's was pretty much the default restaurant option for almost all my friend's bachelor party weekends in Vegas.  But since most are now married, I haven't been back to dine here in a few years. Then I got a call from my friend who was visiting Vegas with his wife, and he wanted prime rib for dinner and asking for recommendations, and eventually we found our way here last night.

The parking lot was nearly empty when we arrived at around 5:30pm, but that is hardly an indication of the restaurant's popularity, as a large portion of the restaurant's guests arrive via taxi.

After a promise of being seated within 15 minutes, we were lead to a booth table in one of the side rooms (near the entrance to the kitchen) in about 5 minutes.  In the past I am used to being seated with at least 20-30 guys in a long line of tables, but I was pleasantly surprised by the table being pulled out for ease of seating.  If they only do that when we are ready to leave, after a big hearty meal.

Anyway, the quality and taste of the prime rib at Lawry's is still what I remembered.  My favorite part of the meal is still the "Original Bowl of Spinning Salad" that they served (part of the prime rib dinners and seafood entrees), in fact I will eat just that if it is AYCE.  That said, the Lawry's Cut prime rib that I ordered was tasty and juicy, and good for the price charged for such a popular dining spot.

The service is very professional and friendly. And if you are looking for something that is other than the myriad of AYCE/Buffet options here in Las Vegas, consider giving Lawry's a try.  It is not too far from the Strip, and all the cabbies know where it is located.  However, I am not sure about their vegetarian options (except as side items to the entree: Fresh Asparagus, Sizzling Skillet of Mushrooms, Creamed Spinach, Creamed Corn, and Buttered Peas and Lawry's Baked Idaho Potato - if you hold the bacon) , as the menu is mostly about their prime rib, or alternatives that include lobster, rib eye steak, or fresh fish.

Also they have a courtesy phone for calling any local Las vegas numbers (located right outside the restroom), which I thought is nice, but with just about everyone having a cell phone nowadays, I doubt it gets used much.  But I supposed it can come in handy if you want to play a prank on your friends or frienemy, and willing to make the effort to make that drive out to the restaurant.

Oh yeah, my friends ordered some drinks while we were waiting, and he said the bartender there makes really good bloody mary.

And if you don't live near a Lawry's and want to satisfy your craving for Lawry's food, they have posted the recipes for you to try and make it at home.  http://www.lawrysonline.com/theprimerib_lasvegas_recipes.asp

4 stars.

I have been here a million times.   Everytime the food and the service is perfect.   I was going to Gordon Ramsey Steakhouse yesterday and couldn't get a reservation so I figured I midas well go to an old favorite... the bill was $148.00  for the two of us and we both added lobster to the bill it was fantastic! There was so much food we left half of it there.  I love this place.

Saturday, 3-12-16, Birthday Celebration

Excellent, excellent, excellent. The bar, bartenders, servers, staff and management excellent. 

Food is great and the home style conversation with complete strangers (until that night) is awesome.

Franks' Sticky Toffee Pudding (STP) (its actually Lawry's STP, but I received such high praises to try it from Frank, I name it Frank's) I think there is a rap song for this named desert pending...

Definitely one place that is in my top 2 of for prime rib and restaurant to visit in Las Vegas.

My favorite restaurant in vegas. The quality is fantastic, service is always excellent, and the overall experience is definitely 5 stars. Each time i come here i always get the lawry's cut (or the beef bowl)mashed potatoes, salad, the creamed corn, and sometimes the baked potato. And my desert of choice is the hot fudge sundae. I love this place!
Best prime rib and lobster I have ever had! Excellent customer service. I will definitely coming back .

Came here for my boyfriend's birthday on May 19. Everything was phenomenal. Although I do think their cuts of meat were bigger than they said. I ordered The California cut and I feel like I got triple the amount. Not necessarily a bad thing but I would've ordered smaller. I had reservations for 10 and a cake that I brought in. They took the cake for me cut etc.  
The room seemed a little bright for dinner. 
The salad with the Lawrey's pepper on it was amazing.
Staff was great. Food was great. I would recommend it.

This restaurant has absolutely the BEST prime rib I have ever tasted! It is a must for any prime rib lover.
The restaurant is dimly lit for ambience but beautifully decorated and a very romantic place to have dinner or a very upscale place to have a business dinner.
The waitresses dress in vintage serving attire (such as a servant of the rich would wear, complete with white caps, cuffs, and aprons.
With your meal, you are first served the spinning salad bowl which the waitress brings, adds the dressing and seasonings to, and spins in front of you, then serves.
The prime rib main course is served by a chef/carver (complete with vintage chef's attire including the tall cap) who arrives pulling a huge silver cart and cuts your meat in front of you, then serves it. 
Along with your meal you get Yorkshire Pudding (which is to die for) and choices of Lawry's own seasonings.
If you have room for dessert after all that, you have a choice of many great items such as the chocolate souffle. We went there on Valentine's Day and received jars of chocolate topping to take home.
We also joined the Lawry's club and get gift certificates regularly in the mail.
This is such a superb place to have a fancy dinner.
The atmosphere feels like old Vegas back in the mob days. Very cool  atmosphere and great food.
